Gvl49EGuA0JByGpLNgpndQ.text: Love this place!  Service is amazing.  You feel so welcomed at the Four Seasons and at this restaurant.  Food is superior than most of the food on the strip.  It is a quiet restaurant away from the flashing lights and constant dinging of the casino.  If you want a quiet delicious meal, this is the place to go.  Their breakfast buffet is amazing.  Fresh pastries, fresh fruit, delicious meats and much, much more.

vfFnNup3KItdwHGMxXsl9w.text: We came here for brunch because it was convenient since we were staying at Mandalay Bay.  Verandah is located inside Four Seasons hotel and I must say I was definitely more impressed by the Four Seasons Hotel than this restaurant.  The service was a little slow and the waitress wasn't too friendly.  The food was good, but definitely well overpriced and nothing too special.  They had a limited selection of dishes for brunch and I kept reading about these delicious pancakes they make, but didn't see it on their menu.  I ended up ordering their organic roasted chicken with mushroom polenta cake (This was the tastiest item) grilled asparagus and tomato and tarragon broth.  The organic roasted chicken was good but only the dark meat as the white meat was well...dry.  My husband ordered their V Burger which is an 8oz. Black Angus Burger, Fried Egg, Caramelized Onion, Smoked Mozzarella, Apple Wood Smoked Bacon, Roasted Poblano Aioli, with Salt and Pepper waffle Fries.  Let's just say he very much liked the burger he ordered at The Burger Bar more.    Overall, the food was good, but not anything spectacular and certainly not worth it for the cost.

J5bcYWmtyyKwyr-9yLiPCg.text: 1st of all I luv a good Italian restaurant tht says yes I will make you anything that isnt on the menu! Amazzing! We sat outside enjoyed the breeze vino & wonderful food!

HD4UB1NYFpx2oYZdgyc4cg.text: Excellent service and excellent food! Definitely returning soon! I had a caprese salad (the best I've ever had) The homemade pasta was cooked to perfection. They were also extremely accommodating for food allergies.

FCXBwWmrv5r5zysmUlUY_w.text: Very disappointing. Went there for a late breakfast (11 am), paid 100$ for 3 people. Rushed, unfriendly service. Tasteless toasts straight from the supermarket. Butter had a weird, cheesy taste. Omelet was just ok. The Verandah gets one star for its nice outside terrace and one star for the mini Belgian waffles, the only dish we had that was above average.

dlnEJpKAaZbmXYZwhsxEtA.text: Was so excited to get back and try Sunday brunch again after the remodel. Picked up a friend from the airport & headed straight for brunch. Like a fool I bragged about how wonder the brunch would be & worth the steep price tag. We had just been seated & grabbed out first treats to enjoy ONLY to be told the brunch would close in 15 minutes & we needed to grab what we wanted immediately. Say WHAT? What didn't the 3 hostesses tell us that when we wee seated? I have never been so disappointed! What a rip off & not what I expected for a top end hotel.  I will never go back & will need to find a replacement for that special donut station they had.

Ft7k1BcYiUjKXhQ7E4K8Ag.text: The Verandah is Four Season's version of a hotel cafe. It serves breakfast, lunch and dinner daily. I've eaten there for breakfast. The breakfast menu offers simple American favorites - pancakes, French toast, waffles, hash - plus a couple of ethnic dishes, such as huevos rancheros. Lunch gets a little more ambitious, and at dinner time the menu switches to an Italian theme.  **The Atmosphere Colors are mostly a range of browns, with lots of wood. Seating is available both indoors and outdoors; while I sat indoors, outdoor seating looked very nice. Overall, the atmosphere was pleasant and relaxed.  Service was friendly and efficient. I can't describe this very well, but I had a good feeling about the restaurant. Everything just worked smoothly.  **The Meal I chose an often recommend dish: corned beef and pastrami hash, two eggs, and crisp potatoes. It started out with a layer of finely shredded potatoes - actually more like thin spaghetti than shreds - fried crisp. Next, a thick layer of hash. Lastly, two eggs, any style; I chose scrambled.  The hash consisted of a thick layer of finely minced corned beef and pastrami. It was delicious; somehow I managed to finish the gargantuan portion. The crunchy potatoes shreds were an excellent foil to the smooth hash, although they were a challenge to get onto my fork. The only disappointing item was the eggs. They were overly firm and lacking in character. However, that's a minor quibble. I would recommend this dish to anyone.  I also ordered a latte. It came with a small biscuit that was a cross between pistachio biscotti and shortbread. Slightly sweet, it was a good foil to the coffee.  **Summary After only one meal, I'm ready to place The Verandah on my list of top breakfast spots. Its menu doesn't appeal to me as much as that at my top choice - Bouchon - and the overall feel of the place also isn't quite as inviting, but the combination of excellent food, good service, and pleasing atmosphere make it a winner.  **The Bill The meal was $21, plus tax and tip.

PlBzQw0rUqV8iZUSJz2flQ.text: Have eaten here many times when in town.  Breakfast is always great here. We like the outdoor seating when weather permits.   At dinner, Chef Antonio features regional 3 course prix fixe specials from his native Italy. Ingredients are the highest and freshest quality, and there is a choice of two for each course. The latest visit was Liguria, featuring basil, Genoa salami. fresh peaches, balsamic vinegar. We tried both of each course, for optimal variety. Although portions appeared on the small side, this perception was deceptive. Each bite was a powerhouse of flavors, we were quite satisfied. We never had to leave the hotel for meals, a reflection of quality in this competitive restaurant town, rather than convenience or laziness.  The kids that I've witnessed have always been well-behaved, probably experienced and comfortable in the atmosphere of Four Seasons. It is not a family restaurant for unbehaved, noisy children.

feQA0yXQpZ5K_Dfwm_ZTZA.text: A group of us visited Las Vegas for a friend's birthday in August 2007 and, since they were staying in the Mandalay Bay, his big birthday dinner was held here.  The dinner itself was nice, if a tad pricey, which is to be expected of The Four Seasons, I suppose.  The real star of the evening, though, was the drinks, particularly this drink called the Desert Rose that consisted of Belvedere Citrus vodka and hibiscus syrup.  Absolutely delicious and hands down, one of the best drinks I've ever had.  On an aside, I had written down the ingredients for the Desert Rose, but accidentally misplaced them.  I e-mailed the Four Seasons and within a few days, they had e-mailed me not only the ingredients, but the directions on how to make the drink.  This is stellar service and it was much appreciated.  While I probably wouldn't make this a regular place to visit for dinner, I could see coming here for drinks or special occasions.

xt0EEwt-pUE9_lElhfEGrg.text: Yogurt and Granola Yuck and Coffee sucks.  Along with their cappuccinos.  Otherwise , it is great.  Bagel and Lox are great and so is the Omelet.

wy4rYfxzyoRuOqMTHVvwYA.text: Been here once before today and it was ok. But this morning, not so much. Sat for about 2 minutes before the SA came over to get drinks, She promptly delivered our juice, coffee and tea. We waited to order breakfast... and waited.... and waited.... and waited some more. There were three tables in the restaurant other than ours. The servers had plenty of time to stand around chatting but apparently not enough time to take our breakfast order. We notified the management were were apologetic, which we appreciated. The server then came over and said "Can I take your order?" Seriously? No hello, how are you, good morning? Gee, thanks a lot. As a service industry professional, it really grinds my gears to see people who have great jobs at a semi fine-dining restaurant waste my time because they're lazy. I'm never coming back here. I will say that the hostesses and our beverage server were nice as well as the management so this is just a reflection on the wait staff. You are lucky to have a cushy gig. get it together!!!!

_gnJ508bOEg4dfMzfFp1HA.text: TEA SERVICE REVIEW I have been searching for a nice establishment to have afternoon tea service in a formal setting, similar to what you would do in England. Yes, tea and crumpets.   The Verandah was ok. Although it is the Four Seasons, it was not as fancy as I had hoped.  It was very professional and we ate off china and used real silver spoons, the atmosphere felt like a restaurant rather than a parlor or Ritz Carlton (which no longer exists in Vegas).  The food was good, the tea selection was acceptable, and the service was good. Just lacking the ambiance.  It's not like the Titanic movie afternoon tea. Probably better off ordering a long island iced tea by the pool, after all this is Vegas..........

1OprLZiSWEWxyN_2YamEHA.text: What is all the fuss about Verandah?  I went to this restaurant to the brunch buffet on the reviews of other Yelpers.  I was wondering if I might of missed something because the food was about as good as a regular breakfast buffet at a sub-par venue.  The outside venue is nice but.... Maybe people don't get out much in Vegas because there are way better places to eat a brunch buffet.  The Buffet at Caesars and The Wicked Spoon at The Cosmopolitan are way better for around the same price.  There were five people in our party and one had a birthday and the total was $210.00 after tax and before tip.  My son said Mom you should gave me the $200.00 and went to eat at Sunrise Cafe.  Wow now I know how rich folks get taken advantage off.  I'll be eating at the other fore-mentioned buffets before I come back here.  One note I will say is that we could have just ordered of the menu and it would have probably been cheaper.  So I cannot review it as a regular restaurant FYI.

_lZMdW821db-w0O93DhbDw.text: My husband and I went here for an easy, more casual (for most of Vegas, anyway) dinner before going to see The Lion King. It was not busy, but nice and quiet. Our waiter was fantastic, very personable and attentive. Menu is small, which I prefer, rather than poring over too many choices. Our mozzarella caprese appetizer was perfectly simple. I had the Cloud of Gnocci for dinner which, as the name indicates, was light and very tasty. I wouldn't recommend it if you are looking for a heavy big dish, but I loved it. Had the apple tart for dessert, which is beautiful and tasty. Didn't love the goat cheese crumble on it, but they didn't overwhelm the tart. It didn't actually have any pie crust, which I missed. Will definitely return!

ftUKzPfuY2otwA9gnKT3kQ.text: This review is for their weekend brunch buffet only.  Every once in a while I am reminded that people just don't know any better. Adam Sandler movies as blockbusters. "Harlem Shake" as number 1 on the Billboard 100. And this restaurant getting 4 and 5 star reviews.  These are probably the same people getting snobby about buffets in other 5 star hotels. I admit, most buffets are forgettable culinary experiences, but this one takes it to a whole different level of bad.  I'll start mentioning I've stayed at the Four Seasons in the past and it is, in my opinion, the best hotel in Las Vegas, together with the Mandarin Oriental. Room decor is a bit outdated but I hear they're renovating so that's a good thing. No smelly casino floor to deal with, no crowds, all rooms are upper floors with a great view, and the most comfortable mattresses I've ever slept in. Great service. Worth the cost.   This restaurant is a whole different story though. For $50 per head we got a cheese "station" (a plate with a few different types of cheese, most of them looked unhealthy, as if they've been sitting there for days), a berry "station" (three small bowls, straw, black, and blue), a charcuterie "station" (once again, a small plate with three different cold cuts), an omelet station (typical omelet ingredients, nothing I haven't seen at any other buffet with an omelet station), pastries, a donut station, bagels that felt like a strange combination of leather and wood (chewy like leather when you bite into it but feels like wood when you touch it), scrambled eggs (runny, tasteless, awful), assorted small plates with mystery food (dry chunks of meat, what I think was quiche but tasted like cooked plain yogurt with microscopic ingredients, and other stuff so bad I don't even remember what it looked or tasted like), and smoked salmon (the only thing worth mentioning, good salmon).  Bottomless bloody marys? Sure, as long as you don't mind playing bartender. Clamato in a bucket with ice, bottle of vodka, tabasco, veggies, bacon, and make it your damn self if you please. I don't mind getting my own food at a buffet (it is a buffet after all), but making my own cocktail? At a $50/person buffet? You must be kidding me.  They get two stars because their servers are top-notch, but great service doesn't compensate enough for their lackluster food to warrant a higher rating.  I won't equate the setting (and it is a great looking restaurant) into the review because most upscale Vegas hotel buffets have magnificent design these days. It's the norm, so it's not even worth mentioning.  Truly disappointing.

rVeuc3Efe0lrX0uKFTbyWg.text: Quite good food, and outstanding service. Decor inside is a bit stuffy but gives the sense that you're going to an old fashioned fancy restaurant where you might see someone important at a nearby table. I'd try to be seated outside next time.

oWjUFBA9u1F5yWiVI_enzg.text: Awesome Brunch spot in vegas...mellow and tasty food.  Perfect for a detoxing morning...  Plates range from 12-20, not bad for vegas

0Hle8RY-e1FtjGkRV3BVTg.text: We were so happy with the service and food! It is pricey, but the excellent food and service is so worth it. They only had flavored teas and I told them I only like black tea. So they went and made me fresh brewed iced tea just for me! Now that is service!

3bWS8RlWPZISwPLLQes7nQ.text: Beautiful, relaxing setting on the Veranda for brunch. Food and service was fabulous.  Highly reccommend. Listed under Mandalay Bay in Yelp, but is actually located in The Four Seasons.

pUBxaC-imLr1pCC8h2tr_g.text: Fantastic as always.  Service is great. Good for any meal of the day. We will miss Andrew at the bar!

gNMQcCeTAUwcaXhHXiXUmw.text: Pastas are excellent here. Full of flavors..not too salty..and big portions.  The italian sausage pasta is light and slightly creamy with little wet sauce.  The mozzarella proscuitto appetizer is unique and mouth watering..highly recommended.  Place is not packed at all. My party of 7 arrived 7pm on Saturday Memorial Day weekend and we had the entire interior restaurant to ourselves until around 815 when another couple sat inside. I guess most guests prefer to dine on the outdoor patio.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sharing dessert -- cotton candy ..trio of ice cream, and amaretto tiramisu
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple pie dessert with hazelnuts
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eskimo pie icecream sticks

slf7rOLfB5GqxO6kF9W9Fg.text: We LOVE this place.  Came here for Sunday Brunch today and it was perfect.  A lot of places are over the top and substitute quality for quantity, but the Veranda brunch was just right. It wasn't huge, but there was still a lot of variety and selection.  Enough selection that we got up three times to try everything.   It was only $39 per person and you get a good selection of pastries, egg stations, omelette station, variety of meats, there's even a fresh donut bar where you choose your own glaze and toppings,  a yogurt and parfait station...overall everything was perfect.  The service was excellent.  The servers greet you by name.  Everyone was polite and attentive.   We will definitely be coming back and highly recommend this place.

7MEDclH5f9tGtKKm92ZXeA.text: My friends and I wanted to try out this place for a while.  We finally were able to and boy was it awesome! It's a small buffet,  but everything looks and taste great! First off you get the choice of eating inside or outside Edith the lovely view of the pool. Second, you have the option of ordering from a menu or the brunch option. The menu has a lot of great breakfast items and lunch items as well. We opted for the brunch, which comes with coffee, tea, or juice. I had a strawberry and banana juice.  I loved it! Mimosas are offered for an additional $12. The buffet had fresh fruit, coffee breads, parfait, oatmeal, bread pudding, sausage, bacon, pancakes, bread pudding, French toast, quiche, and etc. What I liked the most were the freshly made donuts very yummy! You can also have eggs made to your perfection. If you want something that's not out the waiter can have it made for you. We had the chance to be waited on by Leo. He was very professional and friendly. He made our experience even more great when my friend asked for blue berry pancakes. Overall it was a great place to have brunch. It's not like these other buffets it's better! If you go to the Four Seasons make sure to valet in order to get your parking validated unless you like paying for parking. I'll shall return!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

RqUvKC5EriyhKd8z9SVduA.text: My food was fine, but the price paid for it is abominable. A small plate of penne was $23. Will not be coming back unless someone else is buying.

P23CWeXf7rB8Ea7mk4VShA.text: You're still the one that I, love The only one I dream of You're still the one I kiss, goodnight~~~  Veranda is still the best breakfast restaurant in the entire world.  I truly believe this place deserves THREE MICHELIN STARS!! I cannot even FATHOM how it is physically possible within the laws of physics for a breakfast to be as good as Veranda's.

6y_H_eE4-vudUT09Mmk_Mw.text: Sunday Brunch: Loved the breakfast panino! The seeds and nuts of the multigrain bread added a nice texture. The pesto made the flavors pop and made for a really nice autumn flavor profile.  The buffet had positives and negatives-- I loved the mini cinnamon rolls. Bread pudding had great flavors, but was a but underdone. Despite how beautiful and smart the Greek yogurt, fruit, granola parfait appeared, the granola was soggy and overall, the parfait was a bit dry. Unfortunately, The roasted potatoes were soggy as well. I heard that the mini donuts are amazing when piping hot off the station however, I didn't get to try them freshly fried, so those which I did try were quite standard and too sweet. Their fresh carrot melon juice was amazing! I Highly recommend trying their juices. The restaurant itself is quite lovely; bright and airy with high ceilings. We sat poolside which was very nice. Staff is very friendly and attentive. I would love to go back and try some of their other offerings. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast panino

ebqWynNdWNSVVU58poihMQ.text: If you are looking for a great place for brunch, you cannot go wrong with this restaurant. To begin with, the brunch is open along with coffee and tea for $39 a person, which is very affordable in Las Vegas. The array of selection of items for brunch is wonderful. Everything from a continental breakfast of wonderful bagels and delicious pastries to a full buffet of salmon and vegetables to a full American breakfast selection of eggs and sausage and bacon and I can go on for a long time. There are really cool combinations of breakfast items and there is so much to choose from, all of which is delicious, that you have to come hungry. My friend and I were thoroughly impressed and have no hesitation about coming back. This is a great place for families and anyone that is hungry and looking for a diverse and fun brunch with great food. The coffee is delicious and the service is really good, with very friendly staff. This restaurant is a no-brainer for a great brunch.

6Jcu8BQXOP3FHOTooPnFIg.text: Great happy hour specials and tasty food for dinner!  After hearing so much about this place from a buddy, I decided to come here for dinner one night. Luckily, I came right in time for Happy hour. Ordered the Ahi tuna cones $5, and I was presented with 2 very tiny and cute sesame ice cream cones filled soy sauce infused ahi tuna. Nice presentation. Then I got the beef sweet truffle slider $5 for 1 slider; the patty was overcooked and the truffle was too sweet and overpowered everything else inside the slider. Probably will not order that again. For my main entree, I got the braised short rib and that was absolutely delicious. I finished everything under 5 min, and was polishing the plate.   Service was good, I sat by the bar and the bartender was super skilled and talented. I watched him make all sorts of fancy schmancy concoctions and watched people's faces lit up after sipping his creations. It was very entertaining.   I would definitely like to come back and try some of the other options on the menu.

rs64mrQfKmDR8Ktxa1-uMg.text: We booked a reservation here last night after our TERRIBLE experience at Aueroles and could not have been more pleased!  Upon arriving at the restaurant we waited momentarily as the host had left his stand to seat he guests prior to us. After a moment we were treated by the executive chef who happened to be passing by and noticed us standing there. What a nice gesture! He was under no obligation to greet us and attempt to have us seated, but he chose to do so and it started our evening off on such a high note after our disappointing start earlier that evening.   Once we were seated we were met by our absolutely phenomenal waiter (his name escapes me right now, but he was an older Italian gentleman with a wonderful personality and kind demeanor). His suggestions were on par and the food was outstanding. The meatball appetizer was out of this world and my lobster risotto was to die for!   Thank y'all so much for turning a bad evening into a great one. Your hospitality, environment, wait staff and food selection was the best I had during my trip. Rest assured I'll be sending all my friends who visit to y'all's place!!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster risotto

DwnUs6prXT_QnRqU-SAcQA.text: One of the 2 main restaurants, Veranda is the nice but casual dining restaurant on the lobby floor of the The Four Seasons Hotel. Veranda is by the pool. The service was friendly and helpful suggesting the right portions and dishes. We ordered their sausage pizza, Caesar salad and chicken noodle soup. It all tasted great. The ambiance is modern Italian and comfortable. Will go back again.

K_OCh1sgvWxwVHcQkc8s1g.text: Greeting- Yes Vibe- Airport or budget hotel lobby Price- Expensive Service- fast and professional BR- hotel lobby-Pass/nice food This place is way below four seasons standards. It looks like an airport restaurant. The breakfast menu is eclectic. I had the hash. my friend had a breakfast sandwich! Why? The additional pastry basket is a rip off and embarrassing for what you would expect from a four seasons hotel. It was tasty. But this dish and the menu selections are trying so hard to be something they are not. It's like the menu items felt uncomfortable being on the menu! This place should give Bouchon in the Venetian a rum for the money if it was done right. But Bouchon it is not. WIGB? Probably not.

7cbfLShsv0cB_DrzbmZ1Nw.text: Let me start off by saying I was expecting more from Verandah at the Four Seasons.  When the hostess was walking us to our table, I noticed mini donuts sitting out and asked the hostess what they are for. She said they are for our guests and you can take one. I took two mini glazed donuts, even though, I did not like the fact that they were sitting out. It looked tacky and for The Four Seasons I expected a classier way of serving them like having them on a tray with serving tongs or keeping them in the back and having the waiter or hostess ask if we would like complimentary mini donuts.   As soon as I sat down at the table outside I noticed it was dirty. There was a sticky red substance on the table and crumbs all over the table, chairs, and the surrounding floor. For the prices that they charge here, attention to detail can not be overlooked. While looking over the menu, I asked the waiter to bring over some bread and balsamic. The balsamic was low quality and tasted very bitter, the container looked like it had not been cleaned for quite a while and was just refilled before the first shift of the day. I decided on the summer spaghetti and my friend chose the Tuscan chicken salad.   25 minutes later our food had not come out and it was hot as hell outside so we asked to be moved to the inside. As soon as we sat down we noticed it was just as dirty inside as it was outside. The table next to us had dried food particles on the side of it, booths were falling apart, and dust was all in the crevices.   Summer spaghetti- not well seasoned had to add salt, crushed red peppers, Parmesan to make it passable  Chicken salad- lettuce tasted like paper towels, ingredients were low quality  I called over the manager to tell him how filthy the restaurant was and that my expectations were not being met. He proceeded to write everything down on a note pad and thanked me for my feedback. I ended up sending the chicken salad back and we shared the pasta. The manager sent over a few complimentary desserts- Nutella cupcake, cherries, Panna cotta with kiwi gelatin on top? Both the Nutella cupcake and Panna cotta were amateur. The cake part of the cupcake tasted worse than a store bought mix and the Nutella buttercream frosting was lacking any type of bold flavor. The cherries were not even good, I felt like the manager just threw together a dessert without thinking it through.   When the bill came I noticed I was charged for the chicken salad. I told the waiter I should not be charged for an item I didn't eat. The manager comes back out and says you ate half the salad, and I said we tried the salad and realized it was not up to par. He ended up comping the meal for our sub par experience.  I hope to see improvement after the remodel is done because this restaurant needs to be refreshed and professionally detailed.   I appreciated the manager comping the meal and bringing out a few desserts. However, after the lack of attention to detail at Verandah, The Four Seasons in Las Vegas is not what it's cracked up to be.

Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nutella cupcake
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuscan chicken salad- garbanzo beans and grilled artichokes on the side

hHuZ5dTAWdWneAWPBnwgfw.text: While staying at the Mandalay Bay and after one of my SPA treatments I wanted a splurgy late lunch. The Four Seasons hotel is connected by hallways to the Mandalay complex and within one min I was seated and served.  I started with the Caprese salad - lovely Heirloom Tomatoes, Campania Buffalo Mozzarella, Pesto a drizzle of olive oil. For my entree I chose the starter (I do that sometimes - I love Apps!) Sicilian Meatballs - San Marzano Tomato Sauce, Pecorino Romano. Perfect lunch!  Accompanying lunch I had the Chianti Colli Senesi and I also asked for olives and was given a lovely dishful to go with my rustic bread with olive oil. I wish they had a snooty cheese plat or a charcuterie - olive, meats, & cheeses with a salad is a perfect meal IMHO.  Interestingly, they asked me for my last name when being seated and from then on from hostess, waiter, bus boy, to the manager coming by to ask how things were - they addressed me by name ....what a lovely touch!  Everyone helps and serves just seamlessly! A lovely, relaxing experience, and so filling I didn't need a dinner!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Verandah is now the Veranda and has a new look!

dylS9nRqHyLnoUQrl6MLvA.text: I stayed here for four days, and used the American Express Fine Hotels & Resorts reservation program, so I got free breakfast each day. The service was good, and the food was nicely prepared. For breakfast, I stuck with "The American" -- eggs, sausage or bacon, hash browns, and a fruit plate to split. I did notice that they have avocado on toast, which I found funny since my mom made that ages ago when I was a kid. Being English, she always made beans on toast and sardines on toast. When we moved to San Diego, it became avocado on toast (she even made Spaghettios on toast). Back then, I never saw avocado on toast at any restaurants. Now I see it everywhere. Veranda's version has a fried egg on top. Everything is better with an egg on top. On weekends they have a small buffet brunch, which is about $40 a head. I gave it a try and thought it nicely done. I also had lunch there one day, and just got a bunch of appetizers to share and then had a roasted beet salad with the typical ingredients. The only annoying thing was when a waitress had a 10 minute conversation with the next table over, her backside was almost on our table and she kept flipping her ponytail when she spoke. She was close enough that it could almost hit my face (we were seated inside and the tables are close together). I was going to say something, but didn't. However, all in all I like this place and would go back. Oh, and a big plus is that it's not in a noisy, smoky casino.

5C6GXcohaL8-uZMuQxZZyA.text: While at Mandalay Bay to indulge in free shark reef tickets I thought this one would be worth it since the Yelp rating was high and the pictures of the patio tables did create quite the mood so why not right? I admit the flies buzzing around the outdoor area as we ate got annoying, but didn't factor that into the plan of the meal..Haha  Well the wife and I went for the American breakfast vs. the buffet..Note to one of the reviews I saw, the breakfast buffet is different on Saturday and Sunday because Sunday has the build your own omelette and Saturday does not..If that's a make or break then go on the right date!  So yeah I decided upon carrot juice which I was bummed didn't seem to be all you can drink, but it was definitely good none the less..I had scrambled eggs, bacon, and hash browns for the main attraction..I mean yeah nothing special to gawk  over, but at least it wasn't over or under cooked and it seemed like they are pro health so who am I to diss that?

AQx237juPX98IyElsferXw.text: Looking for a killer brunch?  Stop here and you will not be disappointed.  First off, start with an upgraded bloody mary.  You will get a nice assortment of vegetables stuck in it, and it will be topped off with a giant shrimp.  Yum!  For brunch or breakfast I recommend the Traditional Corned Beef & Pastrami Hash Skillet.  It comes with two eggs (get them fried) and crispy shoe string potatoes.  Delicious! The server was nice and the food came promptly.  Do expect to spend a bit though...brunch for 2 people was $100.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Like you&#39;ve never seen a beluga drink an upgraded bloody mary...

YHqGyKze7z34XvISs1lQlg.text: Had lunch at Veranda and I'm just not impressed. Here's my steak salad, it was mediocre at best. $24 for that.
