Ne1HkY8MQT9PN0Upo4yU-Q.text: We had dinner at Veranda, for the first time, on a Monday.  We came here on the Black Friday deal, thanks to Debbie and David.   The ambiance was quiet and intimate. Here are the items we ordered: Bufala Pizza - Delicious.  One of the best pizza I have tasted.  The crust was soft and chewy.  Loved it!   -La Pasta Cotta Nel Vaso (Signature Dish) - I wasn't a fan.  But the rest of the party loved it.  -Tagliolini Ai Gamberi - This is the house made Saffron Tagliolini with Prawns and sea beans.  I liked this dish, though a bit salty. -Branzino Carta Fata - This is the European Seabass, served in a Parchment Bag.  The bag looks more like a clear plastic.  It was ok.   -Cavoletti - Brussel Sprouts were ok. -Chocolate Souffle - Delicious!  Debbie and I each got our own. -Mini Salted Caramel Eskimo Bars - Eh.  Overall, it was ok.  Will Earl and I return for full-priced dinner? Probably not.  For Brunch? Maybe.

Iga-A7FNyLldjmGtImZ_Mg.text: Some very authentic Italian dishes. The food was expertly prepared.  The offer some nice oven fired pizzas as well. Some great desserts also on the menu  Servers were excellent,

faFWhhauu_BVxoJrYAkQ2Q.text: Had an awesome belated Mother's day Sunday brunch here the weekend after Mother's Day, (yesterday)! The food was amazing! The highlight was easily the chicken apple sausage, the freshly made doughnuts, fried chicken and waffle and french toast.   The standard fruits and cured meats, parfaits and yogurts were awesome too. If they wanted to kick up the quality of the cheese selection,  I'd like to suggest brining in Beecher's Flagship cheese from Seattle. Pair this with the cured meats... That would take it to another level, IMO.  There were 12 of us and we were all really happy with the food. The service was why only 4 stars was given. Took awhile to get someone to refill our drinks. At one point, I even had to search for a server to get refills. If they can tighten that up, they would get that 5th star for sure.  I do plan on returning, for sure and I am looking forward to that for sure!

lLGOzm3-Zxaj_I2htzBjrg.text: Had a great brunch on Sunday with some friends. Had to wait a bit before getting seated. Breakfast menu ended at 1pm and we just made it at 12:30pm. Had a great table right by the pool, comfy chairs at a round table that seated 7. The waiters were fantastic and we always had at least two ready to help us. I had the omelet with extra bacon which was delicious. Great mimosa and the Italian Screwdriver was interesting, although a bit sweet for my taste. Others at the table had the bloody mary and were going on and on about how great it was so I assume it was delicious, but I'm not a big bloody mary drinker. It took a while for the food to get to me because I ordered early with three of our friends, and then the other four came about 10-15 minutes after us. Even though we asked for our food to be brought when it was ready they still brought out all the food together. I won't ding them for that, we did kind of feel bad about possibly eating before our friends.   Overall, it was a beautiful location, delicious food, and a great experience!

tCvzoMss0EjKtqfk7_fNOw.text: NYE dinner was fabulous. Fixed menu was v good, especially as it suited non meat eaters. The usual impeccable Four Seasons service and a nicely decorated room made for a very pleasant start to the evening.

q_6ywUdvSqUZF756Z_U_uA.text: The best.  I did not want to leave.  I had the Limon Ricotta pancakes with fig compote and traditional corned beef and hash with a few mimosas.  The restaurant, the staff, the food, everything is impeccable.  This is THE best place for brunch in town.

oZvZ-eW1oHCBIavlOpVapw.text: We ate here for breakfast on Friday morning. It's a nice place with a country club in La Jolla vibe. We had the American breakfast. Scramble eggs, bacon, hash browns, toast, and two cokes. The bill = $70.00...grant it I did not look at the prices but $70.00 for a basic breakfast, never again. I don't mind paying for great food but not for basic. This review is obviously based on breakfast only but if they're charging that much for low quality I can't imagine what dinner would be like.

uGGKIBdrwaK6hv1gvrKgZQ.text: We ate the breakfast for couple of days, the food was good and the fruits were super fresh

FS6Vvtg_QB7vqcE_PHH7Pg.text: Service: Excellent Food: First Class Price: Expensive Atmosphere: A Great Break from the action on the strip  Lunch meeting, 3 hours long! We had a great time, great service, great food, the seafood bento box was to die for. Freshest seafood on the strip!  If you want a little bit of a break from all the action this is a must stop.

fQM18QkJDYAJUwUgXDfGxQ.text: Gr8 weekend buffet.  Creative food, fine service and Four Seasons' ambience.  Gr8 for power lunch or quiet breakfast on outdoor patio overlooking beach at Mandalay Bay.  Reasonably priced.  Try the fresh doughnuts, little skillet creations and made-to-order omelettes.

JmO-iEfucDS86SVqumjwnQ.text: Beautiful brunch location. Always come here when you are looking for a boozy fun brunch spot on a Sunday with friends. Let's not forget one of the top places in Vegas to go for Mother's Day have been there for the last 5 years. As well near the Four Seasons Spa for treatments before or after.

f6qeidym7Q9sa7Vj2N7LBA.text: Had a fantastic brunch out on the patio. Great service and a good variety of options on the menu. The breakfast panini was amazing! The perfect combination of all ingredients and very filing. Service was very good. Possibly because it was a later brunch, the party music from the pool could already be heard.

OI33Cjo2toMO8sUNXnw3TA.text: This review is coming a but late... But mothers day brunch is incredible here.  Is it pricey?  Yes.  Is it worth it?  Hell yes.  I went with my family and they had no less than 9 different food stations.  One was dedicated to juice.  Freshly squeezed, made to order juice.  That was just the tip of the ice berg.  Do yourself a favor and reserve a table for mothers day brunch at the Verandah!

F9z-sl0drmFUBr-l5p5hCQ.text: We had brunch here back in November. I wasn't sold on doing the buffet but then I caught a glimpse of it. Everything was hot and delicious. We also had mimosas which was the icing on the cake. There was so much food, impossible to try everything. I highly recommend eating here. If their brunch is this good, I can imagine dinner is just as delicious.

L0cDRDxyyiFw7uWKpvdxqg.text: Short ribs, halibut, monkey bread, beignets, coffee! All amazing! Have no idea why the place wasn't packed. The waiter , Miguel was amazing, the food extremely good quality, prepared well and just delicious.

6w0VIZ3-YaXXhOQ-K3G3ig.text: I came here with my husband and another couple after reading fantastic yelp reviews.  What the yelp reviews hadn't made clear (at least among the ones I read) was that the brunch buffet they do is only on weekends.  It says it on Verandah's website; I'm just an idiot.  And I'd been looking forward to a fancy tasty buffet, so other Yelpers, be forewarned!    So instead we had lunch.  I had the nicoise salad, and my husband had the ABC pizza.  Both were pretty incredible, but I think I mourned not having the brunch option the whole meal.    I have to return.  Besides being a really beautiful, chill environment, just venturing into the Four Seasons was an experience in and of itself.  We'd never stopped by before, and it was such a breath of fresh air (literally!) to enter a hotel on LV Blvd that was non-smoking, beautiful without being Vegas-gaudy, and allowed pets.  We had a blast watching people taking their dogs out and parading them through the lobby while we waited for our friends.  Everything about Verandah and the Four Seasons feels so un-Vegas...and that's part of why it's fantastic.

0asKHd7zsFGiGiFrpmhFkw.text: Mismanaged expectations.  From a promotion for a the prix fixe dinner, we dressed appropriately for "The Four Seasons" - and what a mistake!  The Verandah is a "dolled-up" buffet room, that's probably great for patio dining by the pool, but hardly for dinner.  While the wait staff was friendly and attentive, the service was out of step and not up to "The Four Seasons" standards.  After being asked for our water order (we chose Pellegrino), bread was dropped off unceremoniously without any suggestion of butter.  We guess 'everyone' prefers olive oil.  The bread was not at all warm - merely room temperature and poorly presented.  When the butter was delivered - a really long wait - over 5 minutes - it arrived cold and hard - straight from the fridge.  Off to a bad start.  The first course was a warm ricotta cheese with tomato - quite pleasant.  By now the sparkling wine included with the meal was delivered and acceptable.  The second course was supposed to be a seafood gnocchi but tasted like grammar school paste.  Huge miss!  Third course was 'snapper' (hard to tell) with whipped potato - not bad, but this is a $100 place setting.  Fourth course was short rib with polenta - very so-so.  The desert course was an 'ok' mouse cake with a dollop of ice cream, topped off with coffee.  The entire expereince just felt very "regular".  Here's the juicy bit.  My wife and I dress up for dinner about once a month as a treat.  On this evening, she wore a stunning dress and her best Jimmy Choo pumps - absolutely smashing!  While we wear jeans and shorts when appropriate - we're the last people would call snobs - we were really put off by the fellow at the next table in a "wife beater" T-shirt.  Where's the dress code for The Four Seasons during the dinner hour?  We've not tried the Charlie Palmer steak house adjacent to The Verandah, but doubt a visit any time soon.  Perhaps that's the hierarchy of dining at this hotel - The Verandah for the pool crowd.  With so many terrific alternatives on and off The Strip, The Verandah is relinquished to the back water.

wgUbt585n0-gtL0R0qJfsw.text: AMAZING!!! I mean its the Four Seasons, how could it not be. We went here as our final event on a bachelorette weekend. We were comfortably sat at a round table that fit our group of 6 perfectly. Close enough to the pool but far enough away that you're not getting splashed. So what makes the Verandah Sunday brunch amazing, everything is miniature.   What do I mean by miniature. Well, first off - don't even bother getting the a la carte menu. I'm sure its good, but you want the buffet. Trust me. But you never eat enough to pay for how much a buffet costs? I know, that's me too. This one is worth it.  Every lil food option is shrunk down so that you can try EVERYTHING and not be full. All of the meats, breads, fruits, yogurt, everything is in these little tasters so that you really can have everything. The in house homemade peanut butter is to die for as is the donuts being rolled right in front of you.   Our waitress was wonderful. We didn't even want any champagne after the weekend we'd had and she was so on the ball with coffee and tea refills. Wonderful! Thank you Verandah and the Four Seasons for a wonderful end to a great weekend!

rP0t4Rd5YZEowylJiK3qHA.text: When my friends told me they were taking me to the 4 Seasons for breakfast I thought they were kidding. A 4 Seasons, on the strip? Who knew? A completely surprising and wonderful experience.   Be sure to have the Huevos Rancheros! The red sauce they prepare is so rich and creamy it would be probably make a fun dinner ice cream! I do ding them for using jarred salsa.. I'm sure that most of the cooks in the back have awesome salsa recipes.. the chef needs to hit them up, seriously! Also a ding on the so so pastry basket.. come on now.. this is the 4 Seasons.. I bet they could bring something better in than what they currently serve.  In all the chaos and drama on the strip this is one of the most secluded feeling and comfortable escapes. I look forward to coming back soon!

ZZp8ieaTZ6atrKMXGU2HYA.text: We had weekend brunch at this restaurant.  Given that it was the Four Seasons, our expectations were very high.  We opted for the brunch buffet.  The buffet was smaller than we would have expected.  The brunch consisted of mainly breakfast foods (eggs, bacon, sausage, potatoes, french toast, pancakes, etc.).  We were hoping for some seafood and were disappointed that there was none.  The place did serve a variety of pastries which were delicious.  The service was slow.  The pool was under construction so there was no view of the pool area.   Overall the food was good and the service was fair.  I am only giving three stars since this was a Four Seasons buffet and therefore expectations were high.

l7WVwmONY0rhu6HRKY6Hkw.text: just Got back from Father's Day brunch!! Waited and hour for a table that I booked a Father's Day reservation for! Food was stale portions were old and not replenished well.. grilled mahi fish tacos were raw taco truck had toppings were baking in the hot sun. Grilled salmon on out  door barbecue was like Sushi gross!!! Scones not even baked and chicken sausage not Cooked well!! No salad bar!!  Serving utensils at Buffet were gross!! No dress code no free mamosas.. no deserts no ice cream!! Worst buffet in Las Vegas!! Sandwiches and deli meat left out for hours!! I'm praying I don't get food poisoning from this horrorshow!!

IfqOKxQSucV0M2XQAKlpwg.text: This is the Four Seasons, so it means business.  5 stars for the Cranberry Ricotta Pancakes. Sure, it's $15 for two, but good luck finding pancakes this amazing anywhere else. So moist and flavorful with a phenomenal cranberry compote and the most perfect under-sweetened syrup. They almost couldn't even be classified as pancakes.  Service was impeccable -I'm sure it helps to have a large group of business associates. ;-)

K4OwL420v1TMR6qifG6deA.text: This was a four compared to other restaurants. It was a three compared to what I expected it to be. Overcooked burger, good fries, service was mediocre, not what I expected from the Four Seasons.

XWfvOwR6GaoewETwGnZSYQ.text: The veranda had a rather simple menu for lunch featuring some pizza we asked for something off the menu  Eggs Benedict for two please  And mimosas  The French bread is to die for I don't know where  its from but it is amazing and I've eaten bread all over the world... butter not so much but the oil was delicious I actually preferred the bread to the eggs Benedict if you could believe that!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bread GONE
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast at Veranda at 2pm

-8cC3Gmv7AzTYgu9xV9tcA.text: Came in for breakfast because I knew that, 1-being in Four Seasons, I was going to get excellent service and 2-the food would be worth the price. I was not disappointed.   When we walked in the hostess was on the telephone assisting a guest. The guest was being quite inquisitive and the hostess was doing her best at answering them. I could tell she was trying to end the call to seat us, but try as she may, she could not end the call. We stood there for about 3-4 minutes when one of the waiters came to seat us. We looked over the menu and ordered the chicken and waffles and eggs Benedict. The service was excellent, as expected.   Our food came out perfect and looked delicious. It was, of course!  The only thing that I could say, was the chicken was over-breaded.  There was more breading than chicken. I'm sure some people like that, but not us.   If you're staying at the Mandalay Bay, this is the place for breakfast. It might be a bit pricier than other restaurants in the hotel, but it is definitely worth it!   I'll be back in a few months!! My mouth is watering writing this review!!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Traditional eggs Benedict l
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and waffles extra crispy!!!

2WAj8BIZa4Vyu65j1NeUGQ.text: Excellent restaurant! Conveniently connected to Mandalay Bay hotel. The staff is friendly and professional. Food is delicious.

b1ktsvnKxLdJmRKLPjQFYw.text: There is no brunch like a four season brunch. They have an amazing buffet on the weekends. On weekdays they have off the menu option. Either one will not disappoint you. There is not much to say about this place other than it is the best brunch you can find in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

kgdvmZ0CnmtTAC0oCSX3DQ.text: This place is amazing! Best breakfast in town and I have eaten a lot of breakfasts:-) the bread pudding!!!!!!!!. Smoked salmon, capers, and tomatoes were perfect. Best Chicken and waffles over heated maple syrup and a fresh donut machine making donuts topped the way you want them- happy days. Plus 2 types of bacon, 2 types of sausages, and so much more. I did not sample anything that I did not like.

JsVNMyg78Gk6kH26KCjacA.text: My wife and I are here twice during our stay at the Four Seasons hotel  The service at the Veranda Restaurant is top notch, some great people working there that were very gracious and helpful with my occasionally rambunctious son.  The ala carte breakfast was okay, albeit not great. The buffet breakfast was however outstanding, one of the best we've had.  Tons of healthy options with muesli and yogurt, plus unhealthy options such as fresh made customizable donuts, many hot options (quiche lorraine, corned beef, top notch blintzes, pastries).  Best of all the serving sizes were small so you could take little bits of everything and find out what you liked best.  Really was a great experience, highly recommended and fairly reasonably priced considering what you get for the money.  Would definitely return!

IpOWStzN7BLEQztVqoA_SA.text: The service was excellent. I had 3 plates consisting of oatmeal, watermelon, pineapple, strawberry yogurt, scrambled eggs, sausages, smoked salmon pancakes, strawberries, banana, grapefruit juice, and English breakfast tea. The food was very high quality. I was sitting beside the pool because it was a sunny day outside. Overall, this all you can eat breakfast has all you have dreamed of. The downside is that it is expensive. For one person it is $48 including tips and tax. Just try this place at least once!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wrxOQrWMs7bJIg2VX9htkQ.text: Went to Veranda with a great Black Friday Deal (50% off any reservation made on Black Friday for the month of Dec).  Ordered more food than normal considering this deal.  Veranda is out of the way, tucked away inside the Four Seasons Hotel at Mandalay Bay.  This is a good restaurant, but one that may not be worth going out of your way for.  Highlights: Desert was great! Best Cannolis I've had since Mike's Pastry and other spots in the North End of Boston.  Comes with three cannolis (Chocolate, Nutella and Pistachio).  Mini Eskimos were also good (chocolate ice cream pops)  Ordered (party of two): Sicilian Meatballs (San Marzano Tomato Sauce, Pecorino) Beet Carpaccio (Roasted Sugar Beets & Ricotta, Citrus Rainbow Carrots, Candied Hazelnuts, Passion Fruit Vinaigrette) Tagliatelle ai Porcini - Hand Made Tagliatelle, Porcini Mushroom, Italian Sausage, Lemon Thyme, Castelmagno Cheese Rigatoni Bolognese (Rigatoni with meat bolognese and parmesan foam) Cannoli (Sicilian Pistachio, Nutella, Chocolate Chip) Mini Eskimos (Sea Salt Caramel Ice Cream Bars, Roasted Nuts, Bittersweet Chocolate)  Overall: Good Italian restaurant, but with so many other great Italian options I would not recommend.  Maybe for desert :)

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini Eskimos
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cannolis
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tagliatelle ai Porcini

FmuY0EcTTw346LFe6mVoww.text: We had an 8 pm reservation for four on a Saturday night. The service was horrible. It took 20 minutes for our server to arrived - and we had to ask for a server.  It went down hill from there. No introduction. No list of specials. No checking on us. Random people brought us our food. We had to flag down people if we wanted water or heaven forbid, more wine. Who was our waiter? Why would we ever come back? And the place not full. My stomach hurts too. What was in that food?!

2Vsg_fi6wIhh4hMxh3wCIw.text: We went to Saturday Brunch for the buffet around 8am. Both the buffet and the menu dishes were absolutely delicious and beautifully curated. They have all of the breakfast buffet standards with many new takes and options. Every berry, bacon strip brioche looked and tasted like it was lovingly prepared and selected. The staff were friendly and so accommodating. My friend is vegan and the chef came out and spoke with her and - I shit you not- created a vegan mini buffet for her comprised of a tofu & veggie omelet, almond milk and chia pudding, avocado toast on freshly baked vegan bread. And, they only charged her for the avocado toast on the menu. Vegan friendly! I ate from the buffet. My favorites were the brioche French toast, the breakfast pizza, the mini Mexican tortilla, cheese & chicken skillet, the scones, the strawberry pancakes, the frittata, the fresh donuts, and the diy chicken waffles. Even the coffee and juice were delicious. We can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our beautiful table out by the pool. This is the vegan omelette the chef made especially for my friend  Silver pot of delicious coffee.

SU3jCGXjs_--4EKIRm4PXw.text: Amazing gluten free pancakes and gluten free waffles. Delicious fresh juices and amazing egg whites with pesto. We actually came twice during our vacation. Had I known about Veranda earlier, i would have spent my entire vacation there for breakfast.   Even tho they aren't a gluten free restaurant (particularly the buffet is not gf-friendly at all), but the other specials are so good. Also has gluten free toast.   Yum yum yum!

xPmxp6iI9qCUUudq7DTJPg.text: I've grown tired of breakfasting at Bouchon so was elated to discover Veranda. The frittata bianca and the Italian omelet were about as good as food can get. I spent all my days in Vegas in search of the best possible food and it's hard to beat what I began the days with when I breakfast at Veranda.

-CyYWgzYwTEOQ-z0IispWA.text: We used to come here often for business meetings since it's quiet enough to talk and entertain your guests. We came here for brunch today and I don't know why we stopped coming here. Their food selection is good, ambience is great and even though it's on the strip, it's still easy to get in and out from here.

hpAxT0mlr72pAr0goUY0rg.text: Went here for afternoon tea! Everything from the service and the food was amazing. Afternoon tea is only served from mon-fri which is a bummer because I'd like to go on the weekends. Must make a 24hr reservation. The portions were perfect!! We even had extra to take home. Our server even hooked us up and added more desserts to our to go box. That was really sweet of him. One of the best afternoon tea spots in town. Will def go back!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

i59CtlNe0CKIoY5faPBWEQ.text: Spacious restaurant. I went on a Tuesday night so not busy. It's located inside the Four Seasons I believe.  I was here with a group of about 10 people and they were able to seat us in a semi private area which was cool.  I ordered the Meatballs as appetizers. They were quite large and filling. I did them find them a bit salty for my palate.  My main was the Bigoli scampi. Now since I already stuffed myself with the meatballs, I was dreading a huge plate as my entree. Luckily the portion was "human" so I was able to eat it without leaving most of it behind.   Hot Chocolate Souffle was a winner amongst everyone.   Not sure I would come back. Food was decent. My friends were staying here and did not want to travel far so it was a nearby option for decent food.

Z_vdH0j1Zbi5Qaop2l4wTA.text: 5 stars for service, 4 stars for food.  Exceptional service.  Salmon salad was good, pumpkin soup pretty good.  Would come back.

AIZSlVppSOlNAUUtOAZVXQ.text: Food is top notch, and is only surpassed by the quality of service.  Yes, it's expensive, but you do get what you pay for here.

EWS5DQXhUJdE2k2evbGimg.text: Walked into Veranda and everyone here is very hospitable. Beautiful inside and out. Service was amazing. Thanks to Bill for waiting on us and making a memorable night. Looking foreword to our return visit.   The restaurant/kitchen accommodate our food allergies. Everything was well paced and delicious. Chef made a visit as well.   Kudos!!

Wl-rte1H0K8pzvs7dLnUAQ.text: Review for afternoon tea. This is a great setting for an afternoon tea, comparable to Mandarin Oriental's (I think the food here is slightly better).  I believe you have to make a reservation for tea. When we arrived they already had our table specially set up. There's a great selection of tea- I had the mountain berry, which is like a hibiscus (so slightly tart and sour) and packed with vitamin C.   The food was also fantastic. The scones are the best ones I've had-- super light and fluffy. They make one plain and one with currants, and is accompanied with THE best cream. I surprisingly liked all the sandwiches, and I think the biggest difference was the quality of the bread and the fact that the sandwiches were not dry. Desserts were a nice mix and not overly sweet.  The best tea for me in Vegas would be the food here with Mandarin Oriental's view!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hfXyvbUD9mrcc0D1FKDyJA.text: This review is for dinner at the Veranda.  I've only had breakfast or brunch here.  The restaurant ran a Black Friday special.  Call on Black Friday, make a reservation for dinner some night in December, and receive 50% off.  That's a great deal!  I had a reservation for 6.  There was only one other table occupied when I arrived but it soon got busy.  My server was Jose and he proved., along with all the staff, to be pleasant, polite, and very efficient!  I ordered 4 things--pear salad, ahi tuna crudo, Penne Tegame, and an apple and fig crostata for dessert.  First I was brought water and quickly the iced tea I ordered.    The starter was the pear salad.  Their menu describes it as Bartlet Poached Pear, Spiced Goat Cheese, Endive, Pecans, Porto Dressing.  It was excellent.  The pieces of pear in the endive leaves with the goat cheese was an amazing combination.  The pecans added a texture element that was perfect.  Next up was the crudo of very thinly sliced ahi tuna with balsamic soy dressing and guacamole. An interesting combination with ahi tuna but it worked very well.  For the main course, I bypassed the signature pasta dish and instead went with the penne Tegame with a spicy Roma tomato and parsley sauce and mozzarella.  The red flecks of pepper could be seen and tasted throughout the dish.  The spiciness was not overwhelming for anyone.  It was excellent.  Jose suggested the cannoli for dessert but I chose something different, the warm apple and fig crostata.  It had an orange and vanilla bean reduction/panna cotta gelato.  I am generally not a fan of warm desserts but this was amazing!  Very delicious and an excellent ending to a delightful meal.  Service was the best!  My iced tea never got more than an inch down from the top when the glass was refilled.  Plates were removed quickly, and people addressed me by my last name taken from the reservation.  This is what I expect from a Four Seasons restaurant and they didn't fail.  In addition, I received a phone call on the way home because they thought they had found an item I may have left behind.  They were in error, but it shows the detail to service that's paired with great food.  I'll be coming back for that signature pasta dish.  I have to check it out!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Warm apple a fig crostata.
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Penne.
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ahi tuna.

fQNzGhJldkCfgNMzTubLKA.text: A beautiful place to start your day. We had a reservation for Monday morning for breakfast, and I requested to be seated outside which we were. The place had a relaxing feel, and was not too crowded. I had the eggs benedict which were yummy and well balanced. My only complaint is that one of the eggs were cooked a bit too long, and didn't run when I cut into it. It's not a cheap place, but the location is great, so is the ambiance and the food is yummy. A fresh breath of air on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benedict

N3ZqoviTYZeoBP2PZNoyuA.text: I had the grilled salmon salad. The salmon was deliciously prepared but the salad felt dry with only tomatoes and artichokes as accompaniment. I found myself noshing on the dry lettuce. Also a can of soda was $5!

iStHtxik8CQ-Susl7QgQOg.text: This is a gem of a restaurant tucked in the Four Seasons Las Vegas. On our recent visit, we experienced wonderful breakfasts and an extremely well priced happy hour.   On Saturday and Sunday, Verandah puts on a brunch that is not to be missed. Traditional egg and griddle dishes are served as well as the most delicious pastries I've had in a long time. Dare I say best croissants this side of Paris? All I know is the pastry chef in residence here rocks! I also must mention the made-to-order donut bar available during brunch. So amazing, and worth the extra trip to the gym later in the day...  Happy Hour at Verandah boasts select $5 apps and cocktails. My husband and I love the friendly staff and well crafted cocktails. Go between 4-7 pm for the Happy hour specials.

hIABPu86EoiW3gdbvh9UgA.text: The restaurant is located at the far end of the strip and it is a perfect place if you want some quiet dining experience away from the casino, smoke and the crowd. We had a Sat brunch there. Before we go in, I was debating whether I should have a la carte or the brunch since we had a heavy meal the night before. I finally decided on the brunch because it was just a deal when juice and coffee is included and they will make whatever juice you want as long as they have the fruits. Even though the brunch does not have an omelet station but the kitchen will make whatever omelet you want and it is included in the brunch price. Overall, the food is good ( not excellent ) but the great service and the environment just made a very relaxing experience. We would definitely go back.

ichoTEoiGKNiQyvFkQ-a3g.text: The Wife and I decided to treat ourselves to a nice dinner in a relaxed environment and she suggested we dine at Verandah. Located in the Four Seasons @ Mandalay Bay, this restaurant is a great getaway where you don't feel like you're on the Las Vegas Strip. After browsing the menu, we decided to order: Salad Caprese - Beefsteak Tomato, Campania Buffalo Mozzarella, Pesto yelp.com/biz_photos/duw-... yelp.com/biz_photos/duw-... Aragosta - Lobster, Frisee, Seasonal Vegetables, Truffle Vinaigrette yelp.com/biz_photos/duw-... Entrees Penne Alla Arrabiata - Smoked Mozzarella, Spicy Roma Tomato Sauce yelp.com/biz_photos/duw-... Branzino - Striped Sea Bass, Citrus Crust, Fennel Sauce yelp.com/biz_photos/duw-... Side Dishes Baby Potatoes with Black Truffle yelp.com/biz_photos/duw-... Mushrooms with Marsala yelp.com/biz_photos/duw-... For Dessert Warm Italian Donuts, Lemon Curd, Chocolate Ganache I had the Caprese Salad and the Penne Alla Arrabiata. Both were amazing! The Penne Alla Arrabiata was made al dente, which is how I love my Pasta and the Arrabiata Sauce had a nice kick to it....just right. The Caprese Salad was not overdone with Oil, unlike some restaurants. The Wife enjoyed her Lobster Salad and Striped Bass. She passed on Dessert, but I couldn't resist the Warm Italian Doughnuts, so I went for it.....they were so good, I forgot to take a picture of them and they were gone by the time I remembered....:) The service was impeccable. The servers were friendly and attentive. They were also very knowledgable about the menu and had great ideas for dinner. Overall, it was an another awesome experience here. Return Factor - 100%

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IGdgxPv9o3yP3GerGxnYDA.text: Had reservations for 7am on a Tuesday morning.  So unnecessary!  :)  Got lost trying to find the restaurant between three hotels in one at Mandalay Bay.  The service was friendly and superb.  Sitting outside was beautiful, comfortable and relaxing.  The menu is very expensive.  $5.50 for coffee, $6 for a wine glass size of juice.  About $18 for the average breakfast plate.  I ordered the vegetarian hash which was okay.  Asked for asparagus instead of spinach which I was pleased withm  The daily fresh squeezed juice was peach & passionfruit.  Just okay.  My hubby had corned beef & pastrami hash.  He liked it.  It looked okay.  A big plus is the gluten free menu items and the gluten free toast with breakfast!

gWJ4wnUmbP9TQtRPFsos1Q.text: Verandah at the Four Seasons just served one of the best meals of my life.  Shared at our table for two, bread with EVOO and bottled water, caprese, beet salad, field greens, ahi tuna steak, top sirloin, salted carmel chocolate eskimo bars, espresso.  Maybe sounds not so special, but each and every element of every dish was pure and distinctly rich in natural flavor, clean, and very high quality.  Excellent service, outdoor seating, warm desert breeze.  The only downer:  loud junky static broadcasting from Mandalay Bay stage next door... Can't call it "music."

8CEiPckC-waf8L8ykZK3BQ.text: Best place we've ever been for breakfast- so many choices! Healthy to not so healthy. The fruit loops covered donut was excellent! Staff was awesome and very on top of it.

fNTDjhwfOlNOFv2H9KSOcQ.text: Veranda is one of are favorite go to Sunday brunch places. The quality is great for those items that are our favorites:  smoked salmon, cream cheese, onions and bagel to start for my husband and he finishes the brunch with freshly made mini donuts and blintzes.  I mainly go for my usual fresh crabmeat egg white omelette prepared on request with their regular pork sausage link and chicken-Apple links. There are other items to choose from, including juices, Bloody Mary's and Mimosas if you'd like. These are from the brunch buffet, but they also have a menu if you rather have it ordered. It has a sophisticated atmosphere with superb service that is second to none. We have tried many other brunches in Las Vegas, but Veranda is the one we enjoy about once a month.  So far it's always as anticipated.

ViW0y_wt1aUaaNcXWaJyIg.text: Made a special trip here just for their afternoon tea service. I booked on Open Table and then called the day before to confirm, no problems at all. We were about ten minutes late (sorry about that by the way, some people in my party, not myself, are incapable of being on time.) but they didn't hassle us about it and graciously sat us right away. Our server was polite and explained our tea choices and then the little pastry and sandwich tray when it came out. My favorites were the currant scone and the strawberry pastry, but everything was delicious.  I thought the hotel itself was beautiful and we would have liked to walk around the patio areas but there was a severe dust storm at the time. I'd consider going again the next time I'm in Vegas just for the ambiance and the wonderful service, even the bussers were outstanding. Thanks again Veranda.

qF91lqDV4uOYZEQh4Yjy7Q.text: Had supper there with my wife and 3 kids. Food was exceptional, service perfect. The head chef came out and spoke with us. Salmon and chocolate souffle were highlights! My entire family really enjoyed it. Can't wait to go back to Vegas and enjoy again.

d0zAKRnW9WUy7Yo1zt6eKQ.text: Review is for 2012 Restaurant Week.  Verandah is located in the Four Seasons Hotel and I remember my first visit here to the hotel, I was confused as heck on where to park, either you valet or do what I did and park in the large lot south of the entrance and walk on the roadway in.    Verandah was dimly lit and had a nice cozy atmosphere.  There were numerous tables, private rooms, and booths.  But we were sat against the window wall where you couldn't really see the outside because it was getting dark.  But you can see the private pool surrounded by green forestry, would probably be nice to sit out there and dine.  The service was good, server was attentive but the restaurant wasn't busy yet and the food runner knocked our socks off.  I lost all my pictures on my phone so I'm relying on the blurry dishes opposite of my foodie buddy Angela T's uploaded photos since we came here for restaurant week.    On paper the menu looked outstanding, worthy of the $50.12 price marked.  And compared to the other items offered at other places for the same mark I thought Verandah played it too conservative with such high level of culinary technique.  The drink I ordered didn't impress but the server did replace it.    The best food runner ever, not because he was Hawaiian, came out with a complimentary appetizer.  The soup and spoon sides were great.  The first course came out and mine beat Angela's.  I tasted her risotto because I love risotto and it was ahh maybe cooked a little bit longer than needed.  I think argula is one of the better tasting greens out there, the flower is even better but it was fresh.  My first course was a scallop, jumbo shrimp, and can't remember the third item but it was placed on top of a nice sauce and topped with a delicious flavor foam.  The spoon had a sweet fruit taste which completely refreshed my palette.  The runner told me it was to be eaten in one direction to the other.  The second course was what caught my attention and what brought me here.  This dish was so plain.  The monkfish itself was prepared perfectly though so there really was no hating it but there really was no way of loving it also.  I ordered the other dessert just so we could split it and try the others dessert and to me they both ended up being ordinary as well.  For me two of the three courses was just so plain, my appetizer was great though.  There were some great skills used when preparing our Restaurant Week courses and I appreciate the participation otherwise I would have never come here for dinner.  Culinary skills and mix of flavor to me outshined the bland main course, the complimentary appetizer was appreciated as well and our food runner was on top of every ingredient and knowledge into  how each dish was created.  I thought he was our chef with the way he explained each item as he delivered it to us.

XFTGbg3W6bQtvwnEg5p2gQ.text: Way over priced. Over 20 dollars for bacon and eggs?? Really.  Even the rich are smart and do not eat here!

3Nz4N-B5zLhIxMKFVXFp9g.text: Amazing Relaxing Experience Every Time! Do yourself a favor and have a nice relaxing breakfast or brunch  Must sit outside on the poolside patio it has a sitting in the backyard by the pool on Sunday morning feel.  Service is impeccable they even remember and call you mr or mrs your last name.  Food is without compromise and is ALWAYS perfect.

A-TqLBFlaFunOBa6pvP_4A.text: Impeccable service and relaxing atmosphere. The food was tasty and filling. Such a nice patio dinner with view of a fountain. The waitstaff greets you by your full name and the chef designed the plates beautifully.

wCbubRPS3g--FKNE6IehAw.text: Our anniversary dinner lead us back to Verandah and basically it just boils down to the fact that I love Verandah. The setting isn't very formal and there's an outdoor seating area with ceiling fans and shade for those that want to hang outside.   We changed things up by ordering the calamari (fritto misto). A good choice as there was shrimp/calamari and green peppers which brought it some heat. I looked back at my previous review and my significant other ordered the same thing as he did last year. The Brasato Barolo (short ribs) which is a definitely a MUST try... very flavorful, melts in your mouth deliciousness. I decided to get the rack of lamb which was good, nothing extraordinary....a lil bit over done for the "medium" that it was supposed to be but I think I could pass it up next time. The best dish of the night was Antonio's Pasta. It was cooked in the glass jar shown in pictures with scallops, shrimp and the best fresh pasta ever! The flavors were just wonderful and I could have just had that for dinner and been content. We ended it with a wonderful chocolate souffle that wasn't overly sweet and paired well with the dolce latte flavored gelato. They also surprised us with a plate of truffles and a Happy Anniversary written on it....sweet touch to a great night.  Verandah's service has always been and still is attentive. Delicious food paired with great service makes it for a great night. They also know how to make a lemon drop martini like how this gal likes it....bonus points there since I've been highly dissatisfied with a lot of lemon drop martinis at other venues. I definitely will be back for more short ribs, etc.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. chocolate souffle
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. antonio&#39;s pasta
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. antonio&#39;s pasta

JvoBQSnp13nlPzcOZTyAMg.text: Had the breakfast buffet and french toast. Coffee was great! Requested outdoor seating and had a great experience. Would definitely go back for the overall experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clean plate!

FzIErkiuSExVoNTTq5r0IQ.text: My wife was here on business and the only two meals we took together were breakfast in the Veranda.  One day the buffet was set up, and it looked like it was very nice and had a lot of unusual items, but we don't eat enough any more to justify the "investment".  I had the corned beef & pastrami hash browns, which was very good and a bit unusual in that the hash was more like very tiny french fries.  It was much better than Carnegie Deli's (in LV or NYC), and reminded me more of how good the pastrami hash at Stage Deli used to be, although it's not the same, of course.  My wife had the tiramisu croissant, which was very good but is more like a dessert than breakfast.  We ate inside that morning, and the service was very good.  A couple of days later, we had breakfast outside, and it seems to take a while to get the waiter's attention and he was nowhere to be found a couple of times when we had a request.  My wife had the quinoa and muesle (or similar), and didn't expect the quinoa to be cold.  That was a bit unusual.  I had the eggs Benedict, which was quite good, but didn't come with toast or any other sides, which seems unusual as well.  My wife had coffee both days, and didn't remark one way or the other upon it.  I had herbal tea, as my metabolism can't tolerate caffeine, and for both of us there were pots placed on the table for us to refill from.  We didn't have the opportunity to try any other meals here, but we will if we stay at the Four Seasons again.

MvXHZx47sM6Fa3x9vEstrg.text: Favorite breakfast spot!  Service is awesome, especially Heidi! The food is fantastic, especially the huevos rancheros.

2XO8wGuycReyuLjQL06vLg.text: $6.00 for a cup of coffee. Why Four Seasons? Do you think as your guests we enjoy overpaying for things to a degree that approached foolishness? Check your bills here folks. There is such a thing called "value". What you get for what you pay.  This type of overcharging is nothing more than price gouging.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $6.00 for a cup of coffee. If they gouge you here where else do they stick it too you? There&#39;s a thing called &#34;value&#34;.

_4kKGKjJJMyCDxiWtiK7Og.text: This is simply the best outdoor place to eat in Vegas....the decor is relaxing, fresh, pool side, green, so soothing!! This is the best breakfast/brunch in Vegas! The LOX bagel are great as well.  The lunch caprese appetizer is the best caprese that I have ever had!! And I had many of them!! The fig appetizer was super delicious as well and light, love it!!  The service is quite possibly the slowest I have ever experienced...and I ate there couple times...too bad!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Thank God for this appetizer...fresh and tasty!

nBDWfoR_rEmUxO-Hkqimgg.text: I had pretty high expectations for this place, but I'm sad to say that i don't think I will be coming back for brunch. I ordered the Eggs Benedict with a regular biscuit instead of the polenta. They forgot to make the changes, but I chose not to say anything. There was no real flavor and the asparagus on my plate was dead and bland. The one thing I thoroughly enjoyed was the freshly made donuts. Delicious :) the service was good of course, it's the Four Seasons. My brother in law enjoyed his corn beef hash, but everything else was okay. Their buffet looked appetizing because of all the fresh fruit and pastry options. Maybe I'll try that next time...

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict

FfPKjADQp0GKVJZtVLFUtA.text: Peaceful, outdoor dining experience by the pool. Excellent service and the food is amazing. Great for brunch.  Afternoon happy hour drinks are cheap. Try their Dark and Stormy

8AZrWKT6DLwIRLkKx7KmNg.text: My favorite Sunday brunch place in Vegas. Leo is my regular waiter and I've been going here regularly for 15 years. Variety and quality of food is amazing and Bloody Mary bar to die for. Poolside patio ambiance is serene. Perfect place to escape and feel relaxed.

5KxtuPvoHXTGD70ODiTg5g.text: We were here for breakfast. Very good food, great service (typical for Four Seasons), selection if freshly squeezed juices. We will come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our breakfast. Everything was so good and yummy!
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict - hot smoked salmon instead of bacon.

dHMaegLHcp2RuUKJKsnqVA.text: what a classy hotel and beautiful inside! the breakfast buffet itself wasn't large but it had all the basics from french toast, eggs, frittata, fruit and more. Nevertheless the quality of the food was very good! i expected the eggs to be fast-food quality but to my surprise they tasted very good and were fluffy! fruit was very fresh. the frittata was a little overcooked. french toast was a bit dry but the raspberry sauce complemented it very well. they had cheese blintz...i was not expecting that and it was tasty. i couldn't pass down the house made doughnuts. they were awesome and by far the best i've ever had. had a nice little crunch to it and it wasn't too sweet. Staff was very polite and attentive. Beautiful patio by the pool but a bit too hot at this time of year. i was staying at another nearby hotel that was a little more than half a mile away and wish we stayed at Four Seasons instead.

Ypj2oZMtdpiWzytFxiI0BA.text: A perfect weekend brunch spot! The restaurant has a beautiful ambiance overlooking the pool. The food is exceptional, as is the service. Enjoy freshly made donuts and a mimosa! The Veranda will not disappoint!

-snLzqVkLKO-pvRlrl7B2g.text: I'm at a loss for words... What an incredible experience! The staff was more than professional and courtious! Particularly the staff at Veranda. Louie and Kieu "Q" went above and beyond and made us feel right at home. Good job guys! In my next visit to Las Vegas, I'll certainly be back! Thank you.

B1Th72-PruPs80PI49P7sw.text: I came here for the brunch buffet (offered on weekends only, 8am-1pm) with a group of girlfriends. Let me just say I haven't felt this gluttonous in a very long time all because of the high-quality foods that were offered. Buffets aren't usually my thing, but this one was worth my while. From a pescetarian standpoint, everything from the fresh squeezed orange juice to the scrambled eggs with smoked salmon was delicious. To top it all off.. Our server, Paul, was very friendly & attentive. If you're willing to spend a grip of money for a fancy brunch then visit Verandah at The Four Seasons hotel: $39 per person & there's an additional charge to include the Bloody Mary bar with your meal. Enjoy!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh mini waffles with maple syrup
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scrambled eggs with smoked salmon, scone with lemon curd &amp; mascarpone cheese blintz topped with a roasted apple glaze

6Ty8B1XnzGS4GGz6YScLwg.text: The best.  Just the environment is amazing    Food great service the best.   Nothing compares

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LJ-Q1adOVNtzHneb-fdhsw.text: Extremely disappointed in what is called a Sunday brunch. There was no brunch rather a breakfast buffet. For $40 a person there wasn't even eggs benedict. So many other buffets to chose from that I wish we had tried instead.

u0pND1W48HTd9n7oLhXqsg.text: So I called to ask if any seats are available the lady said yes inside only. So I was like fine whatever. Got here, there was a lot of seats available outside =T The service was a bit slow. Ordered coffee and that took a while =\ asked for balsamic vinaigrette took about 5-7 mins.It wasn't busy there was only a few tables.  The table in front of us left and I was just seeing how long it took them to clean the table. They didn't clean it right away. They cleaned it when we were leaving about 40 mins later. sigh   Ordered the Cobb lobster salad $26.00   Seafood mac & Cheese $20.00 & salmon sandwich with bacon etc for $24.00  The salad was ok =T had much better before. Nothing special to it. Won't remember it. The seafood mac & cheese was decent and light tasting. The salmon sandwich was heavy & greasy. The bread was nice and toasted but it seems like they put better or oil on it cause my hands was soo greasy from picking it up. The sauce and mozzarella cheese made it very heavy for my breakfast.  Yes my breakfast is most people's lunch =P I wake up late.   The food was nothing great and nothing that I will be recalling to come back. the service was nice and super slow which I didn't like at all. Also how you going to ask someone how everything is when you just put my plate down. I didn't even try it. And also if I said it's not good your going to make me another one? that I need to wait another 15 mins for =T Sshsh

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Bacon sandwich
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cobb lobster salad

95DGWPoLtqiFo-nwInl-Iw.text: Caught a bite, or rather, a full meal pre-flight and it was a fabulous way to round out our week of Vegas folly.  Love the secluded Four Seasons location, right around the corner of Mandalay registration, take the marble steps down & you're transported to understated elegance.  Two choices for dining: inside or alfresco, looking out into the private pool area.  Good: *Iced tea w/iced tea cubes *Lobster Salad, no lettuce, but so many ingredients, delicious & fresh *Greens Salad, lovely light dressing & loved the mixed chartucerie *Beef tartare, w/whole grain mustard, balsamico & micro greens *Salmon w/lentils & a wine reduction, rustic, seared perfectly  Alright: *Amuse, prosciutto & melon shooter, an interesting take on the traditional appetizer, the melon was in liquid form, too sweet for my palate. *Halibut w/sundried tomatoes & olives, fish was nice, but bland, tomatoes and olives were not a nice marraige w/the halibut.  I thought it was funny that their take home utensils are SILVER plastic.  Solid food, but I wouldn't go out of my way to dine here, it's not an experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Halibut
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Greens salad with chartucerie

KV5NSAFQXmNZ6MPgv7M83w.text: Brunched here with the trip group as soon as well all landed in Vegas and got ourselves checked in to our respective rooms/hotels, and it was pretty good :)  I'm vegetarian, so that's what I'm reviewing. I got the Grilled Portobello Parmesan, which if you get the portobello without the breading is egg-free, as I have an egg allergy. It's a decent grilled portobello mushroom and veggie patty, but nothing to write home about. I also couldn't resist getting a side of the truffle parmesan fries which normally come with the burger (and amounted to $8 worth of fries), and they were quite nice, if not particularly truffle-y; I really like truffle, so that was a little sad. My companions got a menagerie of items (there were 7 of us total), including the Chicken & Waffles, the Traditional Corned Beef & Pastrami Hash Skillet, the Chicken Angel Hair Pasta, and the Tuna Sampler. Everyone seemed pretty satisfied with their food, and the buffet looked pretty good, too (except that I probably could only have eaten like two things on it, so of course it made no sense for me to get that). One companion got a bloody mary as well and seemed pleased with that.  The service was lovely--our waiter was great looking things up for me and with making suggestions to group members who were on the fence about what to have. I don't think there's anything on the menu that would be vegan as is, but if you're vegan, I'm pretty sure your waiter here could work something out with the kitchen for you. It would be nice to see a vegetarian section (including a vegan sub-section and/or some markers for common allergens like dairy and nuts), but otherwise it was a lovely experience.  Overall, a tasty, if pricey meal, but if I were brunching in the area again, I'd certainly be willing to return :)

c-XH1tRaPkHZdx8Rh01PEw.text: Brunch HEAVEN! The buffet has all items on the regular menu and much more. The marscapone cheese blintzes are spectacular, all of the cheese station is top notch and the mini latkes are perfectly crispy with every bite! Perfect ambiance outdoors by the pool in the fanned breezeway and fabulous service!  Chill, peaceful gardens and no children. Mimosa and Bloody Mary menu also perfect.  100% perfect brunch choice!

gXG1agzlN-nRBp3leVoXhQ.text: I have been to Mandalay Bay many times and did not know this was here! Located in the Four Seasons Hotel, this is a great spot to get away from the hotel-casino scene. Had breakfast here with my parents and quality was excellent. Prices were reasonable as well considering location. I had the corned beef-pastrami hash with eggs over easy. Nice decandent treat. Not greasy and a huge portion. My Mother's Ricotta and Citrus Pancakes were excellent as well. My Dad had the vegetable Frittata and enjoyed it as well. Good coffee. They keep your pot refreshed on the table.  Added plus was the reading glasses that they had for my Mom! Will be back to try lunch and dinner on another trip.

t2j2zd8Jb5izOc1rsugKxA.text: I have had dinner and breakfast here and Service was always excellent and the food was perfect . Staff was very friendly and accommodating , I will be back for sure . Quite atmosphere and has a nice bar within.

ph3Zbs_Z5VuFl2-BbTPrjA.text: Located in the 4 Seasons Hotel, this is my favorite place to escape the loudness of Vegas, re-energize and most obviously, eat some delicious brunch. Verandah's menu allows one to either order a particular item for brunch or one can do the all you can eat brunch buffet. Although a bit pricey (I think it is around $50 with a mimosa), you definately get what you pay for with the buffet.  I have been coming here for years and have always had great service, my water, coffee and juice always refilled and my check handed to me at an appropriate time. I highly recommend the guava juice if they have it that day.  Some highlights of the buffet include: 1) omelette station that doesn't consist of a family of 5 pushing you out of the way and a really depressed omelette chef who burns your omellete; 2) delicious pastries including mini chocolate croissants; 3) flavorful apple sausage; 4) cheeses and charcutterie items; 5) fresh fruit galore; 6) and FRESHLY MADE MINI DONUTS :)  I highly recommend this place for brunch if you want a peaceful, quality brunch in a restaurant setting, and to avoid the crazy crowds at some of the Strip's more popular buffets.

W3llE8uhNMxx0MLWIYSyEw.text: Best service in town for breakfast. Great place to spend $50 on a cup of coffee and some toast. Ha ha.   Classy place to have breakfast and do business.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying the Veranda at Four Seasons.
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Enjoying lunch with Albert Cantong at Four Seasons.

wB_f3RlFFS0cpaZ1_ZFWGw.text: We had breakfast, lunch, and dinner here during our Vegas trip. My favorite meal here was breakfast.   As I mentioned in the hotel review, the smoothies/juices are to die for and they have a different flavor for the smoothie/juice of the day, daily. Their fruit was fresh and ripe and their scrambled eggs were cooked to perfection. I love their Bonne Mamman fruit preserves that they stock on all the tables, especially the raspberry. Yummy!   Coffee was awesome and if you're feeling daring their buffet is awesome and kind of a steal. I don't recall the exact amount per person but I think it was less than $40.    Lunch and dinner were fine here but honestly it was nothing especially wonderful. The tuna platter that they offer for lunch was tasty and I recall a wonderful wine selection.  I don't think this place can do any wrong. Staff is attentive and friendly as ever. Service is fairly quick, and if you eat outside (and you should) the view is fantastic.   Do it!

JHcP0FgCYGW_ElqhTgIJag.text: I had a business meeting here for their tea service, which was very near as good as one I experienced in London. Wonderful service, everything was delicious. I can't speak to other meals here, but if you'd like to do something special in the afternoon, I highly recommend having tea at Veranda!

b5noSSDI_FTqQPeZrs_JTw.text: i was not impressed.  i think the mistake i made was coming here for dinner instead of brunch.  i saw all the brunch pictures on the yelp page and assumed that their "pasta" and american selection would be fantastic.  this is slightly pricey, and with the ambiance, i thought the food was going to be melt in your mouth, hit you in your face, bomb dot com. unfortunately, it was not.  service was okay -- the host was super nice and friendly and escorted us to our seats.   i ordered a mushroom pasta, and for being a mushroom lover, it was the only thing i could taste.  the flavor overpowered the taste of anything else and it just didn't leave a good taste in my mouth.  my friend ordered the steak and i thought it was pretty good, but not worth the price or the hype.    def recommend trying a different restaurant when you're in vegas!

Mg1EnVrK77BUwkhoqbmepg.text: Service is top notch here. It's casual but they take really good care of you. To the point where your iced tea would have tea ice cubes so when it melts, it won't water down your tea! Their iced tea is really good too by the way.  I've had their breakfast/brunch buffet and afternoon tea here. The buffet definitely is a better value compared to the tea service. Although, the buffet is small compared to all the buffets on the strip, the quality is better. Where else can you make/get fresh peanut butter? The buffet is $40 and afternoon tea is $35 per person.  Afternoon tea was good but I enjoyed tea at Mandarin Oriental and Bellagio (Petrossian Bar) more.  In case you are wondering like I was before I went... if you are staying at the Mandalay Bay or Delano, you can charge your expenses here to your room. And the answer is YES if you are wondering about comps too.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Afternoon tea
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tea service
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tea for two

gikPHidmdERiZAcnRyh6CQ.text: We love to travel and we love food.   We also love nice people.  So this place is perfect. Probably best breakfast buffet ever, custom made donuts, an amazing array of delights and not over priced.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XnZEzGv-F5uif5loQYTEXw.text: Most items were tasty, not overwhelming with too many options, and ambiance you'd want for an intimate brunch experience. Outdoor and indoor seating, also helps to pay ahead of time so you get seated first! Omelette station, plenty of sides, pastry bar, and fresh donuts

Rrj38Fqn6KRSVv9DOgGW_Q.text: Veranda could use some help.  We were there for Sunday brunch.  Although the food was delicious, the service was lacking.  In some ways, the service tried to do what you'd expect from a restaurant in the Four Seasons.  In many other ways, it just missed the mark.    It's worth a trip because it really is a nice place.  I just hope they boost the service a little.    Also, don't waste the money on the "Ultimate Bloody Mary."  The only difference I could tell was a $4 shrimp and the drink itself wasn't that good.

nA1b2t9jp5pk659GXZrvJQ.text: I went with my friend Laurel before a day by the pool.  We were very full so we were tired.   I highly recommend this place for breakfast and brunch.  It's pricey, but as good as the breakfast spread we had at Hotel Du Louvre in Paris.   Very good poached eggs, French toast, cheese and proteins like bacon and eggs.

NqJGCXLYirfriNSpcOhRfw.text: We ate here for Sunday bruch and we're beyond happy! Great food and exceptional service. So worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wonderful brunch, and exceptional service we left vety happy.

HT-bAIoYTnRy9kXbsEQU1A.text: I do not like buffets. To me, I get the feeling of cheap, mass produced, and bland food.  That being said, I loved the Veranda brunch buffet. :)  I went with family not expecting much and was pleasantly surprised. There is a wide assortment of pastries at your disposal: danishes, coffee cakes, muffins, and all sorts of sweet treats. The fresh made donuts are top notch, and I definitely have to exercise restraint to avoid becoming Homer Simpson.  The breakfast items are great too. Scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, crispy hash browns, banana pancakes, and cinnamon French toast are all good. The meat selection and quality is excellent. Multiple types of sausages and bacon are great, and their bacon cheddar waffle with fried chicken is amazingly good.  I like to finish the meal with their bread pudding, which is delicious. Plus they have fresh juices that are really tasty. Today they had a watermelon lime juice that was perfect. Overall, this is the only brunch I have had in my life that I thoroughly enjoyed everything I tried.

oT9pIMlaykz9fouGOYAGGA.text: Veranda offers an excellent buffet-style brunch with an upscale twist on popular breakfast dishes and a few exotic pairings. Go!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

XSeUwhXmaiNX3IEj9Eu-Qw.text: If you're looking for a quiet place, this is it. Ask for a seat outside if you're doing the weekend brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

MRQMNUO3dAd0f4gmgmXTfQ.text: Very good food and really nice atmosphere. We dropped in for a mid-week lunch and sat outside. Our waitress Kieu ("Q") was friendly and happy to give us some recommendations. The Veranda has a nice lunch menu with everything from pizza, pasta, entree salads and sandwiches. I started with a glass of wine which Kieu poured from the actual bottle which is a nice touch.   We ordered the gorgonzola fries to start. I chose the Charlie Palmer steak sandwich and my mom and other half both went with the Sin City burger. The Sin city is a wagyu burger with white cheddar, bacon, avocado and a side of truffle parmesan fries. The steak sandwich was a NY strip with arugula and steak fries.   The chips were house made and described as being served with a  gorgonzola "fondue". As delicious as the chips were there needed to be more cheese. After the first few chips the rest had no cheese on them.   The burgers and steak sandwich arrived a short time after.  My steak was cooked perfectly and the bread was super fresh. The steak fries were a little too thick and dry. I absolutely loved the smaller fries served with the burgers though. They were crispy and loaded with truffle and parmesan flavor. Next time I will ask for those instead of the steak fries.   Unfortunately the food runner mixed up the burgers and my mom and other half got each others (one medium, one rare). They figured it out after a few bites so we flagged down Kieu. She was very apologetic and asked if we wanted it remade, which my other half did. She told us the chef said it would be 15 minutes so he decided not to wait. The burger itself was large and they both said the flavor was delicious. We somehow had a little room for dessert so ordered a piece of chocolate cake to share.   As we were waiting, Tessa, The Veranda manager came by to apologize for the burger mix up. Tessa was a delight to speak to and obviously cares about her guests happiness. She was kind enough to comp us the cake which was a very nice gesture. Overall we had a wonderful lunch and plan on returning for their weekend brunch.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate cake
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sin city wagyu burger
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. NY steak sandwich

W_ks6XCqH8MnJdkJTx2gPA.text: I took my mom here for their $100 (for two after taxes and tip) afternoon tea as an early Christmas present and she absolutely adored it! It was a lot of fun but it pained me to hand over my credit card. This isn't something I'd do often, but if you are into tea parties you should try it at least once.   The tea service setup is fun (but I was sad that the waiters were not wearing white gloves or anything; for that kind of per-person price they should've been playing it up like a scene out of "Downton Abbey") and semi-casual. There were lots of older socialite types as well as a few couples. You can opt to add a glass of champage or just go with the straight tea.   The tea menu is good, but I was sad that they were out of two of the teas (of course the one I wanted!) the day we were there. They should try harder to always have all the teas listed on hand; that really set a downer tone from the get-go.   We were presented with a tiered tower of treats: freshly baked scones on top, savory bites in the middle, then sweets on the bottom. The scones were INSANELY delicious. I wish we had a whole tower of just those. The clotted cream and preserves served alongside were some of the most delicious I've had anywhere, even in local tea houses in rural England.  The savory bites were good but not great. While they tasted freshly baked, some of the textures of the uniform pastry shells screamed "premade." The sweets were the worst of the bunch; we took just one or two bites of most of those.   The staff said they do change up the goodies that are offered, so you may have different edibles than we had. The staff was prompt, courteous, and kept our teapots filled with hot water.  One suggestion I'd have for the tea service: it would be nice if the restaurant tried to make it feel more special and/or romantic. Maybe have some live music or play classical music or curtain off a special area of the restaurant. A lot of ambiance was lost with the television over the bar blaring an NBA basketball game.   The tea service requires a 24 hour's notice reservation, so make sure you call ahead or stop by to avoid disappointment.

Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Jam, clotted cream and spreads served with their tea scones. Delicious!

IXjfUzoUtdDGBVZPBQOjxw.text: Me and my girlfriends loved this place the service was excellent as was the food The tea time looked wonderful  Amazing food  It was a great lunch spot  Very relaxed atmosphere and yes over priced because it is the Four Seasons  The food though is good quality  Went into the gift shop and went nuts

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5oJRt50KIbHBPaumLvhxbg.text: I was invited for lunch at the veranda and my expectations were pretty high since it was in the four seasons.  Looking over the menu and wasn't impressed at all. Nothing really exciting on the selection .  I ordered grilled salmon salad. I typically don't get fish at a restaurant because I always get disappointed at the way they cook it.  That being said, I requested that it be cooked on the rare side.  And it was absolutely amazing perfect. Also with the dressing on the side it was you that went beyond my expectations. The atmosphere was absolutely amazing and the service was incredible.   I will definitely be coming again. Even though the prices are kind of high for atmosphere and experience service and quality of food are some of the best.

XH7m9Qf4NCTPd3FQbIjhtQ.text: Greer food, great service ... in fact perfect service.  I don't know what I was thinking about gluten free tiramisu, it wasn't a highlight but I should have known better.   Recommend for a civil-quiet meal.

-mNn0fJRGRCkTE56zk4Ufw.text: I really enjoyed my dining experience at Veranda. I am a Las Vegas local that enjoys trying new restaurants. Veranda is definitely a Four Seasons restaurant. The service is top notch and the food is beautifully presented and very tasty.  If you are in town, you should take someone special to Veranda. Dress and expect to Impress!

M_LzjQEPwFucKdVDF5IHXg.text: A bit pricey but it is nice outside.  We weren't very hungry so we split a mushroom wood fire pizza.  It was enough for two women. And it was delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

31OO_G4kURLLgc6vESfVWg.text: We had a business lunch here today and I was very impressed by the service and staff. The food was good, I wasn't exactly wowed by my open faced crab and avocado sandwich but it was good. It was missing some spunk, maybe spice or salt, I'm not sure. I believe Javier was our server and he did an excellent job of answering all questions and even accommodated a few odd requests (that weren't mine). Lol I wish it would have been a nicer day outside because it would have been great to sit outside! Shucks. However, the decor inside was nice enough just a tad loud for business. I look forward to my next visit but I'll try a different main dish.

4-PeNyTagvvlze5V-vMc_g.text: Incredible service.  Food was superb.  Wine selection was excellent and can with generous pours.  Love this restaurant.    Ate here three times in four days.  Love love love this restaurant.    Sit in May's section.    -Jeff

LxLR9-SHyg12esal2Xgk7Q.text: Fantastic breakfast of Fried Chicken and Chive Waffles. Great to see Javier, our fav server.

Lv4yIwxK9YVAQPMZdjAaiw.text: I visited Verandah on Saturday, Feb. 8th and was very disappointed. My sister made reservations for 12:30 brunch and we showed up a half hour early and they were able to accommodate us (there were very few people there). The valet parking is free which was nice. We decided to sit outside since the weather was nice. We walked through the dining room and saw all the delicious food available through the buffet. We got seated in a remote corner outside.   When we sat down, we learned that the buffet was $40 (and even more if we wanted mimosas with it). For BRUNCH. I mean, yes it's Vegas, everything is overpriced and that's a common price. But this place is not in a highly trafficked area and is further south on the Strip, so I can't imagine why they think they should be charging that amount. We went out of our way to drive there when we could've easily found a better meal for the same price in or near our hotel (Cosmopolitan).  We decided to forgo the buffet and order lunch. We first ordered mimosas ($14 each! They certainly were not that good). A guy (not our waiter) came around offering coffee which, at any other restaurant, is complimentary, especially when we hadn't requested it and the cups they used were tiny espresso cups. When we got the bill, we saw they charged us $6 EACH - for coffee none of us even drank and was cold. $18 for nothing. So absurd.   My sister ordered sushi and was very happy with it. I believe it was tuna. My friend ordered a salmon sandwich that she also enjoyed, and that came with sweet potato fries. My meal, however, was severely lacking. I ordered the chicken pesto sandwich. The pesto aioli was too goopy and thick and not tasty at all (and I consider myself a pesto connoisseur). It came with tomato jam, which I had never tried before, and found it was too sweet (I would have preferred regular tomato or even sun dried tomatoes). I substituted mozzarella instead of the provolone which made it better. But overall the sandwich was just "ok" and I found myself scraping a lot of the toppings off and just eating the chicken. My sweet potato fries were BURNED. The waitress came over right as I said to my friends "these are burned" and pushed them aside and she didn't say a word, didn't offer to bring more... nothing.   The bill came - $125 for this mediocre lunch (before tip), including the overpriced coffees that we never ordered.  Considering how much they charge and the quality of the food, I would suggest finding another place for brunch (I can't speak for the buffet or breakfast). But if I'm going to be nickel and dimed, I at least want a good meal and decent drinks. I would not recommend Verandah.

GqdQW-qyvSKj-OyXQ_x1OQ.text: The weekend brunch here is unreal. We've gone three times in the past two years and are always very satisfied. We get the buffet and it's so worth the extra money. Hands down this is the best breakfast in Las Vegas. The Four Seasons is so refreshing and a great getaway from the craziness of the Strip. Make sure to use the Bloody Mary bar!

niRwQgNIMEpiaAvRHetB3A.text: We visited for my birthday yesterday, and this was not the same experience that we had months before.  The service was absolutely awful and near non-existent.  The waiter didn't come to check on us or refill our drinks.  I had to hunt for the waiter and flag him down to ask for every drink refill.  Half of our party ordered bottomless bloody marys, which were also difficult to obtain.  The waiter didn't know which vodkas were included, and didn't offer to find out and when I asked about the salted rim he simply said we don't have any today.  This was an absolutely shocking dining experience compared with our visit from 6 months prior.  I'm so disappointed because I used to love this place and rave about it to all my friends and yelp buddies.

O9pPfzq4D3evDmVDLSIdeQ.text: We come here for breakfast every trip to Vegas, on the way out of town.   I usually order off the menu, we usually leave on Mondays and I don't think they have the brunch ( but they might, I can't remember ) , but yesterday we left on Sunday and well... LET ME SAY !! the BRUNCH here is FABULOUS.  Here's why : they have a donut making station. Where they make little round donuts - with a hole, but any way you want. FRESH FRESH FRESH and mini, so you can pretend you aren't getting THAT FAT.  They had these guava pancakes that had a slightly pink tinge, and sound crazy but were very moist and almost creamy. The usual suspects are present - corned beef hash, eggs benedict, french toast, eggs, potatoes, 2 kinds of bacon etc... Some other not so typical stuff also, little personal tins of egg white frittata with veggies, veggie quiche mini's. Lots of nice pastries and bagels, cold cereal, fruit etc...  I think the price was about $40. AYCE. No alcohol included.   The atmosphere is nice. You can sit indoor or outdoor by the pool. This restaurant is inside the Four Seasons. Service is always good. Good OJ, the kind that tastes like a real orange. YUM.

phZbFXDjdhYsCgrUYJsBYw.text: As far as the old system of dining goes, Verandah would probably be considered a "5-star" restaurant. Fancy setting, high prices, impeccable service, etc. However in the new food era, it's not just all about being hoity-toity. To get high stars in my book you need to have good food, and provide some form of value proposition. Based on my breakfast at verandah, I'd have to say that A-OK is proper.   From entry to exit here, the service is beyond impeccable. They ask your name at the desk and you're subsequently greeted by name by every server that approaches you. Coffee is kept full, and it's white-glove the whole way. The setting is very pleasant - outdoors next to the Mandalay pool system - very elegant.   The food itself, however, leaves a bit to be desired. It's okay, but for the price it could be a lot better. I sampled a plate of huevos rancheros that cost about as much as a dinner entree would cost at a decent restaurant. $5 for drip coffee is beyond the pale. Overall it was up in the mid-$20's for a simple entree+coffee breakfast.   I guess I'm not someone who is willing to pay all that extra for exclusivity. Coming from Portland I want the food to be exemplary at that price - especially for breakfast, which is notoriously easy to prepare.   If you want a four-seasons experience, this is your place. If your main goal is good food, you may be able to do better.

pjHEhnzke8MGPDl7t30TmA.text: Located in the Four Seasons". Sitting outside in the Verandah is always nice. The service is great. The food is exceptional. Sundays brunch is awesome with a Bloody Mary build your own bar. Always look forward to dining when staying at the hotel

eQ-ylDSNVX-5wk_biknfdA.text: Yum!! Thanks to Yelpers I had a great breakfast every day here! We stayed at THEHotel at Mandalay and I used yelp to find a decent place to have breakfast. I'd recommend. They have a mimosa buffet breakfast on Sundays with an amazing bloody Mary! We ate here Sat and Sunday. Sunday had the omelet bar with premium ingredients (i.e. crab, asparagus) and each day they had someone making baby donuts and hand dipping them in front of you with different toppings! I want to go back!

JDaXBVDgvt4NUqlFDMIOVw.text: I would have to give 4 stars but I'm sure my husband would give 5 stars :) We've been there few times now and I really liked lunch there.  I haven't been there for breakfast though.  I always love the atmosphere of Verandah and the food is always good! For dinner though, I hope I will have something great because for some reason, I haven't had anything that I really liked.  But I still love Four Seasons!!!!

q02CKijmpy66uXJNEEmAzg.text: Verandah is a taste of the good life.  Located in the Four Seasons, the restaurant has a luxurious patio the nestled along the tranquil pool area.  They have a fabulous looking all-you-can-eat brunch on the weekends (was tempted just to try the doughnuts), but we opted for farm to fork menu items instead.  The eggs benedict is perfectly prepared, served over tender polenta cakes along with snapping asparagus spears.  The wife went with the corned beef and pastrami hash that had the best crispy potatoes available on any breakfast menu.
