The son got mini belgian waffles that he smothered in cinnamon butter and syrup.  The service was perfect and the atmosphere is far more relaxing than fighting the lines at the casino buffets.

Rg5dDtrsNedK5N1d7E2tIQ.text: Great place for Brunch Buffet! Highly recommended it! Great Food, Service, and Variety!

kRlYTzoFerqIOIP3keBEag.text: Pretty pricey for the tea service. It's kinda fancy, but the taste isn't quite there. I had the nutcracker seasonal tea which was very yummy. However, the sandwiches were just alright. As well as the petit fours. Though the sugar cubes was a nice touch, it's not for me. I haven't tried their regular menu though.

dhrTrOrSDyppefOgrV_VUA.text: Usually when I'm here, I get a table for one since I have work to do and they always put me in what I call "singles row." They seem to seat all the parties of 1 in the middle of the restaurant where there's a bench seating area with single tables. Fair enough. I especially like having lunch here. I try to get in one lunch per visit, just for this reason alone: ice tea ice cubes. Yes, just like Bonjour Cafe does with their ice coffee w/coffee ice cubes (yelp.com/biz/bonjour-fre...), this Four Seasons doesn't dilute their ice tea with regular ol' water ice cubes. Bah. That's for amateurs. Here, they bring you a glass filled with ice tea cubes and then pour in the hot ice tea, so you get full concentration and no dilution of a caffeine buzz. Their soups, salads and sandwiches are always nice. And if it's a nice day out, you can eat al fresco. Apparently, them changing out by white napkin for a black one because I was wearing black slacks was a big deal, because DK asked what the heck they were doing. I thought it was pretty common, but I guess not. Or maybe I've just been frequenting restaurants where they care about you not walking out looking like a doofus with white lint all over your white pants. This is the only Four Seasons I know of that has the ice tea cubes. So don't blame me if you go to another Four Seasons asking for this and they look at you all crazy-like.

JSOIn9qk681lqjj8k7Z9ug.text: I've been to some elaborate brunches over the years, but I think the weekend brunch here takes the cake. Over the top versions of just about anything you can imagine, from cheeses to waffles, omelets, fruits. Not cheap, but a great brunch.

ZSRNI8KqMpNkmAQ13mKyaA.text: This is a review specifically on the Afternoon Tea that the Four Seasons Verandah offers.  I attended this place with my mother to celebrate her visit to Vegas and I decided to take her to afternoon tea here.    Afternoon Tea here is offered from 3-4pm from Mon/Fri. Holy cow.  After that experience at Bellagio, this was just -wonderful.-  The view out into the gardens was beautiful.  Their current theme of decor was Lilies and they were everywhere, designed into beautiful arcs that hung gracefully in a festoon that was minimalist and graceful.  We had a single table by the window and it was just a must.  It was summer and everywhere we gazed out our glass windows was lush green, green, green.  It was so tranquil and a firm glass of serenity that you rarely can find in Vegas which, to a certain extent, I will be more than happy to pay a ton of money for.    Of course, being that was at one of the top-shelf properties here in Vegas, I knew going in that it was going to be not cheap.  But it wasn't outrageous and I didn't feel uncomfortable with the price.  The service was top-notch, the quality of the blend of tea, the scones and food was excellent, and I was very satisfied with the entire experience.    When someone asks me where the best Afternoon Tea in Vegas is, I respond with this establishment, if that says anything.  ***On my List of Afternoon Teas in Vegas, this is currently rated as #1.  Please check out my list of Tea Houses, both local and national to compare.**

vvrZr_bJkgpWGqj_XvZ4dg.text: Had the Signature Dish: La Pasta Cotta Nel Vaso which has Artichoke pasta cooked in a jar, scallops, calamari, langoustine, shrimp, tomato and basil. This was the most unique way for food to come to a dinner table - in a mason jar. It was worthy of the title signature dish!

yiJqWIUIg96XQXpPeWfwWg.text: They have a new menu and it's not as good as the last one.  Also our waitress had an accent and spoke WAY too fast for us to understand her despite being very lovely.  If she learned to slow down this would have been a 4 star review despite the less interesting menu.

5ON_CPM6NwroFqoJaEgfkQ.text: The food was very good! The tenderloin was cooked perfectly, so tender, and the sauce was amazing as well. Make sure to get tagliata style. The pasta in a jar was also delicious. The texture of the pasta was great and it was interesting how it was shaped. The branzino was also superb, maybe a tad bland but it was cooked very well and was very tender. Jose was very attentive and was a pleasure. He did an excellent job! I will certainly be back.

x5Tq7H7oozhd20qOCet6fg.text: This place is a retreat and you might forget you are in Vegas. I was excited by how many gluten free options they had! When I arrived they offered bread, of course I normally say no and mentioned gf and they bought me the yummiest toast and olive oil - I was in heaven.   My caprese salad was divine with some of the best fresh mozzeralla I have eaten since Rome and the selection of hairloom tomatoes - divine.  The mahi mahi fish tacos were also gluten free and simply delicious.  My server was attentive, funny and charming and even offered me a newspaper to read on the way to my table as I was dining alone.  A lovely venue and highly recommend.

CWHRirrA-OLj8czhUbFJug.text: Great service from all in the establishment, and delectable food. We went for an early lunch and sat outside on the lovely veranda. Loved the lemon ice cubes in the tea!

3lc1xb7G0qOjf8XSuGcZyA.text: Came here twice, once for their afternoon tea and the other for breakfast (a la carte off the regular menu, not their buffet brunch).  It was my first time having afternoon tea service so I didn't have anything to compare it to but can say that I liked it.  First of all, it was so cute and girly as there were several parties of mothers and their young daughters that afternoon.  What a fun idea for an outing!  As for the tea and food, overall it was all very good.  I asked the waiter if he could suggest something fruity for me and really liked what he picked out.  (I'm pretty sure it was the Mountain Berry Tisane.)  The sandwiches and scones/spread tasted great!  Must admit I wasn't too crazy over their dessert, though.  Some of it was actually dry.  The next day we came back for breakfast and ate out by the pool.  It was a hot day but clouds and misters helped keep us cool.  The atmosphere was amazing!  Totally recommend eating out there.  The food was average.  Not the best breakfast food I've had but not the worst either.  (Surprising but restaurants can actually do bad breakfast food!)  It was also pretty expensive, maybe $30 for my order.  But then again it's the Four Seasons and you're paying for atmosphere as well.  I got The American - eggs, hash brown, choice of meat, bread, and juice.  I forgot what juice I had but whatever it was it was so delish and refreshing!    I really enjoyed both of my visits so four stars for Verandah!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Scones and sandwiches were great!  Dessert not as good though
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The spread was good too
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great scones!

MtlkwnUynUAnWx032wANqQ.text: Lunch today was fabulous. The shrimp tacos were out of this world Service was fantastic We had an amazing experience. Definitely going to be a day after Xmas tradition.

2xRbCkXJfTsHN86eM37YrQ.text: I was not impressed with this place during my last visit. My husband and I showed up for breakfast on a saturday morning. The male hostess was acting way too important on the phone to acknowledge us. After a 5 minute wait we were sat.   We both did the buffet. The scrambled eggs were ice cold, the cold cuts tasted like they had been out days, and in general nothing was spectacular.   I've eaten here before and it was excellent. So I was very surprised that the food quality was not up to par this time.   While fixing myself a bagel, a staff member was wiping down the sneeze sheild in front of me. Don't get me wrong I'm totally for cleanliness, but I was losing my appetite watching her do it right in front of my plate.   The service was also slow which always surprises me at restaurants with buffets because their job is so easy.   I love the four seasons but I don't plan on eating here again.

ez_DcDF6O0cAIHZ6332CqA.text: I can't say enough nice things about this place. The Veranda was my quiet get away hide out away from the convention. My boss and I came here for lunch, and I went for breakfast the following two days. The service is awesome, the waitstaff is very friendly, and the food is great with a unique touch. The food is so good that if you ask the servers what their favorite dish is, they will all say something different. What a great spot and I didn't even have to drive anywhere. My waiter even packed my coffee to go, and asked me if I wanted my milk steamed. They really go the extra steps here.

stET_uv4RoitdVX5glAjNA.text: We've been here more than a few times for brunch and I think the quality has gone down. Have done afternoon tea as well, and although I enjoyed it, not sure its worth the $$. Can't say I'm a fan anymore...

9CI7BIwKJ7heiCv2yygDIw.text: I made reservations for High Tea today. I was highly impressed with Jonathan that took the reservation. His genuine customer service level was exemplary and should be noted. I had previously tried to make reservations at other establishments who would not accommodate a single person. This was not the case at Veranda. They were welcoming and Jonathan explained the tea menu and showed the location within the restaurant. A successful tea is all about atmosphere. You guys set the tone for a great experience. I highly recommend this establishment.

4m_asfFO8BOVwwBC7KQojA.text: Review for Sunday Brunch. Had long been on my brunch list, was saving it for a nice time of year so we could sit outside.   Upon walking in I immediately noticed a donut station. What! I've been on a donut kick lately and I'm usually not a fan. When we sat, our server went over the menu and told us we had the option of buffet or a la carte. I couldn't decide at first, there was a lemon ricotta pancake that had caught my eye on the a la carte menu, but the donut station sealed the deal for me.  I was impressed with the different buffet station, lots of different parfaits and yogurts, an omelet station, and they had all small plates so you could sample a little bit of everything. They also had a pastry station with a spot to make your own homemade peanut butter.   Everything we had was really good. I would bump this up to 5 stars if they offered a bottomless mimosa on the menu. They had a bloody mary bar, but not all of are fans.   This brunch buffet was way better than the Country Club at the Wynn, almost half the price. I totally recommend.

mkkL1nyPP_xH7N8Ad-3IIA.text: There were 13 of us at the veranda last night and we had a great time. The service was excellent and the wait staff very attentive. The corkage fee was $35 a bottle and we had 3 bottles but they only charged us for one. The food was excellent and we also had numerous appetizers. The wine was pricey that's why we brought our own. The food was excellent but again on the higher side.

4Q-nVwNuKXHxU4lH5YmljA.text: Four Seasons is a beautiful property for starts. Service and experience in every area are expected to be above top notch. I requested to be seated at the poolside patio. Which we were promptly. After being seated it took us between 5-7 minutes to be greeted by someone. In that timeframe I did notice multiple servers look in our direction but not come to acknowledge us.  When we were greeted it seemed our server was not enthused to have new guests dining. We ordered drinks and food all at once since we had been unwillingly given the time to do so. Waters took awhile, speaking of, the bus person was the kindest interaction we had. I believe his name was Jose, very polite and genuine. The coke and raspberry tea we had ordered took some time , but were kept filled  after they arrived on a positive note. Bread service arrived about 2 minutes before our entrees made there way. Disappointing because it wasn't anything special. Just a stale white loaf with a hard side of plain butter. My tomato soup was quite good. The rest of the entrees were subpar. I have a hard time believing real Wagyu beef is used for the burger, and the bun was nothing special. Caesar Salad dressing was nice , however the chicken added was bland and seemed not freshly prepared.  I understand restaurants on the strip have unionized food servers. But sometimes maybe they get to comfortable and forget how to provide a positive experience.

V1EZSMguXSBa9daJKCJuSQ.text: Great brunch!  We had brunch at Veranda Sunday. We both chose the brunch buffet. The food here is good quality. I enjoyed everything I had. The service was great. Our coffee and water cups were never empty. We will return.

ucruT2ywG7RXhLRSWVVpLw.text: Unimpressed. The food is mediocre in my opinion. My husband really likes it but I wouldn't return for breakfast. We shared the Club omelette and the S'Mores French toast. Now quite S'mores but looked better than it tasted. The hash browns and omelette were bland. Maybe lunch is tastier.  I will say that the service was great!

yqaeuoUY7ztT8CkSDukdyA.text: Whenever you think Four Seasons you think quality right? Right! Well the Veranda is no exception the food was great and the staff was superior.   I brought my wife for her birthday to enjoy a nice brunch with a bottomless Bloody Mary and Mimosa. I made reservation the day prior and the girl on the phone was extremely nice and helpful.   From valet to the front door every staff member makes you feel so important and appreciated which make you love where you're at. The Veranda is tucked in the back corner next to Charlie Palmers stake house with a newly renovated out door patio. The patio offers a great view of the pool and beautiful comfortable furniture to either lounge or enjoy your brunch on out doors. We chose to dine indoors because of our new born.   Inside, the classic decor give off a very comfy vibe and dinning room was nicely lit. We did the Sunday brunch which is $39.99 per person which includes drinks and the bottomless Bloody Mary is an extra $20.00 I think. As you walk in they have an awesome omelette bar and a mini donut station. The food were delicious and very nicely set you.   They had more then enough variety of yummy food to choose from. After everything they even brought out a plate of sea salt chocolate truffle that said Happy Birthday and it was so good and nice of them.   A great brunch spot for locals and you feel like a king for a great price! I will defiantly be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My creation of Bloody Mary
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini skillets yummy
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh fruits

W7p6LaoLcQ3Kp9dkRg3Yzw.text: Breakfast here is amazing. The weekend buffet has so many options and are all really great quality. The highlight of the buffet was the donut bar - all donuts are made in front of you and you can customize them based on what kind of toppings you'd like. They also had a lot of holiday specialties at the buffet. As far as the a la carte menu I loved the avocado toast with poached eggs.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Avocado toast, coffee, fresh fruit

GIgo68-Dw_phSBVFQBxTmg.text: We had a lunch meeting here next to the Mandalay Bay Convention Center which was very convenient. We sat outside with a view of the pool which was so inviting. I ordered a burger with sweet potato fries. It definitely hit the spot. The ladies had salad, crab tostini  and theirs was very good as well.  Giving a four stars because I have had better burger before but love the ambiance, service and location which is next door to Convention Center.

x-NjhfMlMFoRVilNdGV-nQ.text: The lunch stared off with a pesto caprese heirloom tomato salad, fresh mozzarella and tasty tomato and they even split it for the two of us. The shortrib was requested with a soft polenta substitute for the regular mashed potatoes, and this combo would be hard to beat, very tender large boneless shortrib slow braised with lots of flavor throughout and a nice crisp outer layer, sitting on a bed of perfect polenta with a few root veggie cubes. The lobster tail tagliatelle was  very good with a fresh grilled tail that was tender, but a touch salty. Service from Jose and Harjut was excellent.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Shortrib on polenta
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lobster Tail Tagliatelle
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lPTIqIjPLg9EMttmiSyiMw.text: This is a great spot for a business meeting. Although on the pricier side, you won't be disappointed. We sat inside, but from the looks of it, sitting outside would still be a nice environment for a meeting. All around, it's a nice spot to enjoy good food, good service and hopefully nice weather.  The service was excellent and the wait staff was very aware of our needs - we were spoiled! The soup of the day was mushroom when we went and it was excellent - everyone at our table had a cup. Portions for the lunch menu were manageable, too, not overwhelming.   Located in the Four Seasons at the south end of The Strip, Veranda's staff meets the standards that I would expect at a location like this. They went above and beyond and that was just for lunch. I would love to enjoy an evening meal here.

Zm9xDm8DjgMOJQZp_m8A-A.text: There aren't a lot of dining options at Four Season LV but at least what they do have tastes good! We tried out Veranda for both the breakfast buffet and the regular dinner and we were pretty happy both times.   Dinner: The service was top notch and in particular, our server (I forgot his name but he was a blondish man in maybe his 40s) couldn't be nicer and more accommodating. The portions were larger than I expected. We split a Caesar salad and it was a generous portion. My husband had the shrimp pasta and he said it was one of the best pasta dishes he's ever had (and he's a pasta fanatic). I had the braised short ribs and every bite was super tender and melted in my mouth. We also tried the dessert that included four ice cream bars (made in house - caramel ice cream coated with chocolate and nuts) and they were delicious and just perfect for sharing. My toddler's pasta with red sauce was a very generous portion and he enjoyed his scoop of gelato as well. The setting is "fancy" but they were great with our toddler and had a coloring book with crayons available.   Breakfast: You can either order off the menu or do the buffet and we opted to do the buffet, which is priced about the same as other more high-end resort buffets. What I liked about this is that the food was pre-portioned into single servings so things like bread pudding didn't look all gross after a few people have dug into it. The options include: corned beef hash (with shoestring potatoes), peach pancakes, egg florentine, hash browns (actually, this was a bit salty), bread pudding, scones, house smoked salmon, bacon, sausages, lots of pastries, some kind of quinoa chia pudding, oatmeal, yogurt and granola parfait, omelet station, melon slices, mixed berries, and even more things that I can't remember. There was also a kids station (kids height) with breakfast sandwiches, fruit kabobs, vegetable sticks (with dip), and jam sandwiches.   The coconut mango Greek yogurt flan was AMAZING. (I need the recipe!) I don't like yogurt but this was not tart or yogurt-y. The mini donuts, which is what everyone talks about, are delicious and made fresh. I recommend the cinnamon sugar one which tastes like a churro.

-_VIhrWR7oo4_aHC_ApMPw.text: (Short version) Absolutely amazing experience. Come eat here right now.  (Long version) Just dined here with my girlfriend last night and it was one of the best meals of my life. We don't typically spend this much money on fine meals but I can say with full confidence it was totally worth it. I highly recommend their "Taste of Italy" pre-built three course meal with the matched wine tasting. Service was super friendly and made sure we were fully satisfied every step of the meal.

iGhVnSblUY3OsJQykc-b4w.text: This review is for their weekend brunch. First of all, this could possibly be the most family friendly restaurant on the strip. Children get a coloring book, souvenir cup, and they even play cartoons if you need that to keep children still.   The brunch is $39 and for a Four Seasons restaurant, its a very reasonable. Children are $16. Most items come in individual serving dishes and the highlight is a donut maker that will customize to your taste.   Highlights of items include rustic cut corned beef hash skillet, red quinoa cereal, chicken apple sausage, applewood smoked bacon, chilaquiles, florentine eggs benedict hollandaise, mascarpone cheese blintz roasted apple glaze and ricotta pancakes. You can also choose an unlimited bloody mary bar.   Unlike many Vegas strip buffet, they do take reservations, so use Open Table to make guarantee seating, because it gets busy here.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Individual Fruit Serving.
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red Quinoa Cereal
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh made donuts!

CMk9MBIZX1U4xpt-EaWhYQ.text: There are honestly a limitless number of breakfast/brunch restaurants to explore in Vegas and it can be difficult choosing between them. There are some that I say are undeniably above the rest and while Veranda may not be one of those select few, it is still incredibly good.  The setting is great and I don't know if there's a better outdoor seating environment on the strip than overlooking the pool at the Four Seasons. It is a casual restaurant experience which is great for when you roll out of your bed but it also feels like a country club. The prices also reflect that feeling. It is not exuberantly expensive by any means...it is also not IHOP.  -Smores French Toast. Obviously delicious and something that could kill you upon first consumption. Probably worth it though.  -Breakfast Panini. Super good. Won't destroy your stomach but still has a lot of flavor and tastes healthy which is a plus even if it is most likely a lie. Burrata tomatoe spinach pesto eggs etc. It all works.  The fruit plates and the pastries are also nice and fresh. It's hard to describe the intricacies of a medium to high priced breakfast cafe but you should reasonably know what to expect. I am the kind of person that has never been blown away by breakfast food no matter where it is, except Border Grill but more on that later. For a relaxing breakfast at a cafe it's hard to get better than this.

T8CfjjmFiSxJaUGcJm8t8w.text: Happened to be here during restaurant week - they had a set menu option - the food was fabulous - only one Pinot noir option by the glass but it was excellent. All around one of the best meals I've had in a long time. Also, the Four Seasons is an oasis of sanity in the world of Vegas - very relaxing meal and great service. Thinking about eating here every night ...

wbS9r0XpY4575L2vE9DVbw.text: Just ate brunch here it's amazing and worth every penny. Make sure you try the homemade doughnuts and french toast.

U1I5IBlBBdwUWEtJc12zSg.text: After all the drinking, gambling, bright lights and pounding music on The Strip, afternoon tea at the Four Season's Verandah is just what we needed. The place is so lovely, quiet and relaxing it's almost like not being in Vegas at all (which sometimes is a good thing.)  We opted to have champagne with our tea (why stop drinking now?) and chose the Organic Assam tea which was amazing! Also amazing are the scones, with and without currants. Super light and delicious. The sandwiches (there are four) are all good, but only the smoked turkey stood out to me. We were sadly underwhelmed by the desserts. I think the mango tart was the best of the bunch.  Service is fabulous - unobtrusive while still being attentive.

juwQgMWZxFz6Ctc0xZ9g8A.text: This review is based on the service, not so much the food. I'd made reservations months in advance for my birthday. I've been to London & love their Afternoon Tea, and wanted to do something similar with my friends. From the reviews, I thought Verandah would be a perfect fit. We arrived early & were told we had to wait until 3pm. Waiting 15 mins was fine. We were taken to our table shortly after 3pm, and served water. Then we waited. And waited. And waited. It was 20 mins before anyone took our tea order.  Now...the place was NOT busy. Our table of four was the biggest table they had in the room we were in, and the front room had maybe three tables. What really bothered us was the table of two that came in several minutes after us for their tea, that was served before us. Um...not cool. My friend's water glass was empty several minutes & several waiters rushed past us so fast we couldn't flag them down to ask for more. I contemplated getting up to serve her water myself, but finally a slower moving waitress walked past & I was able to ask for water.  I realize the experience is supposed to be a relaxing one, but when you can't keep water glasses full & you're serving tea and food to people who arrive later than your other customers, that's just not the service I would expect from the Four Seasons.   The food was pretty good, though. Which is a pity because we won't be going back.

NWoCiZmveQqWMwxWfPSXZw.text: $10+ for oatmeal w/fruit?  Really?  Yes.  It does come with a generous portion of milk.  The oatmeal condiments were nicely served on a rectangular plate:  a perfect cube of brown sugar, a dash of cinnamon and a pile of currants.  Fresh fruit choices were mixed berries or banana.  Service was good, restaurant was drafty.

hxwyFsE2EWwOYplIegedjw.text: Wow. What a delight. Fantastic food and amazing service. We had our two energetic little boys with us and the staff treated them like they were their own. We'll definitely be back!

c-jnxXDSGnT0jbUNLROdVQ.text: Brunch.  Classic and done very well.  Great location for brunch, and if it's a nice day the outdoor seating is fantastic.  Located in the Four Seasons this is just good food. Everything you would expect from a weekend brunch. Also, they serve their ice tea with ice tea ice cubes and liquid sugar, so you know they are for real.

3FPavB2Xcz36Jtzk7qkhhg.text: I booked Veranda for a post-wedding luncheon for 16 people, sight unseen but having read these reviews I went for it. Our group was staying at Mandalay Bay, and it was very convenient.  Additionally, the menu was very appealing, the people I worked with were friendly, and the price was more than fair. When the time came to actually indulge, we were treated to a spectacular meal. The appetizers, entree and dessert were the highlight of the afternoon, and the service was outstanding.  I couldn't have imagined a better reception lunch than the one we got at Veranda and I give it my highest recommendation. Five stars all the way around.

YrBXnN7to_Bnxvm-QZh47g.text: We dined here this past Sunday to indulge in their Easter Bunch which was absolutely decadent.  The selection and the caliber of the food was divine as unlike other buffets every item was fresh and flavorful.  The service was exceptional as every waiter was attentive yet not too intrusive.  My toddler loved the Easter Bunny as well as being able to roam around the outside patio, yet none of the staff complained as rather they were very warm and entertaining.  We would definitely return for their regular weekend brunch.

HUKU_l9KMiYI4LodX-e4yQ.text: *** Breakfast review ***  Simple formula for the 5 star review here --- superb setting and a legendary huevos rancheros.   As someone said -- "This is simply the best outdoor place to eat in Vegas....the decor is relaxing, fresh, pool side, green, so soothing!!"  Indeed. So relaxing, fresh, clean, quiet --- a stark contrast to the rest of Vegas.  The coffee was perfect and I am a picky coffee person. Service was good and not in your face at all. But the best part was the main.  Huevos rancheros. A relatively straightforward dish. Made differently at a lot of places. But this sets the standard. The plate came out piping hot, the flavors mixed together so well, and the presentation was superb.  Let me put it this way --- I eat out a LOT and am blessed to try some amazing places. I rarely have something I remember vividly later. The duck at the Modern in NYC, the cashew chicken at Ryutenmon Tokyo, the sushi at Kaygetsu here in in Menlo Park --- and now the huevos rancheros at Verandah Vegas. Well done guys, thank you for a great meal.

tA4nwUuyC4yHbfUI8H926w.text: Tonight, five of us dined at Verandah. This is usually one of my favorite places to dine since it seems like it is miles away from the strip. The food is great yet a little expensive. I guess that is to be expected since it is the Four Seasons Hotel. One of the reasons I like Verandah is because they are on OpenTable.com. That usually makes it very easy to have a space reserved between classes at the conference. Sometimes lunch time during a conference with 20,000 people can be a challenge. Open Table reservations make that challenge easy to overcome. But tonight the hostess did not credit my Open Table reservation. Instead she canceled it. I tried to explain to her that I did not cancel my reservation we just came an hour early since one member of our party had to get to the airport. It became difficult for something that should have been so easy. While the food was good, and the service was good, the experience was a little frustrating. However, I will give them a chance to make it better next time.

bGMDCXQtrwvoFzd7aSX0bQ.text: A brunch at Verandah feels much like a brunch in a southeast asian resort.  With palm trees swaying gently overhead, and the predominance in southeast asian servers, with white stones and thatched dark wood elements, it quickly makes one forget that one is in north america at all.  While pricey, it's not to be unexpected.  My hash browns, eggs benedict, iced tea, orange juice, bacon and coffee were all to my liking.  As well as the champagne as appertif.  I honestly enjoyed relaxing out in the sun inordinately well.    When one does the math, heading out to LV instead of say, Bintan island, really is more cost effective...  Sort of.

b9JCr7a-0xK5hts85vJDpQ.text: I love the atmosphere of the Four Seasons, it really feels like a home away from home, if my home was more fabulous. I've had both breakfast and lunch here. Breakfast was a better experience for me. The coffee is the best I've had in Vegas, and served in a french press.   My only disappointment with my lunch time experience is that my sirlion burger was overcooked. The truffle parmesan french fries were tasty and served in a little cone (which I knocked over repeatedly)

ZUjCxnMb5BvBhk_QRxFF6w.text: Verandah is always a lunch stop when I'm in Vegas. The restaurant itself is nice, with a patio overlooking the pool area. I like that the restaurant is quiet, a nice change of pace from the typical noise of a casino restaurant.   The only thing I order here is the burger. It is cooked exactly to order, juicy even if you have the nerve to order it well done. The truffle oil fries are good, though I must admit that I've had better. But overall, one of the best burgers to be had.   The chicken noodle soup is also good, very homemade tasting. The ice tea ice cubes are really cool the first time you see them and useful too. Makes you wonder why more restaurants don't do it.

ZVoX65BkaRN0Sr349QEbOg.text: My favorite place for brunch in Vegas. The Cranberry ricotta pancakes are a must, superb service, food.  As ironic as it sounds, you almost don't feel like you are in vegas when you dine at Verandah. And that is much needed at times during my LV stay.

Gjje-M1ogF2mzhJo41hu-A.text: Afternoon tea in the Four Season Hotel, Monday-Thursday 3-5pm.  Scones with devonshire cream, strawberry preserves and lemon curd.  The scones are small, silver dollar sized and so flaky and you can ask for more.  The wait staff's attention to detail is very good, I wore black slacks, they gave me a black linen napkin instead of the usual white, so there wouldn't be lint on my pants.   4 different  tea sandwiches and 4 different desserts on a tiered  serving dish.  Each person gets their own choice of tea.  Around $30.  Beautiful atmosphere in the Verandah, both dining inside and out, next to the pool.  Downstairs from the main lobby. Four Seasons hotel is attached to the Mandalay Bay Hotel

wG7N2f2ldQBGDHH4BJe6WQ.text: Four stars for Lunch and Two for dinner for an average of three.  Don't be confused by the location, this "restaurant" is really an over priced hotel cafe.  The Lunch is very tasty and a nice change from most Vegas lunches.  At dinner, however, the kitchen deludes itself into believing that it is a top rate dining establishment.    If this place would realize that it is what it is, I am sure it could be a great all around cafe.  One thing that the Strip is definitely missing.

wwdNpjLas2AtuuppjdKjjg.text: We had a wonderful dinner at Verandah while staying at the Four Seasons.   The service was outstanding and the food was great.  It was a very relaxed atmosphere and a nice way to end the day.   We enjoyed dinner so much, that we had breakfast at Verandah the next day.  Breakfast was good plus the coffee was great.  We plan to dine here the next time we are in LAS.  However we must disclose that our meals were complementary through Four Seasons Hotel.

EkNm6QE04aF6bXV1h0Z1Uw.text: We came here for Brunch on a Saturday with a rather large party.  When I looked at the menu I didn't see anything that stood out.  It featured typical salads, sandwiches etc...I ordered the Chicken Panini and It was probably the best damn sandwich I have ever had! Everything was extremely fresh and had a sassy flair to it. The wait staff were extremely attentive and even offered to take pictures of all of us!

O9TI0sGWyIis1S958wHB8Q.text: Great service and amazing bartenders! Ate at the bar as I was on a business trip and dining solo and got the royal treatment. Food was outstanding and the attentive service was best in class. Ask for Nick at the bar for a specialty cocktail and the best mojito you've ever tasted!

nxflV_DlnOHFgK4VB1UNtQ.text: High Tea or Afternoon Tea Veranda at the Four Seasons  Valet is the only method of parking if you drove. Valet parking can be validated if you dine.   Reservations only.  Open M-F from 3PM to 4PM  $35 High Tea $50 Champagne Tea  Pinky finger must always be up   My bestie and I had so much fun! (We mostly entertained ourselves.)  The scones were traditional English style scones that were flaky and buttery. There was Devonshire Cream, Raspberry Jelly, and Lemon Curd to top it off. The finger sandwiches, sesame and beet cones were savory. The bite-sized desserts were very good. This season, they had an Oreo Candy Cane Cheesecake. The menu also had remnants of fall with pumpkin and maple. As much as I do appreciate seasonal menus, I was over the fall pumpkin spice and the Christmasy candy cane flavors.   The menu changes with the season. We will try again in the spring/summer.   The tea I had was the Organic Assam, delicious with a bit of sugar and milk.   I've had High Tea in Toronto and my friend in Cape Town and abroad. We are going to try the ones at MO and Wynn as well. So far High Tea at Veranda was good, but ranked low on our personal lists.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

no2dJ8VbRrvlgyhVzv9fvQ.text: If there were more stars as an option, I would give Veranda 10 stars! My husband and I had an amazing experience both at lunch on Saturday and breakfast this morning. Everything is served hot, fresh, and delicious! Paul and Javier are awesome. They were attentive, warm, and made sure everything we ordered was just right.The decor is chic and airy.You want to stay and enjoy the food, ambiance, and good conversation. You have the choice of dining outside ( the fans were a nice choice) or inside where the AC is perfection! We really appreciated being greeted so warmly by the hostesses upon entering and Mr. Todorovic ( the general manager) was kind enough to give us a personal greeting this morning. He remembered us from the day before. WOW! Customer service at it's best. I HIGHLY recommend Veranda @ Four Seasons for a wonderful dining experience from beginning to end.

DFcghI9yQEqHZ9h1FeRrrA.text: Had afternoon tea service here. This is one of the best high tea locations in Vegas. Everything done very classy. Limited times (3-4) and days of the week.  Both plain and currant scones with strawberry preserves, clotted cream and lemon curd. Nice assortment of finger sandwiches, and four different bite sized desserts (as if scones with clotted cream aren't enough).  Weren't able to finish everything, so they boxed up what we had left and also included clotted cream  lemon curd to go (along with a few extra scones). Typical top notch service you would expect from a Four Seasons.  If you are celebrating anything in particular (eg. Anniversary, birthday), make sure to let them know and they bring out a plate celebrating your special event along with some truffles. And if you have a non tea drinker at the table, the bottomless hot chocolate with fresh whipped cream is delicious.  Only complaint is that they ended up seating a party in the tea area which was just ordering from the bar menu and they were a bit boisterous. Would suggest that they seat then in the non tea areas during tea service.

J79FR1LS6--4ApYQ3AwDGQ.text: 4.5 stars.  Weekend brunch buffet! $39 per person + tax gets you unlimited coffee, juice, and everything on the buffet line.   I've been to about 5 buffets on the strip, and this is by far my favorite one. The selection might not be as vast as others, but it's just done so much better in terms of food quality. Everything is just fresher.   Items include: - Fresh baby donut station (my mom says they're good only when hot) - Omelet station - Plenty of sweet, fresh fruit like segmented grapefruit, orange, sweet berries, and sliced melon - Egg frittata, small quiche Lorraine - Unlimited thick cut bacon, two types - Really good chicken and waffles - Breakfast pizza - Big bakery item selection (this actually didn't look particularly appealing to me)  They do charge for parking. Since my brother is M Life Gold, we parked at Mandalay and took the connecting hallway over to Four Seasons.   Tips:  - For when the weather is nice, make a reservation to sit outside on the shaded patio.  - If you get full fast, share a couple of items with your table so that you can split bites and still try everything. This worked out great for our family of 3, and we just went back for more of what we really liked!

0aEEohOdITHwUUbKu7ayuA.text: Overall: DO NOT go on a holiday, good food with a few exceptions, no alcoholic drinks included.   Price is $39 for brunch on a regular day and $80 on a holiday.   We had some difficulties with this restaurant which I'll get to later, but first I'll talk about the food. We made reservations for Sunday brunch, and it happened to be Father's day, so we are unsure if it was a different menu or not but the menu seemed comparable to what was online. There were several stations: one more focused on breakfast with egg dishes, bacon, yogurt parfaits, etc., and these were all very good. The candied bacon was excellent in particular. There is also a small kids table. Next, there was a sushi/fish station. We enjoyed the tuna and salmon glasses but the sushi was not fresh, and I had one bite before giving up on that. There is a cheese and charcuterie selection as well, with mostly blue cheeses which were not my favorite but they seemed to be good cheeses overall. We loved the dessert station with dessert non-alcoholic martinis, cakes, cupcakes, and freshly make mini-donuts (skip the ones with the frosting, it's too sweet). There was an avocado bar oddly placed outside the restaurant; some people were even eating it while waiting in line. It seemed like anyone walking by could get some. The avocado bar was nice though; we tried the crab avocado toast. By the pool was a barbeque area with an Asian station with lovely duck buns, a taco station which also was good, and a meat section. The meat section had a large beef rotisserie which was dry and chewy and seemed like the meat had been there for a while untouched. I would skip out on this meat as well. They also have several fresh juices they bring to the table.   So overall, we did enjoy the food. When we thought we were paying the $39 for the buffet, we enjoyed the food and overall experience even though some food was a little less fresh than desired.   Next, we get to my issue with the place. When I made a reservation, I received an email confirmation saying we were confirmed for my specific date (which happened to be father's day) for the price of $39 per person. I was traveling with my boyfriend and mom and it never really occurred to us that it was Father's Day or that anything would be different since the email confirmation stated the price was $39. When we got the check, it says $80 a person - over DOUBLE what we were told! We asked the waitress and she said the price was correct, so we followed up with the manager the next day who was rude and demeaning. There is no excuse for the overcharge since I have an email confirmation saying the price was less than half of that which was listed. We are in the process of getting refunded for the overcharge, but even if we knew it was $80, I would not say the service and food are worth that. My suggestion is do not go to the Veranda on a holiday. The food is no better than on a regular day, and I don't see how this could justify for over double the price. They didn't even offer drinks. The Sterling Brunch at another Vegas hotel is $90, and they provide unlimited caviar and champagne! This brunch is just not worth $80 for the price.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

27MxzDHshsv_v54bo5baUw.text: The tea selection is not too extensive, but what they have is so delicious. The scones are so fluffy, probably the fluffiest I've ever had. I've been here on multiple occasions and the service has been solidly outstanding. The tea savories are a mix of traditional and seasonal, and the sweets are just perfect. I usually have to take the sweets home. So delicious and just a special time to share with a loved one.

WGr1dmTn254Ylvb7E-Gvuw.text: Afternoon tea $35: great service and nice atmosphere.  The scones were tasty, crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside.  The strawberry preserves, Devonshire cream, and lemon curd were spot on and tasty on the scones.  I would rank them in that order.  The salmon sandwich was good while the cucumber sandwich was decent.  The beet root was good, esp with the waffle cone.  The almond and pear tart reminded me of an egg custard tart with almonds on the top.  The 2 chocolate desserts were ok for me.  The mango cheesecake was smooth.  The wait staff were very friendly and even gave us their extra desserts.  I would definitely support them.  Tip:  I would recommend the chef to keep all the font colors the same as their use of the reddish pink font on the menu may be consTrued as requiring an extra payment.

oRhEGSwOC49ZNsNUNmFUNg.text: It was very classy menu was limited but the select we ordered were very good. Starting with pear salad and lobster bisque. The main course of Bronzino and the Signature Seafood Pasta Bowl were great. We had the roasted beets with goat cheese. There was bread as well and we filled up quickly taking home a little. Service was great always someone there to care for any needs and to check on each dish.

n0axvzinbZmuEmUrvO70pw.text: Yay: -The brunch buffet had a smorgasbord of options: omelet bar, donut bar (delightful!), charcuterie bar, continental breakfast type bar (including chicken and waffles, pear french toast, and then your usual suspects) -The bloody mary and the cranberry and blood orange mimosa were a refreshing and tasty way to relax midday on a Sunday. The iced coffee was clearly fresh brewed, similar to a cold brew style, a good way to wake up and cool off while we were seated outside. -The pineapple french toast was done so delectably: the pineapple was toasted and warm yet still refreshing. The brioche was soft and fluffy, not soaked and mushy. It didn't sit heavy but it satiated me completely. -This place is bougie and we felt fancy and taken care of. Can't wait to come back here!  Nay: -It was rather expensive. We knew we were getting fancy when we decided to eat here. Brunch buffet was $40; 2 iced coffees, a bloody mary, and a mimosa came to $38; and the pineapple french toast was $20-something. So make sure you win some at the casino first heh.

ktThSVE3he0xOIt1BwosRw.text: I absolutely love this place, I wish I'd work here,  i've been here 2times and going on my 3rd time this week, food is amazing, service is AMAZING too, and the ppl that work there,  thank you for always making my experience enjoyable

Bi6jG8VmFmcFisxI0QkFYQ.text: Had lunch and a couple drinks at the bar and was so impressed with the service, quality of food, and ambiance. Highly recommend! Also, my bartender was Tri and he was the best! Thanks for the great service!

HLu6zL3IXDaqJ5JwYRozPQ.text: *Dinner* Atmosphere was nice & my friend liked his RAVIOLI PARMIGIANA & we both thought the beets were excellent. However, the service was not the quality I would expect & the TRADITIONAL CARBONARA was horrible. First, the server was condescending. When I asked about how the courses should/could work (antipasti, primi, secondi, etc.), she didn't answer my question, but managed to tell us twice the portions weren't Cheesecake Factory size, but a good size. Just because I'm a little overweight & not sure how the courses at the Veranda work, doesn't mean I know what the portions are like at Cheesecake Factory, which I don't, or that I'm worried that I won't have enough to stuff my face! The server was also inattentive, disappointing since we were there for an early dinner and it wasn't busy!  (Only 3 other tables in the place). We picked this restaurant because I was craving Carbonara...I still am. The portion was plenty, too bad it was not tasty. It was a nest of noodles with the lightly cooked egg in the middle, two thumbs up for presentation. But the noodles were not quite al dente & super dry. So it was difficult to stir the egg around, all in all, it mostly tasted like undercooked noodles. To leave on a positive note, the bread, olive oil & balsamic were delish!

bAPtcRUMOtUMS_a1sMkSsQ.text: I hate leaving bad reviews. I wouldn't leave this one if it had just been an unpleasant dining experience but my husband and I both got sick after this meal and I hate the thought of others suffering the same. We had the holiday afternoon tea. Dinner might be fine here. The staff was nice enough and there is nothing wrong with the interior but things went down hill from there.  The scones had nice flavor but the bake was bad. They were very under cooked. The sandwiches were not great. The one with goat cheese was particularly unpleasant. That was my husband's least favorite thing we ate. The goat cheese was so strong of goat. The best sandwich was the chicken salad but it was only average.  The dessert tray was very pretty but they weren't worth the calories. The Yule log was probably the best. Very chocolate but it had nice flavor and texture. The fruit cake and egg nog creme brulee were very boozy. I'm not a drinker so that doesn't appeal to my palate but I think that might have just been preference. The fruit cake was a bit stodgy though. The worst thing on the plate for me was the chestnut tart. It just tasted like sugar flavor chalk. It was probably the worst dessert I've had at a higher end restaurant.

klKv7XUjBXXjWPly07ipew.text: # B R U N C H  - B R E A K D O W N (# of + stars = rating) * A T M O S P H E R E/C O N C E P T: +1 star * F O O D/P R E S E N T A T I O N: +1 star * P O R T I O N/C O S T: -1 star * S E R V I C E: +1 star * R E V I S I T: +1 star  Met up with some friends to have brunch here. SOO tasty! Downside is the small portion size, but the flavor really kicks it up! An upside is the lack of waiting! So many tasty brunch places have an awful wait.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; Waffles

2nb7yeeSfUD3gLD34gro0g.text: Beautiful surroundings, beautifully prepared and presented meals, plus service above and beyond expectations made this a great mid-afternoon choice.

Cz7swY5vnSBFsECtzg5phA.text: I guess don't come for lunch?  Very underwhelmed recently when we came for lunch.  Pizza and pasta were both below average.  Stick to brunch I guess?!

7H3fFMS1d9PVtVHCDx5hKA.text: Love their breakfast buffets on the weekends.  Great selection of breakfast items, and their muesli is so delicious.  The fresh donuts are a nice treat as well.  While it's not going to be hundreds of food choices like at the bigger hotel buffets, the ambiance and lack of crowds more than makes up for it.  It's nice to not have to wait in a long line (i.e. Bellagio buffet), and fights with hoards of people.  Relaxing and nice environment to enjoy brunch!

4dzU9seGPPTbWksHx93HUg.text: $79 Father's Day Bruch. Worth way more. Seafood, taco trucks, a tiny buffet for toddlers so they can make their own fruit kabobs. They had multiple outdoor stations all around the pool. King crab, braised beef with potatoes, sushi, creme brulee was amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiny toddler buffet.

dq1TC2MKFkUoX8-q9apZfQ.text: Maybe it was the company.  Maybe it was the food.  I'll say it was a combination for a lovely Sunday brunch at Veranda!  Located in the Four Seasons, you can use valet complimentary when dining at one of their restaurants.  Veranda sits notably at the end of the hall.  We had to wait only about 5 minutes to be seated even with reservations.  That's ok. Once inside it was all good.  I love that since the reservation was under my name that she would use it frequently when checking on the table.  Service was very attentive throughout our meal.    Their Sunday Brunch Buffet offers many options without feeling overloaded.  Of course you have an omelet station as well as fresh baked mini donuts.  Benedict, waffles, blintz' and breakfast meats are just to name a few of their offerings.  There is a designated table with breads and pastries that all looked delightful!  The food seemed to be fresh and not heat lamp baked.  It may have been because we went during a busy time so items weren't sitting very long.    I realize that you pay a little more but every once in a while won't hurt.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yogurt Parfait from weekend breakfast buffet
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Benedict, bacon, sausage, blintz, French toast &amp; hash browns from weekend breakfast buffet
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast pizza, enchiladas, corned beef hash (part of weekend breakfast buffet)

2Gp83yVqGZhgsBQWkueYjg.text: We went for dinner last night.  The service from Johnathan and Theresa was great.  The cocktails by Gabe were awesome--especially the dirty martinis.  The kitchen was not great.  While the apps were good (beet salad and ahi tuna) the mushroom soup was not very good and we ended up just returning it, uneaten. They still charged us for that, by the way. Two of our four pastas came out lukewarm--not what you expect for a $30 pasta.  They were very willing to redo them, but they all came out under seasoned and very unimpressive.  The vegetarian lasagna tasted like a came from a frozen meal.  It had obviously been sitting because the cheese on top was dried out.  The center was warm, but the outside was lukewarm.  Overall, not impressed by the kitchen execution here, even though the servers did try to make up for it.

5faU8DCw7VU-mMEJK3fn7Q.text: While I love FS Spas, I am not a huge fan of the FS restaurants, ranging from Allium in Chicago, Blue Bar in Hong Kong, to Veranda in Vegas. I feel like a little kid getting all excited and am disappointed every time I dine at a FS restaurant. I decided never come back to Veranda, but why?  1) The service was not on par with that of other FS restaurants - While the food at Allium and Blue Bar are mediocre, the waiters are friendly and helpful. On the other hand, the waiter at Veranda confused the orders of my friend and mine. She also forgot our requests for water.  2) The food was mediocre - Although I appreciated the parfait being less sweet, I was not happy that the ratio of the non-fat Greek yogurt and the granola was one to four. I ended up eating dry nuts most of the time. The orange juice that both of us had was not fresh and was slightly bitter. The juice was definitely two levels below that in MOzen at Mandarin Oriental.   Although I enjoyed the view of the pool and the palm trees, I was disappointed by the overpriced mediocre food of Verandah. I would rather pay slightly more for the food and drinks at MOzen.

k9W3zcRVpYa02_fPvZRk8Q.text: We went to Veranda for breakfast and we found it to be a total let down. Server was not attentive, $14 Mimosas served in a tiny skinny champagne flute, the orange juice was not even fresh, it was from a bottle but they will lie to you because I asked if it was fresh and I was told that yes it was, then I asked if it was freshly squeezed on the premises and was told that actually not they get it bottled - why the bs?! If OJ is bottled it's pasteurized NOT FRESH, and I could definitely taste that it wasn't fresh. The Frittata ($18) was a very small serving and completely flavorless, even the accompanying veggies were bland. We ended up paying $140 for a simple breakfast for 2. We expected the high prices since it's the Four Seasons, however it was a total let down, we didn't expect the Mimosas to be $14 - what a joke.

FbkYIPitRjGuXUrHEwR5ag.text: Went for a lunch. Very mediocre : I had salmon salad and my husband chicken panini . No flavor to Salmon.

t-GCzClbOCWSjmBluin73A.text: Very good place for lunch, fresh and nice menu, easy access, valet parking, patio area lovely and very professional service.  F

kov5iNjWLEvK1lbCnlH9eQ.text: We had the Cheeze Stuffed Blintz (newly added to their menu) and the Italian Skillet. Both dishes were so yummy!! Service is great. The coffee was good too.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Italian Skillet. So healthy and soo good!
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The extremely delicious Cheeze Blintz.

M1Kd_G1sFOZP5fkoBcKw9A.text: So this review is only a Little over a year late...oh well. I thought I had written one.  Anyways, we had our anniversary breakfast here last year. I waited for a good two years before we finally tried this place out. The food was not at all what I was expecting so the four stars is not for that. I guess my palate isnt trained yet but I didn't  like the polenta eggs Benedict.  4 stars is for the service and the ambience. Loved sitting outside on a nice morning. The staff did bring us a plate with chocolates on it with "happy anniversary" written on the plate so we definitely appreciated that.   I would return for the view and the drinks maybe but not so much the food.

2R1RkrtqZ8NLjOoZGg_v6w.text: I came here for both Brunch and dinner and I can't speak highly about this place.    The restaurant itself is a casual elegant environment without being pretentious. Its a real getaway from the casino crowd.  It feels like you are not in Vegas, which is kinda nice being able to enjoy your dinner.  The brunch was a bit disappointing in terms of the Vegas offering, but the qualities are much better. I loved the make your own peanut butter machine, so fun!  freshly made doughnuts are good too.  The dinner, however, it was a real deal.  I loved the regional Italian dinner prix-fixe Menu.  from appetizers, main courses to dessert, are all wonderfully prepared and reasonably priced (Vegas pricing).  I loved the way he cooked the fish, one of the best fish dishes I had in Vegas.  Definitely worth a visit if you are in Vegas and don't want to have an overpriced dinner.

whD3OmKFMN-PyEhGrbJqdQ.text: Do yourself a favor and have brunch here on the last day of your trip. There's no casino at the 4 Seasons, so it's good for when you're almost tired of Vegas.  Second best brunch buffet I've ever had (Foundry Grill at Sundance still wins). Everything is fantastic. The donut station achieves greatness. The new Bloody Mary bar was a pleasant surprise. This place delivers on so many little details...grind your own honey nut peanut butter...jam from Austria...corned beef in a tiny cast iron skillet. Great experience.

zWWcnfjpwjA8tsPKdwyTGw.text: Quality control is observed religiously.  The best part of dining here is that you forget that you are here in Las Vegas. As a local its the best feeling.

sGjO7cVG0vTSIz-jnI8TfA.text: Service was great! My kids and I had a good time here. The food is pretty good. Their chicken and waffles are delicious minus the use of dark meat. I would prefer the breast meat to avoid the at smell of the dark meat (thigh meats tend to have a smell). Breakfast buffet was fresh and delicious. We stayed at the Mandalay Bay hotel but came here often to dine. The Four Seasons hotel is really nice and quiet. If you want to go to Vegas but not have the hustle and bustle of Sin City, this is your hotel. We might stay here next time.

m5P-ZgVVna3AR0sdGvQlww.text: ~Totally Worth It~  The Verandah has definitely improved since the last time I stayed at the Four Seasons :)  The service was Excellent and the Food was delicious.   My mother, lil sister and I took a break from the pool and sat on the patio:  We had Prosecco, The summer Watermelon and Arugula Salad. So light, refreshing and tasty. The watermelon and tomatoes were bright red and they were delicious. Next we had the Grilled Salmon on top of the Field Greens Salad. Both dressing's were spectacular and it was a perfect late lunch to hold us over for dinner.   I was here about 6 months ago and the service was terrible and the food was mediocre.  They have definitely stepped up the food and service quality!!! Come to the VERANDAH for a great dinning experience. It's not just a lunch place, the dinner menu is spectacular, too :)

MMz5zH1vYz2tFnFqm6IlFg.text: Back in Vegas, sick and hung over, but I had to drag myself out for verandah brunch. Still as amazing as I remember. I have a flight to catch and our sweet waitress, Heidi, was amazing at rushing our food for us. Top quality food and service, I love you Verandah!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LKTANTtvVfLBrksKgwjORA.text: Stick to their Brunch that has apparently generated some positive reviews but think twice and avoid their evening dining.  Sadly, our attempt for a fine dining evening experience at the Veranda was far less than satisfactory. They have redecorated the restaurant in what might be described as Contemporary Pacific Rim for Italian fare. Ambiance aside, it was the dinners that fell hopelessly into the category of grossly over priced for very unimpressive cuisine. One member of our party had to send his inedible pasta dish back, not once, but twice. The fact that his dinner was later comped did not alter the on going dining disruption for our entire party. Other guests found their dinners ranged from grossly lacking to ordinary. A Filet steak that was ordered Medium was served Rare. A side order of spinach was 1/2 cup of tasteless lukewarm greens. The Cotton Candy creation that was to be shared was laughable and correctly described by another reviewer.

B_bEdYJFTqoL0lIukQM4Tg.text: The food here is awesome. I had some of the best pasta I have had in my life. The beet carpacio was delicious. The Chef came by and visited our table. My friends had the tasting menu and loved it.  Prices were average for the quality of food and Vegas.  This place should be packed, however it was not. I highly recommend it.

HcTjjMX4Xz_HXaBpM-9Ivg.text: Oh, Verandah! My Verandah! I was SO excited to come for their Sunday brunch! But my bad from not putting into affect the fact that it was Father's Day. Whomp whomp!  The brunch buffet price was nearly doubled for the holiday, I was so upset and disappointed. I was SO SO SO excited for this brunch.   But we enjoyed our meal anyway. The BF got eggs, bacon and toast. The typical and he said it was tasty. I got the Quatro, a small Gluten free waffle, scrambled egg whites with asparagus and pesto, grapefruit segments in agave syrup and a carrot juice shooter. The waffle was surprisingly good and who'd know that it was gluten free...no one! The egg whites were light and fluffy and very flavorful with the pesto. The carrot juice was very refreshing.   Our server was great, my coffee was always full and it seemed when I went to pour my coffee he was right there behind me to stop me and did it for me.  I look forward to my next visit for brunch and am hoping that all the awesome little stations we saw are the norm, I know some are but I have a feeling there may have been some additional ones for the occasion. I shall find out soon enough!

Dc747K8wNv7Ldd1aJ1sDWg.text: Excellent service!  Nice GF options.  Ate here 4 times, 2 breakfast, brunch, and 2 lunches.  Everything was very delicious!

NbUSFKonNxKsW4GvPhWrxw.text: Brunch ran us $50 per person, and it was worth every penny.  Everything that found its way into my mouth was delicious. I wasn't even sure what everything was, but I ate it anyways, and it was good. The bloody mary bar was excellent as well; don't forget to try the bacon infused vodka.  It was also a lot quieter than a lot of the other restaurants, a nice change after a week in Vegas.

CUl2y61mRur8GZ16jSUy6g.text: Love how this place is opened late. Came here after watching a show in Mandalay Bay. To eat, I got the La Pasta Cotta Nel Vaso. It's literally served in a jar. It was very good. I also had the Rita to drink, which was just ok. Great ambiance, service, and food. Would come back here again to try their other dishes.

_sF3dgjbV-KAPY24zBcI5Q.text: Pretty place for weekend brunch, poolside at the Four Seasons with a waterfall! The food was very good.  Omelet bar, corned beef hash, chicken and waffles, pancakes, bacon, sausage-you name it they had it!  My son especially liked the made to order mini donuts, mini pancakes and sausage.   I enjoyed my egg white omelet and fresh fruit plate. The hubby ordered a breakfast panini off the menu and said it was just right.   Would definitely recommend if it's in your budget or as a special place to celebrate a birthday, etc.

mH6YQnim6zZ8VYdjNZJ5Sw.text: We came for breakfast on our last morning in The Four Seasons, however, I think all the room service and the poolside menu also comes from Verandah when you are a guest at The Four Seasons (Which we took advantage of plenty during our stay).    First of all:  Multiple Gluten Free options!  SO exciting for people like my friend and myself who generally dont get to have a lot of options when dining out.  The GF waffles are amazing, and although they use the same GF bread I do at home... it just seemed better.  Fruit was fresh, and juicy.  Chicken Apple sausage was not under/over done, and the mango/guava juice was sweet and not too thin.  Our men had the brunch buffet, and everything looked great from there as well.  On the room service/poolside menu  food:  All was fabulous!  A great burger on a couple slices of GF bread with avocado and swiss, waffle fries, skillet corned beef and pastrami hash with eggs and shoestring fried potatoes, the large salads, chicken nachos... I would eat every one of these meals again and again!  Service was very good, as well.  No complaints.

aTsJs7HEib29DWNHsJX2mQ.text: My wife and I visited Verandah for lunch on last Friday and our lunch was very good. We had the Seafood Macaroni and Cheese with Truffle, the V Burger and for starters the Seafood Frito Misto. All was very good. The next day we decided to go to the Saturday Breakfast Buffet and it was a terrible mistake. We arrived shortly after the opening and were greeted fine and seated outside as requested. After we were provided our beverages we proceeded to the buffet however there was only half of the food ready. The silver chafing dishes were empty. We then took what was available however once we got back to the table we found the food was barely warm. We ate a bit of it and then went back to the buffet and found there was more food. We loaded our plates and once again the food was barely warm.  There were no waitress around and then the man in the suit came and asked if everything was ok? We told him the food was cold and he replied that he would go find out why. He came back shortly after and proceeded to explain that the hot pans were not ready which is why the food was not warm, duh! He walked away.After that a waitress came and asked the same question and we told her the same and she said oh, that's too bad.

pe6UGcYmsoGukWoyznfgWA.text: I just returned from one of the most overpriced lunches ever.  it was at the verandah at the four seasons hotel, which is also located in the mandalay bay resort.  the hotel has a private entrance away from the main entrance of the mandalay.  It does continue on with that slightly tropical, slightly Asia and beautiful resort dcor from the mandalay. theme.  there was indoor and outdoor seating available overlooking the pool.  the tables and chairs were of rattan amidst the wood tones around the restaurant.   We started with tuna sampler of tuna tartare (ahi poke), blackened sashimi (seared tuna) and spicy tuna maki roll (spicy tuna roll)...good but unimpressive.  We also had the tasty and crispy crab cakes on a jicama-green papaya-mango slaw (this is a definite recommendation...i just love that slaw).   my friend had the original san francisco crab louis, which was loaded with hella lumps of crab meat.  i had the nioise Salad with grilled hawaiian rare tuna (these were meaty bastards that resembled slightly rare steak with a shiny sheen under different lights), haricot vert, roasted potatoes, cherry tomatoes, capers, and big chunks of red and green olives sprayed with vinager.   We also ordered garlic and parmesan fries, sweet potato fries, which both needed a better dip than ketchup.  (note the sweet potato fry comment on my pop's review...totally better over at pop's.)  my friend could not stop raving about the macaroni and cheese (sounds like somebody else out there...Ed M.)  and wholly crap!!!  it was damn good, in fact i took some back to the office and eating it right now.  this cheese is just extremely creamy, but what I love about it is the garlic toast sprinkles all over the top.  when you mix it all up, every bite you'll taste the creamy buttery cheese, the  softness of the macaroni, crunchy little bits scattered throughout.  we did finish it off with the mini eskimos, roasted nuts and dark chocolate covered vanilla ice cream bars on a stick.  i had to have two!!! if i could i would like to give this place 3 and a half stars.  i mean the mini eskimos and crab cakes were good.  i ordered the nicoise salad  because it looked and tasted good, plus i didn't see anything appetizing in the entree section.  it is a good thing b/c i probably wouldnt have had the chance to try the mac and cheese and fries.  both items were side dishes, and they were happy to whip us up an order.  i would like to return here for afternoon tea and then add some more insight to this place...till then...

JxBjlkHpvOxi7QZHklbRmQ.text: Dinner tonight 12.23.12 for party of 4.  Very good service, food all excellent, very beautiful and pleasant dining room, felt very much apart from the Strip which was what we wanted.  Penne was outstanding, osso bucco very good, nice wine selection, very good pizza.   Reasonably priced given the classy decor and service and food quality.

AYMNi3t3oPkK1mQSBOSYhQ.text: AMAZING AMAZING AMAZING. The service was beyond incredible.Came here for dinner with my friends. In addition to incredible food and beautiful ambiance (peaceful in crazy Vegas) we had the most personable experience I've ever had. Our servers name was Kevin. We had great appetizers and then our entrees came out. My friend ordered the filet steak and it came out a little too well done- although the flavor was delicious. We told them and they cleared it immediately. While they were redoing the dish -the server, manager, and head chef! came out to apologize and sent out two amazing courses in the mean time! (So over and beyond) -gourmet courses that were delectable- in addition to apology on apology (all over a steak taking an extra 10 minutes which was no big deal to begin with). Dinner was cleared and they continued to send out limoncello after dinner cocktails. We had dessert and too top it all off Kevin sent out a plate with a personalized message written in chocolate! Needless to say -excellent excellent service. Delicious food. Cheers to Kevin and to Verandah for a wonderful and memorable evening.

ttTA3UXRE0B6JyUcSjbzTw.text: As a college student I definetly couldn't afford to eat dinner at this excellent but expensive restaurant. I was lucky enough to be invited to dinner by a friend of mine, whose parents were in town and were staying at the Four Seasons.  I loved the ambiance the wait staff was professional, courteous, and attentive and provided the level of service you would expect from a luxury hotel restaurant. I think what's unique about this restaurant is that you can have any dish in an appetizer size or an entree size, and the dish is priced accordingly. I had the clam linguini, appetizer size and it was delicous the white wine sauce was superb along with the pasta, freshly chopped tomatoes, and clams.  Verandah also serves excellent bread while you wait for your meal. If you have an expense account, I highly recommend this restaurant.

RzS5CdYA4cycnphjLY7mzA.text: 5 stars for the ambiance, 4 stars for the food.  In our trek from The Encore to the restaurant Verandah for the Travelzoo promotional 5-course dinner for two, we casually walked through several hotels, taking in the sites.  We noticed many crowded, loud, bustling restaurants, booming with music or the loud echos of chatter and dishes clanking and bouncing from the casino ceiling and walls.  And suddenly, we were here at Verandah, led out onto a peaceful & quiet patio, overlooking a nice garden and pool and it felt glorious.  It was perfect for a relaxing, 5-course dinner.  No fake blue sky painted on the ceilings here.  No echos of mall shopping.  We could actually carry a conversation without having to yell, and we could sit back and enjoy the fresh air and sunshine on a gorgeous open air patio.  Why aren't there more restaurants like this on The Strip?  Of the five courses, the majority of them were very tasty and the meal included champagne, coffee and dessert.  The service was on-point and we were very well-attended to.  I will definitely be coming back to Verandah on my next trip to Vegas.

YwUYpcwu_jdUd90xBJ3LKQ.text: This was a most pleasant experience - class act all the way. It was crowded, but the hostess was able to find seating pretty quickly. We got to sit on the patio and it was a perfect setting...next to the pool. They started out with a bread/cracker basket with a wonderful white bean dip. The dip was so good we had to order seconds. We had a scrumptious salad. Normally I dislike blue cheese because it is a "strong" cheese; however, this salad had such a good combination of textures and flavors. The ice tea was spectacular as the ice cubes were made from ice tea. The sweet potato fries had just the right combination of sweetness and saltiness. Service was very good and very friendly. Overall, a very relaxing, pleasant visit.

x_8VH45LnG0urqid3MjIsg.text: Great food really bad service.  Surprising for a Four Seasons restaurant.  It's a lovely environment and at dinner the food was quite good--fresh, well-presented, high quality.  One of the better meals I had in Vegas.  The service, during what appeared to be a very slow night, was abysmal; inattentive and rushed (when it came time for the check), not well timed, and overall unimpressive.  I found myself having to look for someone when I needed something, like a glass of wine, and yet the check was presented to me without bothering to ask if there was anything else I would like.  There is too much competition in Vegas to return to a restaurant with bad service.

TKzEvrSqbCYyIzPSS1rxtQ.text: The atmosphere here at the Four Seasons is absolute paradise. As son as you walk outside to the patio area,  you are taken in by the palm trees, beautiful view of the pool, and super comfy couches you can lounge on while much on something totally amazing. The staff is more than happy to do whatever they have to make you happy - even if that means refilling your fresh squeezed lemonade glass a zillion times. Although the food is a bit pricey ($19 for a sandwich and $6 for a lemonade) it is light and refreshing. I opted for the shrimp and lobster salad on wheat bread with salad and sweet potato fries on the side. Very delicious.

Yd2dOAFWQ9_3s4gtKV3C-A.text: I love the ambience of this restaurant.  I give the ambience 5/5 stars.  The service is good and the food is also well done.  I've eaten here twice and have not been disappointed.  This is a perfect place for breakfast and lunch and sitting outside on the patio to have some fresh air. The only complaint I have is: $5 for a cup of regular coffee?

sj0nGH7hKCQIE8VWT1dNKg.text: The most salient feature of Verandah is that it partakes of the entire Four Seasons Las Vegas "oasis" atmosphere we enjoyed during a recent stay (q.v.): a million miles from the casinos and their showplace (and not-so-showplace) restaurants while being a corridor away.  Restaurant is thoroughly kid-friendly while not for a second compromising adults' menu choices; also Four Seasons-standard.  We had breakfast here each day and it was consistent and enjoyable, including both the a la carte menu and the buffet.  Highlights of the buffet on the day I ate include salmon and crab at the omelet bar and a donut bar!  We had lunch once and it was, for the price especially, remarkable.  The trio of tuna is great, and useful especially as a light lunch if you're going on to something big that night, and we also enjoyed the crab salad.  Finally, we had a nice pre-fix group dinner there one night.  Some quite creative items as well as a centerpiece meat and fish dishes that were tasty, just the right size in portion, and otherwise fully on target.  Nothing that really leaped out and demanded your attention to the extent that a fifth star would be in order, though.

pwNzF5dHBVSTAVP-6jOgGQ.text: This is the restaurant at the four Four Seasons.  It's lovely - food is delicious.  The outdoor verandah is really nice and calm.  Highly recommended.

RxxWE3rvK7lNSQ5sR-F40w.text: Great place if you're trying to get away from the noise/commotion of Vegas.  Food  was average, but, again, eating on the porch was a welcome respite.

UrXWl8FctlSbEt3Ax_ShSA.text: One of the best meals that I have had in Vegas.  The server, Michael, was great and the food was fantastic.  We first had a winter risotto that we shared among all four of us.  It had asparagus, mushrooms, a few different cheeses, etc.  I had the Chilean Sea Bass, which came with crispy gnocchi, mushrooms, tomatoes and a lobster sauce.  It was so good.  Two of my friends got the tenderloin and another friend tried the crab-crusted scallops.  Everything was amazing.  We also got two desserts, which was actually one too many.  Also, for one friend's brithday, they had given us a little chocolate cake.  Everything was perfect.

ye5BL72BDt5vWkLAlEGLMA.text: Good NOT great.  I had dinner here with several of my coworkers.   I opted for the Chilean Seabass, it was good, not great!  I was almost going to say it was OKAY but I think it might be better than okay.  The service however is fantastic and the atmosphere superb!  We all sat outside to dine and it was very nice, very relaxing.  I would return perhaps to have lunch or breakfast but for the money, there are way too many options in Vegas for dinner and this would not be my first choice.

oApW1qy1rTPxGUbIXA0qYg.text: OMG! Most amazing restaurant ever..I love this restaurant b/c it's on the strip, but in an upscale environment. If you are looking for a restaurant that actually HAS good service in Vegas + amazing food + amazing ambiance - come here

TfePkH1UIctyORVQZlevQw.text: we had the calamari appetizer, seafood mac n cheese, and the short rib panini....calamari was so yummy!! came with this aioli that we had to get 2nds of, theres this light parmesan-garlic breading on it that is so good!!! seafood mac n cheese is also very yummy! i would highly recommend that! but beware it doesnt seem like a lot, but is very filling!!! the short rib panini is meh, i'd try the "christina panini" next time or try their brunch menu!!

H6e5DFWWY5Y7juKrS6jiLQ.text: Checked into the Four Seasons on Thursday after a quick drive from So Cal.  Didn't feel like driving anymore and the front desk suggested Verandah.  They described it as Italian fare.  I had the prix fixe menu which included huge tiger prawns appetizer which was spot on delicious.  I picked the fish entree which was done correctly which was also great.  I picked the mousse desert what a way to unwind from a long drive.

RXqNgZoZJQakQy5nZFEHqg.text: As far as Vegas dining goes, this is one of the most pleasant experiences you can have. Lightyears different from any other strip and casino restaurant, Verandah provides a beautiful, calm and relaxing dining atmosphere. This is the place to go if you want to get away from your typical Vegas scene. Verandah has both indoor and outdoor seating. The indoor seating almost reminds me an island resort's restaurant... and the outdoor seating is beatiful and relaxing by the Four Season's quiet pool. The place has a Mediterranean garden feel to it which is really wonderful. Their food is a bit mediocre as far as Four Seasons dining goes but absolutely always hits the spot with a nice array of salads, sandwiches and other usual hotel restaurants offerings. I must recommend their Arnold Palmer - don't know what makes it so good but its a must try!

gqTSA2CuxT6VroZN6178MA.text: GREAT SERVICE, GREAT PRICE, GREAT SETTING ======================================== The service is superb (what else would you expect from the Four Season?).
