We were sat promptly on the verandah overlooking the garden and pool. The chairs and tables were comfortable. The staff were excellent, helpful, prompt and proactive. The food was great. The brunch buffet was amazing (they even hand make mini donuts to order). The fresh juices tasty and refreshing.   Verandah has the kind of "can and will do service" that you'll be highly satisfied with. Also, you won't even feel like you're in Las Vegas the minute you enter the property yet it's right next door to the Mandalay Bay Hotel.

IXOXIc2sOtyyfF7ZqD6U8Q.text: Good atmosphere for a intimate lunch/dinner or a quiet conversation. Inside is warm and inviting, and outside is breezy and relaxing. I usually am here for a lunch with a friend. Service is always above par, but not 100% stellar. I feel the slight language barrier interferes with the service, but definitely not anything to turn you away from dining there. Food is always cooked very well, is fresh, and has great flavor.

POpnGoF3T3p_zVaWq7dkwg.text: We came here for a late night dinner on a Saturday night with a large group. The place was pretty quiet and we got a semi-private room in the back. Our server was excellent. She was very personable and was excellent at menu suggestions. I shared the Ravioli and Short Ribs. The Ravioli was homemade and stuffed with burrata - I LOVE burrata. The sauce was very delicate and overall, it was delicious. The Short Ribs were amazing. They melted in my mouth and the polenta it came with served as a nice creamy balance. Definitely a place for a nice, good dinner in Vegas!

dZ8GNrtKIHVq75DeFX7uUg.text: One of my favorite pastimes is: afternoon teatime at the Verandah. Alas, I don't have the finances to do it very often. I think that's what makes it even more special, because it is an occasional treat. The servers are the best!

qswRwkhr-t18vISbfki6HQ.text: We ate here twice during our last trip to vegas, once for lunch and once for dinner. The menu was really interesting, the service was good, and the price was reasonable for a fancy place. The patio outside is really nice on a nice day.  Overall the food was really tasty. The only reason it didn't get 5 stars is that I got the blackened fish tacos for lunch and they really weren't very good. Kinda fishy and otherwise flavorless.

m052QdK4J0TICPPH_rY9gw.text: First they brought out bread.  The bread was good however it was cold and not warm which is a minus.  the second thing I ordered was the butternut squash soup which was incredible and I highly recommend. Next I had the mahi-mahi fish tacos the mango salsa on top made them very good.  The only disappointment was the side slaw salad which virtually has no taste I had to finally add salt to find if there was any flavor or not

HWX5PcB6HrPkaX2JGmA_eA.text: Had great service and food. The calamari app was one of the best I've had. It is worth a visit.

DzF0yryg0dW8hIlA6i99rw.text: Service was terrible, although the food was excellent.  We waited twenty minutes before anyone would pour water for us, and only then after we told the hostess no one had seen us.  Had to ask three times for bread.  As icing on the cake, our bill was wrong not once, but twice.  Don't bother with it--there are plenty of good restaurants in Vegas--no one should have to be ignored through dinner.

MvOzMfaWR10hfqflxKJkpw.text: Excellent food, courteous and friendly staff. It was a perfect a break from the crazy Vegas environment.

GwscbauhYYRn91HbKx5Oog.text: My husband and I were staying at the Four Seasons hotel and had breakfast here each morning. The food was fresh and delicious with many options available. The service was always very professional and attentive. The view outside the restaurant of the gardens was beautiful. We really enjoyed starting off the day in the Verandah restaurant

UpV7tqQbScMmMQjgjFYYSg.text: With an estimated group of 14 and no reservations for brunch on Father's Day, I pressed my luck and went to Verandah first to see if they could accommodate us. Behold my Vegas luck, someone with a group of 14 canceled and we would have a nice semi-private room for our group. Only downside would be that it would be inside. If you have a semi-small group or don't mind waiting, I'd recommend trying to get seated outside on a nice day. It's right next to the Four Seasons pool and seems very relaxing.   Some people in our group ordered a la crate and some got the brunch buffet. Two most impressive contraptions of the meal: the Donut Robot and the fresh peanut butter maker. The donut robot makes donuts by itself and the only need for a human being is to dip the donuts into toppings (but I'd recommend just trying a plain donut fresh). They had an omelette station that had both crab and lobster meat. Traditional breakfast buffet fare including frittatas, bread pudding, lots of fruits and pastries, etc... They also had fresh squeezed juices.   I guess the only negative was the cost. +$40 for the brunch buffet after tax/tip. Being in the Four Seasons hotel, I guess this is to be expected. However, still a reason for a dock of a star. I haven't really eaten at the other casino buffets for breakfast/brunch, so I can't really compare. But I'm fairly certain they're less expensive and might even offer more fare.

Tt6Ndq7M5Grd1pR2j87Wpw.text: I think this is the coffee shop at the Four Seasons Hotel.  I just had dinner there last night after a late flight.  The food was excellent and the wait staff were very helpful.  The place is wicked expensive though so be prepared-dinner ran about $100/person.  I'd come back but I'll have to work a little to be able to afford it first.  I guess you can't really expect anything to be inexpensive at a Four Seasons, can you.

4FMFTFUopDhHGVXUWPltwQ.text: Arrived here on the morning of 10.10.10 to have brunch as the Bride-To-Be with my Best Ladies, my Mother and soon-to-be Mother-in-Law on the day of my wedding in Las Vegas.  Simply amazing.  The service was top notch, the food options were plentiful, the servings were tiny( (i have a lap band & a tight wedding gown to slide into) which allowed us to sample a little taste of everything.  The ambiance was perfect.  We enjoyed a bit of sunshine out on the pool while waiting for people to meet us.  The bill was steep, but this type of meal and day only happen one in a life time.  I highly recommend anyone visiting Las Vegas to make a date for brunch @ The Vernadah - it does not disappoint!  I only wish I could eat brunch there everyday.  Delicious!

Xym-HMX-f-R6h8voYba6nA.text: $5.50 for a cup of coffee! Jeremy ordered a double espresso & that was $7.50. I've learned to ask for prices in the future.  I can't believe that it's categorized under casual restaurants. The food ok & the service isn't great. However, I think our server may had too many tables to look after. I don't think we'll be coming back.  The nice thing was that they split our burger order though. :)

hkMnPHrM7TDHbE_66D_sFg.text: Forget you are in Vegas and slip away... to the Verandah !! This is tucked on the Strip but you feel a few thousand miles away ! Had Breakfast outside with the palms! Service was a 5 star.. not too pushy, just available, kept water glasses filled and checked in when needed. Had the Lox plate which is excellent, good portion size, fresh coffee served in a carafe left at the table. It was quiet and very relaxing ! Would definitely recommend this if you are looking for a quiet elegant or even romantic breakfast away from the bustle of the Strip !

MCnHpUSclEIAQa6G2Vg2SQ.text: Enjoyed breakfast here before I joined the family reunion at Mandalay Bay and THE Hotel. Setting, service and food are all top notch. My favorite was the eggs Benedict. Two disks of polenta, premium Canadian bacon, topped with two perfectly poached eggs and velvety smooth Hollandaise. Served with a portion of steamed asparagus. All the while every service personnel using my name and making sure that I was well attended to. I could live in the FS hotel and eat here every day.

64I_DCR9YMWqW9aHREZKDw.text: Service 5/5 Atmosphere 5/5 --indoor private room  Starter: Land & Sea Slider 5/5 Fritto Misto 5/5 --lightly battered Tuna Sampler 5/5 --very fresh even in the middle of the desert  Main: Seafood Mac-n-Cheese 5/5  Drinks: Peach Palmer 5/5 Benvolio Pinot Grigio 5/5

GzX1-Xd4UcE59IS1RtogXg.text: I'm a big fan of the Four Seasons, and lament that they sold the one in Carlsbad to Hyatt.  Anyway, this FS restaurant has a wonderful breakfast/lunch.  I love the loveseat tables out by the pool, so comfy!  The iced tea is so good - passionfruit? with tea ice cubes and liquid sugar - why doesn't every restaurant prepare it this way?  I ate there twice on my last visit, and especially enjoyed the salmon salad.  I love this little oasis on the Strip!

lM5XCjq_SL4IPbP3iklarQ.text: Had to meet a client here for a quick cocktail before dinner. Being in the Four Seasons, it's a very quiet location; perfect for uninterrupted discussions. The service was excellent; our waiter was constantly available without being a nuisance.

SASWBaDZGDccstmAHix6mw.text: Great place to relax and enjoy a pleasant meal.  My wife and I often visit this restaurant on the weekends for lunch.  I recommend you sit outside and enjoy the pool view and atmosphere.  The drink menu is awesome and the menu is great.

NpqwdZvFlyVkJ23FyvOI1A.text: We went to Verandah for a weekday brunch.  Ambiance was excellent. The background music was soothing and subtle.   The price was OK for a restaurant in Four Season's Hotel, but the food was disappointing. We had Healthy Breakfast or something, which consisted of 4 tiny plates with granola, oatmeal, muffin and fruits. Besides it was such a small portion, it did not taste great. Basically everything was just the same as you get for your breakfast in your kitchen every day.  I am a brunch lover, so I was disappointed :(

o2AunNGbUy4aSZOySok_PQ.text: Absolutely horrible experience from start to finish. I was there with a girlfriend for her birthday at lunchtime on a weekday (not too crowded).  -menu advertised a dessert item that wasn't available at lunch. we had specifically chosen Veranda b/c of this item. the manager tried to convince us that it was a lunch version of the dinner menu or some BS like that. I requested a discount for the False advertising and we were given 20% off -there was a hair in my friend's pasta  -when trying to get help/resolutions were we treated very condescendingly and told several times that this is the way a restaurant "of this caliber" operates  We ended up going to CPK afterwards and their friendliness made up for my friend's awful bday experience at Veranda

fWxmcISRVqM4KLIPYHdWmw.text: Off the beaten path, yet walking distance from the strip. This place is a great spot if you want to relax and escape the hustle of Vegas.   The restaurant is rather small on the inside but when combined with the pool area veranda, the space is rather large.   The service is 4 Seasons quality (prompt and attentive). The wait staff even addressed me by name.   We arrived for a late brunch @ 1:45 pm on a Monday. Although they were wrapping up the lunch session, they were accommodating and allowed us to order from the breakfast menu. On top of that, they even allowed me to modify the order (off the menu).   The food is stellar but not excessively pricey! Although upscale, brunch was the same cost as House of Blues. The quality is far superior at Veranda however. Not to say that HOB is sub-par. It is not. Veranda however, used the freshest ingredients and has small touches that really make the food stand out. For example I received a side of liquid sugar with my iced tea.     Everything was perfect and I cant wait to go back!

pyjne7eV7XbvyaxTKReHHA.text: I love the service quality and adventure of every meal here; a pristine top notch pinnacle class culinary experience every single time.

L8RPwzPr8dXurwvNcjGxwQ.text: Every trip to Vegas must include Veranda. I have many food allergies and sensitivities (Gluten, Dairy, Soy, etc) and the staff at Veranda were able to accomodate and everything tasted delicious. Even those without food allergies in my party raved about the food. If you're staying at Mandalay Bay/Delano this is the BEST restaurant. Nice view of the pool, amazing brunch and steaks. Cant beat it!

rsNxlIWsBxkrDIcRnK6ZAw.text: I've had brunch here twice and it's been mediocre both times; food and service wise. The menu is pretty limited(I'm assuming it's just tiny bites for hotel guests outside of the buffet) and the service was sub par. The first time was not good or bad enough to be memorable but today was a bit odd. We had an average of 5 people coming to our table at rotation and it just got confusing between ordering and getting more drinks, desserts etc..  The one that brought our ticket, placed it on the table and then asked if we wanted dessert...lol you tony have to work in a restaurant to know what's wrong with that picture -__-  I won't be back, but that's mainly because the menu isn't already that spectacular so not much to return for...  In response to manager's comment: Brunch is a combination of breakfast and lunch, and we definitely ordered that from the menu(didn't do the breakfast buffet)

FLkH-oX3mIzwRNmopIHVLg.text: I had a fantastic lunch here yesterday. The split pea soup was awesome and the Rigatoni Bolognese was just the right portion for a business lunch. I really liked the iced tea. It was a passion fruit flavor and the ice cubes were made from frozen tea! This kept the tea from getting that normal "watery" taste! A very nice touch!

GxgD_1g-3ng9g2Q-zUQXtg.text: Changing my review because I did indeed return and had a great experience. Our server was so sweet and we experienced the brunch buffet-- AMAZING. So many choices, including a fresh donut bar. I especially loved the chilaquiles, chicken & waffles and the bread pudding.  It's $39 but that included coffee or juice. I think it was another $11 if you wanted to add a bloody mary/mimosa. I'll be back on another Sunday in Vegas.

CXQZkRDaguWxk9zv1k--bQ.text: On my most recent trip to Vegas, I had the pleasure of having breakfast once again at Verandah at the Four Seasons Hotel.  My mission:  To order the wonderful and flavorful corned beef and pastrami hash I ate on my last visit in '08.  My friend and I made reservations just to be on the safe side, I mean who knows how busy a restaurant may or may not be on Sunday morning (hint:  don't worry if you DIDN'T make reservations for Sunday breakfast).    At first I thought we were going to be late because Las Vegas Blvd was closed for the marathon and so the police were diverting traffic elsewhere, in this case we made a u-turn and went back in the opposite direction we came from.  Thankfully we made it on time to for our 8am reservation.  One of the best things I've come to appreciate about Verandah is its location AWAY from the hustle and bustle of the Strip.  Since there isn't a casino in the Four Seasons, guests and visitors alike can enjoy the peace and serenity this restaurant has to offer.  And besides this tranquility, their service is just simply impeccable as well.  Everyone from the hostess to the servers make you feel very welcome and treat you like you're one of the Ocean's 11.  But now let's talk about the most important meal of the day:  Breakfast. Although there were other items on the menu that seemed appealing, as well as the buffet, we didn't deter from our mission and ordered our corned beef and pastrami hash.  Well, good things come to those who wait and this certainly was well worth waiting for.  Simply put:  One of the best breakfast meals I've ever had.  Bottom Line:  Peaceful.  Quiet.  Great Service.  Fantastic Breakfast.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Corned beef and pastrami hash
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7fBxQ4q6SiGoU3-gQnouKA.text: Wonderful!!! Beautiful atmosphere and kind waiters :) we went for the breakfast buffet and was very delicious and had so many wonderful options! It's was 39$ but we probably would have spent that for breakfast anywhere else and everything was of high quality

ZxQbriC1P1fsyF150sJjcw.text: Smaller-than-average portions and exorbitant prices. This alone gets a max of 3 stars from me. That being said, the food is good and the service is excellent. The atmosphere is also nice and convenient for people staying at the Four Seasons.

S_MHJwBD7_11WUv0dBvS2g.text: My wife and I went here after my wife received a gift from a friend.  I must say this place was not on my radar.  What a wonderful place!  Even though we presented a voucher we were treated like the most important people there. We had the calamari and shrimp appetizer which was beautifully displayed and was equally delicous. I had a cup of the bean soup and found it remarkabley good. My wife had the 8 ounce filet accompanied by fingerling potatoes with a mushroom medley and I had the braised short ribs with truffled patatoes. We were very impressed with this place and will keep this in mind for the future.

N_wQ4BfJQXauYWRPG3FVpw.text: This is one of the worst places I have eaten on the strip. It was my birthday lunch and we received terrible service. Just a couple things that went wrong: I found a hair in my food, truffle tries had no truffle oil on them, they refused to make something that was on their menu, they charged for every refill of coke and didn't tell us that refills of soda aren't free, managers were rude, etc   Ps I've been to probably 80% of the fine dining restaurants on the strip

A34KzwEaJaJtGIUPXPwbsA.text: I thought it was impossible to make an inedible pizza, but Veranda change my long-standing theory and now I feel my life has been turned upside down.   I've never had a good Four Seasons meal, which I understand makes me sound like a dick, but it's True -- both my being a dick and the food thing.   The good news is the service is always great and it's nice and quiet here, so there's that.

_HHjIA8rkLOuYQ0Lcq48Tw.text: Ate dinner last night. Food was average with not much flavor. We were seated near the  kitchen door even though the restaurant was 25% occupied (except private party rooms). Service was good. Not worth the price tag.

cFfB3lM2EwNUMiURYEm2QQ.text: Given the location and the lack of good food options in this hotel, I'll have to give the food 4 stars, but the service gets 2 stars. I've eaten 3 meals here throughout the day and the service is always a problem. They have multiple people caring for your table, normally one guy is solid, and the other 2 are clueless (low cost).   The food is decent overall, but the service is really bad.   Brunch was probably the best meal, but they have some good salad options as well. The pastas and red sauce they make is pretty bad, I would avoid the marinara.

Q0ptO4Je0PUjgjANW438rw.text: Best lunch I've ever had. Loved our cocktails and the fish tacos were like biting into heaven!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. So good!

ayH8RhmZx08E_7Um7WimQA.text: Love this place! My friends and I were reluctant to spend $39 on brunch, but it paid off because we stuffed or faces and did not need to eat the rest of the day. We didn't realize the entire area was brunch, we stuck to the corner and were already full and overwhelmed with options, we got a second plate. Then realized there was an omelette station, dessert station, fruit, breads, etc. Our server was very nice and we got refills on orange juice, which was by the way the best and most fresh orange juice I've ever had. So much class and so much food, I would definitely recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate 1 from the brunch buffet.

d7up32ZbgVq8DQmlJ6Gu7A.text: Food was really good. Food portions were small like you'd expect at a 5 star restaurant.  Service was good. So why only two stars?  Because they had the audacity to charge me $5 FOR A CLUB SODA! $5? We spent $275 and you couldn't fair for a  glass of carbonated water? Great way to nickel and dime people. We won't be back! There are too many other options that serve great food and don't charge you for carbonated water.

tWy_IAxNbvxAV_UpEAXpEQ.text: I love their breakfast! Omg and their cocktails are perfect. Customer service is great and their menu options are decent.

TpDJcYflrCMo5YDLN0nwIA.text: This review is based on the brunch only. I feel that a 3.5 would be more accurate, but hey, they have a Bloody Mary bar and a donut station. That alone is worth the overpriced buffet! And let's be honest, we are at Four Seasons here. Did you not expect overpriced? The service was also stellar, which made it easy to go with the 4 versus the 3 star rating.  My boyfriend and I went here randomly because we have heard many good things. They offer an a-la-carte menu as well as the buffet. The menu had pretty tempting options like chicken and waffles, and lemon ricotta pancakes, but who passes up the above mentioned in an AYCE setting?! Not me! The buffet was $39, or $51 if you want unlimited mimosas or marys. Also, I must mention their OJ is totally fresh squeezed, or at least tasted so. The buffet included many hot items, meats, eggs, potatoes. But the real winner here was the omelette station and/or the donut station. Chef on hand to whip you up an egg dish of your choice. Love it. I also like all the yogurt, granola, and cheeses. You could taste the quality.  We ended up ordering the pancakes, and they were fluffy, moist, and yummy. But not worth $20. I will stick to the buffet next time.  Also, I would avoid this place during conventions, I could imagine the tourist taking advantage of a classy buffet such as this.

NKyTxMIX4ah1LZlgJ00Skg.text: Shared a wonderful Italian-inspired meal out on the patio recently.  Met up with an old friend for lunch, and this restaurant was his suggestion.  The outdoor patio is a lovely space, shaded from the direct sunlight, yet open and airy.  Service was very attentive and patient as we had a fairly leisurely meal.  Their ice tea was infused with passion fruit giving it an incredibly refreshing flavor.  I chose a simple dish a tuscan-style tomato soup and a grilled cheese sandwich.  The soup was thick, seasoned nicely and very hearty.  I used the extra crusty bread brought to our table for dunking...just perfect!  The sandwich appeared to be grilled on either a grate or in a panini press; either way it had an unusual combination of cheese that made the sandwich unique and unlike any grilled cheese I'd had before.  i also paired well with the soup.  A beautiful setting and a delicious meal made for a great afternoon.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled cheese and tomato soup

nSU7Q9cvP76csLeUbXGq9g.text: **This review is only for afternoon tea service at the Veranda**  There are a few places to get high tea in Las Vegas, with the Veranda being one of them. We came at 3:00 pm on a weekday and we were one of only 2 other tables that came for tea service. While it was a beautiful day outside on the patio, unfortunately tea service was limited to stay inside.  For $35, you get a choice of teas to chose from, followed three tiers of plates of little snacks and sandwiches. Supposedly you work your way down from the scones to the savory sandwiches and bites, down to the sweet pastries. You can also add on an additional plate of food for $5, but the snacks were actually quite filling.   My favorite was actually the scones, which were served with fresh Devonshire cream, lemon curd and house made strawberry preserves. They were some of the most buttery and crumbly scones I've ever had. These were followed by a number of tea sandwiches including smoked salmon, scallion caper cream cheese on pumpernickel bread, a cucumber & green olive tapenade on sourdough bread, chicken apple salad on sesame cone, and an egg & dill salad on tomato brioche. While they were all quite delicious, the breads all tasted somewhat stale and old. The tea pastries included a milk chocolate & candied orange velvet cake, a fresh strawberry & Sicilian pistachio tart (my favorite!), almond & pear tart, and a "no bake" vanilla bean cheesecake.   For organic teas, there were a number of choices including orange pekoe, traditional English breakfast, organic assam, Russian earl grey, black currant, golden jasmine blossoms, golden chamomile flowers, mountain terry tisane, and silver leaf. I chose the earl grey, which had nice citrus notes of orange and lemon. Many commented that the tea was much better and stronger than the teas served at the Mandarin Oriental.   You get a little more bang for your buck and it's $10 cheaper than the Tea Lounge at MO, but you miss out on the amazing view there. They also lack in some of the details with chipped tea pots and the such at Veranda that probably would not have gone unnoticed at MO. Free valet parking that you could get validated at Veranda.

57VgsGKnJSf7BWNILwY6Dw.text: Great service, food and ambiance. The staff was so accommodating. We're local here and they'll even valet for free. I'll definitely be coming back in.

7FRewYk4M14nhdMtksFwXQ.text: This place is soooo good.  I would give it a 10 if this were a 10 point scale.  The service and the quality of the food, which I went on the weekend for the brunch buffet.   Our waiter, I apologize that I cannot remember his name, was unbeatable along with the chicken and waffles.

WOCRSpBo7pqS8POvFzex-w.text: Updating my review because I came here for Christmas dinner. It was a Pre Fix Meal and there were 2 choices. You could get surf and turf or the turkey dinner.  We both got the turkey dinner. We actually brought our own wine and I am glad we did because the waiter told us the wine pairing was horrible that night. We went early and there was nobody there.   The food came out really quick and it was ok. I was bummed because almost every single item served had cinnamon in it. I am allergic to cinnamon so it was difficult for me to eat. It was shocking how much cinnamon they used.   Oh well-- the desserts were good but also the same problem. We had to leave right away because I was having a reaction to the cinnamon.   I guess I won't go here for holiday meals, but I will try again for the regular menu.

tRyuRiYr_mMaoUOG0EKGDg.text: This restaurant was slow on the night we went, perhaps being new people haven't discovered it yet, but it's worth discovering this gem. The staff were extremely helpful and the food was simply spectacular. Starting with a superb cocktail (old fashioned) we moved on to fried calamari appetizer that was crisp and not a bit oily. One of our party had the seared tuna appetizer in a dinner portion that was so fresh and accompanied by flavors that highlighted the tuna. Really good. I had the tenderloin with caramelized onions; so tender it was the best beef I've had in at least a year. We had the potatoes and mushrooms in marsala sauce on the side; surprising flavors that were perfect in accompaniment to the beef. The portions were so generous (along with the bread) that we had no room for what looked like delicious desserts. The only surprise was how reasonable the check was when compared to what we'd have paid in many other gourmet restaurants.

_x8dZU-6adoVz75Wxwt4lQ.text: An absolutely unforgettable brunch at the Four Seasons. Quiet and attentive service, classy dining room, and a delightful selection of brunch cuisine. It's tough to pick a favorite... the brioche french toast was loaded with flavor, and the sticky buns were the perfect size, perfect for downing several per sitting. Made to order mini-donuts was an eye catching station, but it was the bread pudding with creme anglaise that stole the show. Simply incredible. This was a great find...it's nice and quiet, comfortable, and delicious.

-B6UkHoOcr92hy8dVFej8g.text: I was thrilled to celebrate the occasion of my husband's b'day at this restaurant. I had reserved outdoor seating for six for brunch a few weeks in advance.  While waiting to be seated I overheard a patron without reservations fussing because the restaurant could not accommodate his party. Shortly after his loud protest, he and his party of 5 were seated at an outdoor table. My family and I were next to be seated and to my disappointment we were told that outdoor seating was full and not available.  This was quite upsetting since the group before us did not have reservations and they were seated outdoors. I felt like they were at our table and to express my concern about the situation, I requested to speak to the manager, Mr. Todorovic. He was quite dismissive and exhibited micro aggressions towards me and my family.  On a 1 -10 customer relations rating scale, the manager gets a "zero" from me.  Fortunately and after a little wait time, the hostess was able to find outdoor seating for us. In spite of the manager's rudeness, we had a very nice time. The ambiance was great; the food selection was adequate; and the waiting staff was extremely attentive.

yJ1FThRWbR0T3g7BButCjA.text: Probably the worst service I have ever experienced anywhere. The food was good but not exceptional. Do yourself a favor and avoid this place.

NQVaCTV7od6NBHlLsNMEuw.text: I throughly enjoyed Veranda for breakfast. Their buffet had a wide selection of breakfast items. They had little cast iron skillets with meat, potatoes and cheese. A wide meat and cheese selection. Little pastries and crepes. Hashbrowns. The coffee was also pretty good. I would eat here again.

CAW2Tr4QQYufNc2p2cH_Ug.text: Really good stop for a business lunch. Had the steak sandwich based upon recommendation of a Mandalay Bay worker, it did not disappoint. My favorite part of meal was the cauliflower appetizer with sweet chili sauce. Don't overlook it!

WPwmR2HtyaUZstLd2t5G5Q.text: It was this place where we had the best breakfast of my life. And I am not exaggerating, this place cooks up a good meal! We came here right after waking up, on our spur of the moment trip to Vegas. It was a short walk from Mandalay Bay and into the Four Seasons Hotel. The two resorts are connected, so there was no need to venture into the street. After the short walk, we checked in with the host and were seated. Since it was a chilly morning, we ate inside. The place is elegantly decorated, clean, and staffed by attentive workers.  We had some lattes and water while we decided what to order. We ordered our food, which came out about twenty minutes later. While the wait was a little longer than usual, the quality more than made up for this. The food was amazing! And I say this about every part of the meal! It was very delicious, and left me feeling full for quite some time after. Please see pics. The staff was friendly and efficient. We were taken cared of very well, and left very happy. I commend their good quality, and recommend this place to my friends and family.

ByLsTtn5SaN4t6o6FZ4hCA.text: Ok I get it if you hate Vegas but want to be pampered and look down on regular people who wander down the South end of the Strip then yeah stay here, but why pay high prices for bad food. We "brunched" at Veranda. For the life of me I don't know why! My third choice Rigatoni with a decent ragu $26. The rigatoni was severely overcooked. My first choice was not to eat here. My second choice was not to eat but they ran out of Blanton's. Hope that they learn how to cook pasta and stock their bar better.

WAEKCthn9IO6dtzKYLW-ag.text: Nice little restaurant with excellent food.The first time I dinned here was in 2007 with my relatives.We were here for a breakfast buffet(you can do a la carte as well)The breakfast buffet has a great variety and the food display is beautiful.The waiting staffs are attentive. I was impressed with the variety of food that they offered in this restaurant.I went back here again with my friend for a la carte breakfast.We get a compliment fruit plate from the Garde Manger Chef and it was good.  The third& fourth time here for me was for lunch when I had relatives and friend in town.I would say a lunch menu here is not that special, but for sure the taste and quality is above average.The service is also good during lunch time.  By the way,I do visited this restaurant again for dinner for my friend Claudette's birthday.I ordered a 3 course Italian meal(Made by chef Antonio).I would say Italian dishes here are one of the best in Las Vegas so far.My pasta was al dente and other dishes were yummy.Food display and garnished make my dishes even more delicious.   So have here for breakfast,lunch and dinner and I have to say top class and want to give it a five star rating.I will definitely come back here again.

RM5vQwn_hH-KutxZdasuJw.text: Buffet review only:  Impeccable service.  Bomb diggity.  $40/pp.  Just go.   My boo surprised me with a breakfast buffet and from the minute we walked in, I felt we were treated like high rollers.   Verandah is situated inside the Four Seasons and right beside the pool.  Should you wish to people watch and bask in the sun, then the verandah of the Verandah (see what I did there?) would be your ideal spot.  Otherwise, I'd suggest you bathe in the luxury of elegant decor, white linens, and a relaxed eat-at-your-own-pace ambiance of  their indoor dining area.   You are not obligated to partake in their breakfast buffet, as there was separate menu  that featured the usual breakfast fare.   After being seated by the friendly hostess, our server took our drink orders.  We then galloped to the buffet area to feast!  The buffet was relatively small Eggs Benedict, eggs, and bacon.  I was surprised with the quality of Eggs Benedict.  I'm not a connoisseur of EB, but damn.  The biscuit was crunchy!  I did not expect it to have texture if it had been sitting in a food heater/water bath all morning.  That was a good surprise.  I'm not a fan of drip coffee, but damn, even the coffee was good.    Some stand-out items were the scrambled eggs with smoked salmon, peppered bacon, French Toast with berry compote, vanilla bread pudding, and assorted pastries like blueberry scones with lemon curd.  Yummy in my tummy!  Also Included in the buffet menu was custom-made omelettes.  I ordered mine made with spinach and other standard accoutrements you would put in any omelette.  One thing I MUST note  was my spinach was cooked PERFECTLY in the omelette.  In all other omelettes I have had that included the green, leafy powerhouse, the spinach had been cooked into nothing and offered no *textural* contrast to my omelette.  Oh, but at the Verandah, you see, my omelette was perfection!   Another area that exceeded my expectations was the efficacy and professionalism of the staff.    My coffee was constantly refilled and other servers (including our own) periodically asked about our food and our experience without being too invasive or too fake.   I was having trouble cutting the biscuit of my Eggs Benedict with a dull dinner knife and our server noticed and handed me a steak knife so that I could cut through the biscuit (I couldn't, but I much appreciated the gesture). It just seemed that everyone we encountered was genuinely interested in our dining experience!  That's always a plus for me and makes for a glowing review on Yelp.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast buffet items.

_Z-eUkwIegt8N2T_k7sq3g.text: Had a fantastic lunch out by the pool. They were able to make their Seafood Mac 'n Cheese for me even though to was after lunch. Service was excellent and the food was great. Would definitely come again. The service was a little slow.

tlOyWb_16AcS8o7k45V5YQ.text: Visited Veranda three times over a two night stay. Food is delicious and service is spot on. Brunch is fun and the guy who makes the donuts is super friendly. Bartenders are cool. A testament to Four Seasons level of service. We will definitely be back!

pLEInvmwXme0_Te-xtTkPg.text: Good, not great. It's not really a brunch, just buffet breakfast. No lunch items at all. Some in our group lamented the lack of a carving station. No way that this is better than Mozen, which closed their amazing Sunday brunch except for special occasions. Veranda brunch has limited items. Cannot compare to the other big buffets in Vegas in terms of variety. I expected better from Four Seasons.

RcPYQlRIkpmTDPdNgyZTwA.text: We came for an early dinner with my little ones in tow. They were very accommodating with my children. They provide coloring books with crayons and their kids menu is good. The Mac and cheese was good and big enough to share between two small children. The hot dog plate came with two mini hot dogs. The passion iced tea is so refreshing and it came with unlimited refills! The beet salad was surprisingly very filling. Our server Jose was simply amazing! He made our dining experience very comfortable. He knew to bring the kids out their food quick. We look forward to dining here again.

M7-WOPSFOzffJkWtJdwSYg.text: Vegas is filled with overpriced mediocre restaurants and Veranda is NOT one of them. Went there twice on my recent trip and everything was divine. Lovely outdoor patio and attentive staff. Worth the trip.

PxJaM0B0BWzwsfkxTO7WCg.text: I came here for a weekend brunch and got the hash with poached eggs, braised short ribs, peppers, and onions. I thought it was just mediocre; it wasn't too salty and tasted just average. I've definitely had better hashes before. My boyfriend's mom ordered the french toast and it was overly sweet. I wouldn't recommend coming here unless you're trying to get rid of your hotel credit.

DSgzhhvh-ElDZbtAc7LZpg.text: Lunch by the pool on a beautiful day is rather enjoyable at the Four Seasons. It is secluded enough to give diners and swimmers some privacy, but still be out in the warm sunshine.   The food is what surprised me. I got the salmon salad and shared the tuna three ways. My friend got the crab cake sliders and it was all delicious. The crab retained its texture and did not gum together like one which is made of all bread crumbs. The aioli is on the heavy side. The salmon was cooked to perfection. A beautiful medium with a nice warm center. It broke apart without flaking everywhere. The use of dressing was light and the flavors of the artichoke and other vegetables were present. The tuna three ways was okay. I am not a huge roll type of person, so I could do without it. The upside was that they did not skimp of the center. It was predominantly spicy tuna. The poke was decent. Nothing spectacular. The thick slices seared was the best of the offerings.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna three ways.
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Grilled salmon salad

AJ6H9WkwnwO0mlkXxBsvVw.text: There's just something so sane and proper in visiting a Four Seasons.  No matter where you are or how stressful life is, getting a cocktail at their bars, eating at their restaurants, or sleeping on those amazing beds will remove that stress in your life and make life seem, almost perfect and well deserved.  The Verandah promised this upon entry for breakfast.  The classy and understated decor, the beautiful tones that screams taste, and the nice welcome from the staff.  After a week long of craziness in Vegas, we came here to transition back to ourselves before getting on a plane to leave.  The Verandah did not disappoint.  The food was very good, the service friendly.  But since FS to me is of certain standard, I did take a star away because even after explaining to our server that I would simply like omelets with no hash brown or toast, it still came with those items.  Since I am in a low carb diet that day, this was simply torturous as those perfectly crisp, carefully trimmed hash browns beckoned to me throughout my meal.  Somebody has to pay for that torture, and voila, there's a star off!    I will definitely be back when I am allowed carbs again and will definitely try their afternoon tea.  Ta-ta!

BEjmAj0rhBW_Fhc0VzQRIw.text: This is a review for the bar at the Veranda.  While the room appears lovely, with windows overlooking the elegantly styled Four Season's pool, the bar itself is non-descript with nothing special about it.  Service was preumptory, with no personality and light pours.  The experience was so banal, that I would be concerned with dining here.  Thus, while I'm staying at the Four Seasons, I will avoid eating at Veranda.  Besides, it's a lousy name for an Italian restaurant.

9BC7LbInI0oN-kTlS4gSzA.text: My favorite dining in Las Vegas. Located in the four seasons. You would expect the prices to be off the wall but it is the most affordable restaurant on the strip.  It's shocking I know.   I dine at the Verandah every year.  The food is delicious and the setting outside is romantic.  No matter what the outside temp eat outside.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My favorite place in

4HGgRCUdCDsrhK0DoUxkOg.text: The high tea at the veranda is the best in Las Vegas. Such a clean and calm environment. Tea required a 24 hour in advance reservation. The scones and sandwiches are my favorite part. In particular, the cucumber sandwiches. The desserts are very good also just not my personal favorite. They also had them decorated for Easter. The tea itself is also very good, medium selection. If you like sweet teas I would recommend the mountain berry. And if you like green tea I would recommend the jasmine blossom tea. The staff are very nice and attentive. I would rate the experience a 10/10.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Decorated for Easter

P_q_iFSJvixgrBlrQzaXcA.text: We came here for a quick lunch on a weekday. Note that they only have buffet on weekends, and then only till 1pm. The dishes are on the expensive side, but what do you expect? It's connected to 4 seasons. We had 3 dishes:  The margarita pizza (I think that's what it's called) - I thought this one wasn't great, though the girlfriend thought it was the best dish. The bread of the pizza felt a bit too soft, and the sauce plus pizza was lacking. Maybe I'm just being too picky since I'm biased towards NY pizza.   Shrimp tacos - these were great, the shrimp was big and fresh, and the lemon and avocado sauce was interesting. I prefer the taco toasted a bit more, but overall I can recommend this dish.   Seafood mac and cheese - This was the highlight of the lunch. They did not skimp on the seafood, with chunks of lobster, scallop and shrimp. I devoured it in minutes. Girlfriend did not enjoy it though, so it may be an acquired taste.   Overall, I give the food a solid 3. The extra star is for the service, our server was very at tentative and checked on us several times to make sure we were ok.

mI2Ub2DVc00T8d-FCWhfXA.text: Great atmosphere! I went for lunch by myself and enjoyed the scenery. I ordered the soup of the day which is curry along with mahi mahi tacos.  Service was on point and I happened to find this place last minute when searching for food venues near me (stayed at the Mandalay Bay)

KnLJFRw_LibfliKJ4Q3kRg.text: Pros: inside the Four Seasons, with outdoor seating overlooking the pool and misters for extra hot days. Good quality of food. Tasty coffee.  Cons: had to ask twice for a glass of water, and then had to ask for it to be refilled. Price is astronomical for what you're getting. We had two simple breakfast dishes, one coffee and one glass of juice for $70 total. Yikes.

Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked salmon

_Bdx_imKiVLs0qyOjKFhbg.text: This review is for afternoon tea, which is currently $35 per person, less than the other area teas on the Strip.  First, I parked at the valet.  The restaurant will validate your ticket for you so parking is free.  My friend parked at Mandalay Bay because she is an Mlife member.    Tea is served in Veranda, the restaurant next to Charlie Palmer Steakhouse.  They also serve lunch during tea, so you will see and smell different food coming out.  So while this isn't an elegant or particularly refined setting for tea, it is still quiet and relaxing.   The tea selection is not huge but well rounded with a total of 6 teas.  I tried the Ruby Oolong and Silver Needle, which were both very developed in both flavor and aroma.  They refresh your hot water and the pots have a way to lift your tea leaves out of the water when it has reached your preferred steep.   The food consists of 4 types of sandwich, 4 types of pastries, and two types of scones.   - The scones (sweet cream and currant) were delectable paired with a perfect Devonshire cream, seedless strawberry jam, and lemon curd. - The sandwiches varied between perfect (roast beef and smoked salmon), good (turkey), and average (cucumber). - The lemon bar was exceptional!  The rest were just average.  Ricky was our main server, friendly and attentive. Teresa chased me out to my car when I forgot my phone at the table.  Wonderful service!

IB5jj8MtnS6obRFlZwHIjw.text: My husband and I went to the Veranda for lunch after spending the morning at the pool. We were both impressed with the amount and quality of the food we received. We both left stuffed and with a bunch of food left over. I ordered the Tuscan Chicken Salad, my husband got the Sin City Burger with fries. The fires were crispy and seasoned well...I kept reaching back in the basket for more. My salad was delicious--the chicken was tender, and all of the veggies toppings were fresh and tasty. We would absolutely come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sin City Burger
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuscan Chicken Salad

a68yw8PvMV7rPkmf9C4KUQ.text: My husband and I found this place after our stingray adventure at the Mandalay Bay - Shark Reef Aquarium. We discovered that the Four Seasons is actually nestled within the Mandalay Bay - with this gem of a restaurant! We were just going to order off the breakfast menu, but after surveying the options at the buffet we upgraded - which was the best decision! Courteous staff, constant refills on our juice - and yummy options!!

DU5yYepST_sa_zCxiF7kOg.text: Veranda and The Four Seasons in general is one of my favorite and often overlooked spots in Vegas.   The Four Seasons is beautiful and set back just far enough from Las Vegas Boulevard to make you feel like you've entered a peaceful oasis. Veranda is a short walk from the main entrance. Parking is valet only, but Veranda can validate the parking after you dine with them. The valets and employees at the entrance really make you feel welcome when you arrive and are very professional.   A variety of visits have proven to be five star experiences. I've dined here a couple of times for the Sunday brunch buffet (also offered on Saturdays), enjoyed a weekday lunch, and my friend hosted my baby shower in a private room here. All of the experiences were excellent, with both the food and the exceptional service.   My baby shower at Veranda was perfect. My friend did the best job choosing the details and planning while the staff perfectly executed the details. The staff was so professional and really went above and beyond to get everything right. The almond cake was one of the best I've ever had and was decorated beautifully, exactly as requested. All three courses of the meal were delicious and beautifully plated. Having dined there before I knew the food would be good, but they really wowed with the presentation.   Lunch is extra special at Veranda. The menu is excellent in selection and taste. As always, the service was friendly and professional. We enjoyed the Sicilian Meatball appetizer, Fungi Pizza, Bolognese Pasta, No Bake Pumpkin Cheesecake, and Chocolate Lollipops. The favorites of what we ordered were definitely the Fungi Pizza and the No Bake Pumpkin Cheesecake.   The weekend brunch buffet is delicious, my favorite part is the pastries. They offer amazing bread pudding, cinnamon rolls, and miniature donuts. Standard breakfast options are offered like eggs, bacon, and pancakes. They also offer small plates of dishes like chilaquiles and chicken and waffles. There's plenty to choose from and even a table of selections for kids.   The only thing left on my Veranda bucket list is the daily afternoon tea. I'll be back!

u-rMAzkr_wh3Bvy92l4hlQ.text: I have found myself here, twice, for a couple of small private events. A SHERO Foundation event and most recently a Baby Shower. Both events were held in the same small private room and had different food service but they were both excellent.   The SHERO event was Afternoon Tea and they do a very nice one! I am an Afternoon Tea snob and I will give my 'Two Thumbs Up' with the tea service at Veranda. The courses were on point of choice of tea, scones, finger sandwiches and little pastries. Everything was delicious with several options to munch on.  As for the most recent event, I came in for a baby shower and it was a Class Act Shower. The details were fantastic from the personalized menu, the delicious courses and the Baby Shower cake provided. The cake was sliced and presented beautifully with additional berries.  For both events, the service was great and our servers kept the afternoon flowing. I am definitely giving Veranda a Five Star recommendation especially for those looking for a small private event that is frilly, pretty and tasty!

eq4_d6JgJCY4nTj3agmknw.text: Veranda is not a place I'd normally find myself, being within the Four Seasons on the Strip. I am far from fancy, but I cleaned up well enough to make an appearance at a baby shower. We came as they were closing up the Sunday brunch buffet (selection looked good) and were seated in a private room with a set menu that included vegetarian options.  Menu had great choices with fresh produce and photogenic presentation, and staff were attentive. The caprese app, blackened salmon salad, and fruit tart were all solid dishes from their lunch menu. Based on the food and service, I would return for brunch or another meal here- they also have HH 4-7PM and a (reservation-required) afternoon tea service!  NOTE: Valet validation and vegan menu available!

I highly recommend Leo as he is one of my favorite servers. He happens to be off today as I am writing this but Paul has been great too.

VQU-yCD8bqEPOCLojyfOMw.text: Love love love love this place... seriously not because this place is at the Four Seasons because I wouldn't care. This could be a mom and pop and id give my honest review about it. The place is beautiful and the service is A+. The food is perfect ( but if you're into a lot of greasy breakfast this is not the place for you ) some of the food they have on the buffet table are portioned out for you so you can do a grab and go, you can also choose to do patio seating and it is by the pool side ( not great to do this on summer season here in Vegas) great view. They also have fresh pressed juices and other menu you can choose from if you choose not to have the buffet brunch. Plus, and if you have a hang over from hard partying the night before they have awesome Bloody Mary's. This place is a bit of an upscale breakfast place so don't be coming in here looking like you haven't gotten back to your  room to clean up or just came back from the walk of shame hall. Food is good !!!!!!ooooh you have to try their mini donuts and great shell eggs at the omelette stations. Yum! It's a must to eat here. $$

NowdA9XQPCa6JulHeq_vKQ.text: Veranda is the fine dining restaurant at the Four Seasons Las Vegas specializing in Italian cuisine. From reading other reviews of Veranda, one would assume it is merely a brunch spot, and after visiting this restaurant for a grown-up meal, I can see why no one is talking about their offerings beyond benedicts and beignets.  Chef Joel Ott is responsible for the food at Veranda. Having previously worked locally in lesser roles at Le Cirque, Allegro, and Sinatra, Ott inherited the kitchen from Naples-born Antonio Minichiello, who departed in 2017. I am not one to demand on the ethnicity of my food match with the ethnicity of my chef (since most of the people doing the actual cooking are Hispanic anyway), but it does seem odd that a job at such a high-profile Italian restaurant on the Vegas Strip went to a guy from Toledo, Ohio.  Astonishingly, after pondering my menu options, I found nothing Italian that seemed particularly compelling. I started with the zuppa del giorno: a yellow tomato gazpacho with avocado and supposedly bacon. I say "supposedly" because my tongue couldn't find any texture of pork belly or taste of smoke. This was a shame, because it was boring without it. The tomatoes were neither sweet nor acetic enough, and by the time my spoon reached the bottom of the bowl, I was not inclined to scrape the sides.  On, then, to my next course: a "Tuna Sampler" featuring spice-rubbed sashimi, a "spicy" tuna roll, and ahi tartare. While I found the ahi tartare and spicy tuna roll pleasing due to their spicy heat and seasonings, the spice-rubbed sashimi was served much too cold to be palatable. These types of mistakes should not happen in a restaurant like this.  My final non-Italian course at this Italian restaurant was an Asian-themed "Roasted Striped Bass," served with root vegetables in a lemongrass shrimp broth. Striper is a good choice for serving in a broth due to its dense meatiness and rich flavor, and I was looking forward to a preparation that would complement its sometimes strong seawater-like taste. What I got was passable, but I found the liquid thin and non-assertive; a more competent kitchen would have better-seasoned or spiced the broth.  The service here is respectful but ultimately underwhelming for a Four Seasons restaurant. When my plates were placed in front of me, a laundry list of ingredients were perfunctorily rattled off, but any questions I asked could not be addressed, as my wait-staff didn't actually know the food they were serving very well. Surprisingly there was no attempt or offer to go back to the kitchen and get answers.  At most Four Seasons hotels I've stayed at, the restaurant is world-class. In fact, Veranda earned a 4-star rating from Forbes, which implies it is on par with other 4-star fine dining restaurants in Las Vegas such as Michael Mina, L'Atelier de Joel Robuchon, Mizumi, and Sage. I must unfortunately report that Veranda does not belong on this list and does not belong in a Four Seasons hotel. Nothing at Veranda, from the food to the ambiance to the service, is impressive. If I knew nothing of this restaurant and simply materialized in the middle of it for a meal, I would assume I was drugged "B.A. Baracus"-style by cruel enemies and propped up on a chair so I would be forced to eat dinner at a mediocre house restaurant in a suburban Marriott. You need to fix this, Four Seasons - this restaurant is hurting your brand.  Food/Decor/Service: 3.3/3.9/3.7

Vp646lU4qfw_X-3H8giEJA.text: Situated at the Four Seasons at the Mandalay Bay is this  pleasant brunch buffet. It's not as crowded as the other ones on the strip and is a well kept secret where the locals go. The staff is extremely friendly, and ready to refill your water glass or juice glass! The omelette bar is wonderful and made to order as you like it. Be sure to ask for the shrimp and crab! I like that I can also get just egg whites as well. There is also a fresh donut area... with all the sprinkles you could ever want. Watch them come right out of the fryer. There is a nice variety of dishes including quiche, chicken and waffles, and  lox and bagels with all the toppings!! The fresh fruit and bakery display is beautiful and always fresh! The pecan rolls are the BEST anywhere!!  The restaurant is clean and the service is excellent!! I will be back!

6PhQHjitrJePKxoI3TTxbQ.text: It took me a while to write this review, I went for brunch the 1st Sat in April.  Let's start out by reminding you that this is my all-time favorite place for brunch buffet and I've been frequenting for 5 years now, and have given it as my #1 referral to anyone who asks for recommendations... But... I'm extremely sad to say, I probably won't be back. They've changed everything, from the layout to the food. The blintzes, chicken n waffles, mini donuts, mini cornbeef and hash remain.  They've moved the yogurt and fruits from the bar to a small deli case where everything is already prepared for you. None of it looked appealing except for one, but it was 3x the size of what I wanted so I didn't get it. You used to be able to make your own. The mini frittata was bland and not worth eating, but was better than most other stuff so that's what I had. The replacement chilaquiles was inedible which was a major disappointment.  Lastly, we were sat up against the building wall, we usually sit against a pillar (2-top), those tables are no longer there. It took me almost the entire brunch to pinpoint why the atmosphere felt so off - this change in seating totally disrupted what I loved most about coming here. I always felt like I was on vacation (beach) and not stuck in this waterless desert city, but that totally changed sitting so far back.  Sorry for the 4-tops that were sitting there all these years, guess we all need to have our day; but I'm mourning the loss of my favorite weekend getaway :( I'm all for change, but ultimately the quality of the dishes really fell off and I can't bring myself to go through the pain of it all again.  I really feel like I lost my friend.  In a city that can't hold a candle to my home state in the cuisine department, I had 2 favs (El Dorado and Veranda's brunch) that I've had to say goodbye to... boooo!

0cqOF6VdToO7LVOb7veCww.text: My 2 girlfriends and I had reservations for the Charles Palmer restaurant in the four seasons.  When we got there nothing on the menu sounded very good to us so we went over and ate here at Veranda instead.  Best choice ever!!!    We had the beet appetizer, pea risotto, the chicken dish, and the eggplant ravioli.  All of them were amazing!!  The chicken was flattened and then rolled up with spinach in the middle.  The sauce on it was yummy!!  The chicken was very tender.  The potatoes that car with it were phenomenal.  The ravioli was hand made by the chef.  They were so fresh and tasty.   The risotto was delicious!!!  We love risotto but it's really hard to find a restaurant that can malt right.  This place nailed it!!  Was al Dante and cooked to perfection!!  The service was great!!  Our main server was very nice, Helpful, and knowledgeable.  There were other people helping bring out our food and filling our water.  They were all very pleasant.  We will definitely go back next time we're in Vegas!!

SFx5NA8ujR5PCly-TSFzsw.text: I was looking forward to coming here for brunch, but it turned out to be a disappointment.   2 of us made reservations to sit outside and it was lovely out there.   The food was good, but expensive for what we got.  The doughnut station was my favorite, but we didn't get an omelette because no one was at the station when we came by. We waited for about 10 min, but he didn't come back. I felt like one mimosa was too expensive when you can get bottomless at some places for $10.   The service was our biggest issue. Our plates weren't cleared and water wasn't refilled unless we flagged someone down. We also waited a long time to close out after we asked for our check.

uJXxqn0JYuc4kMfhVWyjqA.text: Trash. I had been to Press, and they were on point...  Veranda tries to get away with things that novice eaters would fall for.  I got the avocado toast for like 22$ lmao what a joke this was...  A slice of bread...half an avocado (probably non organic), some cherry tomatoes, and an egg...nothing special at all.   Their bacon is ihop bacon...their bellini mix does not taste natural at all...the french toast might of been the only decent thing I got here.   Service is meh, almost like the servers take their time to judge you, glad I am confusing enough to feel like they never settled in with me.   I should of stuck to Tableau for a good breakfast at the Wynn, but Vegas is a never ending learning experience, if you trust me, trust me that Veranda is a pump fake attempt, just don't fall for it because you'll end up fouling.

6PqFtXxuDseVHvXYil2phw.text: It is likely by design that many locals and visitors do not even realize Four Seasons Hotels and Resorts owns property in Las Vegas, the luxury brand out of Toronto choosing to maintain a quiet presence as part of Mandalay Bay without any gaming but instead several amenities plus two Restaurants including Charlie Palmer Steak and Italian-themed Veranda.  Found at The Strip's south end, separate access from the Boulevard paired to valet parking while cost-conscious guests may prefer to use Mandalay Bay self-park and walk, it is as one passes from Mandalay's lobby to Four Seasons that both music and decor shift, everything suddenly smoother while a curved staircase and elevators await en route to the first floor where restaurants and Press Cafe are found.  Visiting Veranda on this particular Saturday, a previous Brunch and Dinner each pre-dating Chef Joel Ott's arrival, it was with reservations confirmed that two guests were led to a table at room's center, a cheerful captain quickly arriving  to take Beverage orders and explain the a la carte menu versus Buffet option.  Currently charging $39 for the weekend-only Buffet, included Juice and Coffee plus made-to-order Omelettes an unmistakable bargain compared to individual items ranging $12-$22, it was with a daily Juice of Watermelon and Lime poured that a scouting mission took place, the collection concise and elegantly presented across cold and hot stations plus made-to-order Donut and Pastry carts.  Selecting a plate as staff refreshed stations with new items, the 3/4 full room never loud even as guests partook in bottomless Blood Marys, it was on return to the table with Charcuterie, Cheese and house-smoked Salmon that a large glass of Sangria was offered, the $18 addition nearly twice the volume served elsewhere and very refreshing as Italian Bubbles were balanced by Citrus plus Peach Schnapps.  Sipping Sangria with savories and Coffee as a compliment to sweeter items it was on a second plate that Apple Pancakes were stacked next to Chicken and Waffles, the unexpected surprise of Bacon in the Batter nicely complimenting Sage fried Bird while an Apple Danish and dainty Brioche Muffin kissed by Sea Salt each attested to a Pastry cart that would warrant further attention.  Told by the other diner that both Parfaits and Chia Pudding were memorable, the former in particular thanks to fresh Persimmon and Dried Apricot, it was in addition to these that Museli and self-assembled Granola were tasted, the latter available with or without nuts and only minimally sweetened though pure Maple Syrup, Organic Honey and even housemade Jam are available to add as desired.  Returning to savories, Scrambled Eggs, Hash Browns and Breakfast Potatoes all passed by to preserve capacity, those seeking Bacon or Sausage will be happy to know that two varieties of each are available while small plates nearby are highlighted by Chilaquiles, the unfortunate use of heat lamps compromising the texture of Corned Beef Hash that was nicely flavored but far too dry.  At this point opting to add an a la carte option, $19 French Toast straight from Chef Ott presenting two thick slices of custardy Brioche beneath boozy Pineapples and Tres Leches Whipped Cream, it was after enjoying each pillowy bite that more sweets were gathered, the Scones kept in a steamer rich with Butter while freshly made Blintzes, warm Sticky Buns and golden Croissants filled with Nutella were all good enough to warrant seconds.   Sated but not full, the fact that all items are offered in reasonable portions allowing even those of limited appetites to indulge in a variety, it was setting aside coarse Poppyseed Loaf that attention instead focused on two styles of Coffee Cake, a preference for Raspberry based on nothing but personal taste as both were moist and crumbly while Muffins were appropriately softer and more dense.    Not about to pass on warm Donuts, each but a mouthful and the sprinkled round reminiscing of Sundays after Church as a child, it was after six of these airy bites that any remaining space was filled by Bread Pudding, the top a toasty landscape capable of standing up to Vanilla Anglaise while the base yields nearly-molten Custard imbued by melted pieces of Dark Chocolate.

Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Veranda Brunch 02/16/19: Jam on Table

ZV7kme_o_jg7JTkn0-oqCw.text: Visit after visit, Cold smoke salmon and fresh fried mini donuts.   The salmon, lots of internal fat, pronounced sweet smoke with just the right amount of bitterness, rich, soft, silky, velvety smooth as it melts on your tongue.  Wow!    The donuts, fresh fried, still warm, ethereally crispy on the outside moist, cakey fluffiness on the inside. Drizzle them or top them anywhere you like, naked is superb.  Add a bagel and the usual condiments for the salmon, a bowl of fresh seasonal berries, a plate of ripe melons, some cheese and charcuterie. A right, proper breakfast buffet in Vegas.  You don't like my choices? Well everything else Is mediocre. Pancakes, bennies, quiche that have become rubbery from being warmed, room temp waffles and dry, over spiced chicken tenders, piles of rubbery gourmet bacon and oddly flavored limp sausages, AC dried baked goods.  Very inconsistent service. Sometimes Four Seasons proper, friendly, efficient, always greeting you by name. Other times absent minded and clumsy.  The weekend breakfast manager needs re-training.  Never argue with the guest.  I was dissatisfied, told the server to just run my credit card so I could leave.  Problem solved, Instead the manager took it upon himself to come to the table carry on about how he is right and I'm wrong.  His actions cut the servers tip in half.  $39 for outstanding smoke salmon and mini donuts with the chance to gamble on service?  It's Vegas!  The choice is yours.

mRDaa9v4UpPRUC7KHJd8pQ.text: Anyone who knows me can tell you I HATE BUFFETS!   There are a few different reasons I dislike buffets here are just a few: -I don't like mixing different types of food in one meal. -I don't like fetching my own food when paying to dine out. -I don't like "community food" forums like potlucks or buffets because of the whole germ factor.  We flew into Vegas on an early Saturday morning flight and upon checking into our room at the Four Seasons we went down to Veranda mostly based on sheer convenience, but I had also read and heard great things about the weekend brunch. We were there on a Saturday which isn't as popular of a day for brunch as Sunday is so it wasn't crowded. In fact we were one of the first people to enter the dinning room so that helped me navigate the "community food germs" concern. Since all of the food featured fell into the "breakfast category the type of food I'd be mixing was also fairly limited. This only left me having to content with the "fetching my own food" issue which I sucked up!   I'm so glad I put aside my issues and gave this place a shot because I LOVED it!!! The food options were limited compared to other buffets which believe it or not is a plus in my book. Every item I tried (and I didn't even get to them all) was delicious and amazing. Even the mountain berry tea I had blew me away. No other buffet has impressed me the way this one did. I've been coming to Las Vegas for over 30 years and have visited my fair share of buffets but this visit to Veranda clinched the deal. I can now confidently say "the only buffet I'll go to is the weekend brunch at Veranda".

D5E52Xp6rPWBKwczkaJQVw.text: GLUTEN FREE OPTIONS ARE PLENTIFUL AND DELICIOUS!   Veranda has always been one of my favorite breakfast spots, especially if you can acquire an outside table. I've recently started eating a gluten free diet, but that hasn't deterred me from enjoying this hidden gem!   They have your typical options such as eggs, omelettes, etc, but they go above and beyond by offering specialties like a Gluten Free Sampler and Gluten Free Mini Belgian Waffles (probably the best I've had)! Veranda is also very accommodating when it comes to transforming any dish into a gluten friendly option; I've done this several times with the Eggs Benedict. They also have gluten free toast!   Gluten free options aside, Veranda offers a breakfast buffet with all of your usual offerings, but with plenty of specialties as well! They even have a Donut Bar which can be dangerously addictive.   Veranda checks all of the boxes when it comes to having a perfect breakfast. It's arguably the best breakfast in town if you're wanting to eat gluten free, and the prices are fairly reasonable for the quality. I've had nothing but wonderful experiences, and I'll continue going back!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Gluten Free Mini Belgian Waffles! (Probably the best I&#39;ve ever had!)

96PAoqpe0lF_i_PfusNjfw.text: I would expect a certain level of quality and service from any Four Seasons.  Verandah did not live up to the standards of a Denny's.

vxt5PScfoMzPY6MJBCjVEA.text: What a nice experience today for Valentine's Day!    The service was spectacular and the presentation of the food was great.  We had a made to order omelet, plenty of great hot food such as applewood smoked bacon, eggs benedict, french toast with warm berries, yogurt and fruit parfaits, plenty of fresh fruit served in individual containers.  There is a donut station where on of the chefs hand dips the donuts in various sauces.  We had the peach/guava juice, orange juice, mimosa and plenty of other great food.    The buffet was $35 for the regular buffet and $42 for the buffet with a mimosa or bloody mary.  A great, quiet way to celebrate a special day or to get away from the rat race of Vegas casinos.

z1pMJuq4u7xxG_IX6KeZ4w.text: I really wanted to like this place.  Easy to make reservations on Open Table, and when I called to update the reservations to a later time they were super polite and accommodating - especially considering the reservation was for a group of 8 (which wound up actually being 7).  First, the food - that's what you really go for, right?  The menu looks great; unfortunately, some of the dishes don't deliver.  Although I did like my salad first-course, others in the group weren't so lucky.  One person's scallops were over-cooked and rubbery, and the caprese salad was so salty it couldn't be eaten.  More mixed reviews on the main dishes.  The short-ribs were a hit and people liked the oxtail ravioli, but the skin on my sea bass was soggy instead of a nice, crunchy texture, and someone had undercooked chicken that had to be sent back.  The worst part of the evening?  The service.  Our waiter came by twice in roughly an hour - first to give us menus, then to take our orders.  Even though it took about 90 minutes to get our dinners, he never came back to ask if we wanted more drinks, say it's coming, etc.  And there were only 4 other parties in the restaurant!  When we finally complained to the manager, there was no apology - simply a head nod.  Truly disappointing.  The apology only came awkwardly during the THIRD conversation with the manager, after the raw chicken had to be sent back.  Then came the after dinner chocolates - they brought 6. For a group of 7. This was possibly the worst service I've ever experienced.  It's a real negative mark on the Four Season's luxury brand.    Because I like to leave things on a positive note, the drinks were great, as was the bread basket.

D5oW54-gxrPPEDybZZr3UA.text: We were going to staying at the Mandalay Bay so we purchased a $89 TravelZoo voucher that included a 5-course dinner for two, sparkling wine, and coffee/espresso.  When we walked in we were really impressed with all the seating.  Outdoors they have a mix of cool patio furniture and tables.  We didn't know what to expect when it came to the food but we were blown away.  There were three people in our party so we had only bought one TZ voucher.  The chef sent out tastes of everything we were eating so our third guest could also experience the 5-course meal.  Everything was plated beautifully and the taste of the food was DEVINE!  It was a dining experience, so we took our time to take it all in.  The staff were all very attentive making sure our waters and wine were replenished.  Everyone agreed that we will be visiting Verandah again when we go back to Vegas!

UoY0IGwG1a_Vkw7LvZ5L9A.text: of course is over price it is  IF THE 4 SEASONS for god sake! We had luch there during our stay @ the hotel. They have the BEST side pool food EVER. I had the hamburger, chicken grilled . The fries are to die for. Breakfast was perfect. I really like this place and the $16.00 for a hamburger is definitly worth it!

t8XLQbw99hWJeh9SdHJUpg.text: I try the afternoon tea in Verandah (Mon-Thu 3-4pm) and that is fantastic. That is done formal style quote from en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Te... "Traditionally, loose tea would be served in a teapot with milk and sugar. This would be accompanied by various sandwiches (customarily cucumber, egg and cress, fish paste, ham, and smoked salmon), scones (with butter, clotted cream and jam -- see cream tea) and usually cakes and pastries (such as Battenberg, fruit cake or Victoria sponge). The food would be often served in a tiered stand." Verandah afternoon tea makes you feel like you are not in vegas anymore. Everything is so quiet and peaceful. Of course the price tag $30/ per person is abit steep for afternoon tea but what do you expect from having afternoon tea in four season in United States? Finally, you had to reserved in advance for the afternoon tea since the sandwich and pastry are hand made daily by their pastry chef.

2Ruxy9wHlFlb4WLmwEP-Cg.text: The only reason I would go to Verandah is for the home-like comfortable patio setting. The food and service were both poor, not what I expected from the Four Seasons. My husband was so upset that he spent $35 on the brunch buffet and didn't like anything besides the donuts! I had the huevos rancheros and it was mediocre at best. As for the service, the waiters approached about 3 times to take our order in the first minute we sat down, before we had a chance to read the menu, and then didn't come back for a while. My husband used 3 plates to visit the buffet, and not one plate was cleared until I stood up to leave. It was a complete disappointment and I would only recommend going for perhaps a morning coffee, just for the beautiful setting.

gWpDEd6FhqZTfwn2EjK5Sg.text: My fiance and I went here for their weekend brunch after reading some Yelp reviews saying it was fantastic. Unfortunately, it wasn't nearly as fantastic as everyone seems to think. While the atmosphere was nice and the service was quick and friendly, the food was certainly nothing to write home about, especially at the prices they charge. The weekend brunch costs $35 per person, $42 if you want a mimosa or bloody mary. They had a decent selection of brunch options, but not as large as many of the other brunches on the Strip. And while the selection was ok, none of the food was spectacular. Just a heads up, if you're looking for an incredible Las Vegas brunch, this isn't the place to go.

kUf7odGSYj0N0Fj9HTEA0A.text: Quite a nice brunch in a beautiful setting, with good service.  Carrot juice isn't fresh, but everything else was quite good.  I think their omelet bar could've had better/different options to truly be luxurious, and some of the vegetables would've been better sauteed for longer before adding the eggs.  But, still beautiful setting, and far better than eating at the beach bar at Mandalay Bay.

IkUh6uJwRiC8-1LVrEDiDg.text: This place knocks the ball out of the park every time!  I go once a year and it is always a different menu with great options.  This year I had the bento box express for lunch.  Tomato soup, panini, pasta salad and creme brulee - probably the best lunch I will have this year!  Be sure to sit outside by the pool.  This is one of Las Vegas best kept secrets!

IpeNvPN6DYYPqme6L-1EtA.text: Verandah is the best breakfast/ brunch buffet in Vegas, hands down.  It is more pricey than most other places on the strip, including the Bellagio and Wynn.  That being said, the quality of the food and the setting could not be better.  It's located in the Four Seasons hotel and has a very tropical feel.  They have outdoor seating on gorgeous patio furniture, with palm trees and misters that create a lush and humid environment.  The buffet does not have the plethra of selections that you would find at Bellagio or others, but they are not going for the cheesy Vegas buffet experience where you wait in line for hours and gorge yourself.  The food is beautiful- a huge selection of pastries including plain and almond croissants, pain au chocolat, fruit danishes, cinnamon rolls, brioche, muffins, and lovely coffee cakes.  They have bagels with lox and all the fixings.  There is fresh fruit plated in glass cups (greek yogurt and granola parfaits, macerated citrus segments, fresh seasonal berries, etc).  There is a made-to-order egg and omelette station and about 10 chaffing dishes with eggs benedict, breakfast meats, vegetarian quiches and fritattas, cheese blintzes, and a delicious bread pudding.  Best of all, there is a donut station with a chef preparing hot cake donuts by the minute and glazing them with icing, chocolate, coconut, nuts, etc.  They are small, crisp, delicate and delicious.  Your brunch is served with their fresh juice of the day (which is usually a blend of melons and berries).  They use iced tea ice cubes in their iced tea, a major plus in my book.  Whenever we have peeps in town or it's a special occasion, this is the first place we head to.  Brunch at Verandah is not to be missed.

l30bS_gG9yCeCt82UYxUUQ.text: This place is fantastic for breakfast, lunch or brunch. The service, food and ambiance - especially on the patio is 5 Star. If you have any stress in your life have a nice liesurely lunch on the patio and watch your worries disappear. Oh, and the Iced Tea ice cubes are made from Iced Tea! Awesome!

EXOFAYEPLos9N5sj0FcLfA.text: Had breakfast on Saturday. Chose to order from the menu instead of the buffet. Chicken & waffles wonderful. Lemon ricotta pancakes very good but the butter & fig just a little sweet for me... I just skipped it. Service not so good 2 star. Saw our waiter when we ordered & when we got the check. Never in between. Coffee $6 :(.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon ricotta pancakes
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken &amp; waffles

CJcUrItbZ6kIvyGfRNmzXg.text: We went for a late dinner last night and had a lovely time here. The style and dim ambiance of the restaurant felt very elegant and comfortable. Service was courteous and everything we ordered was delicious. We started off with beef tartare, which was incredible. The signature pasta (served beautifully in a jar) and four cheese pizza also did not disappoint. For dessert, we had the panna cotta trio and loved each individual flavor. I am looking forward to coming back here again and trying out the brunch menu and happy hour specials!  The only negative was that they charged us for every single soda refill. Most standard restaurants don't charge for soda refills, so I would think for a high class restaurant where you're paying an easy $30+ per person, they wouldn't be so stingy on that sort of thing. Not to mention each drink was always loaded with ice, hence why we needed so many refills.
