photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. plum, peach, and cherry panna cotta
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. signature pasta and four cheese pizza

u6E0Ve1FwK7Lrax8lF5e-A.text: Yum! Dessert is a must! I didn't care a lot about my actual past meal (I don't get excited about really fancy overpriced food, but the dessert? Worth every penny! Tirimisu and ice cream bars were delicious!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu w/o cotton candy
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ice cream bars (there were four)
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tiramisu

yzqzb4InOWEHv9tp3-nB5Q.text: Best. Brunch. In. The. City.   We have come to Veranda for the last few years every Mother's Day and Father's Day. The brunch keeps getting better and it seems like they add more food each time.   We always sit outside by the pool. This year they offered the normal brunch foods inside. Outside, there was a hot dog/Philly cheesesteak station, pizza station, taco cart, meats, etc. The only bad thing I could say about their food is that the sushi wasn't good. But when is sushi at a brunch ever good? Rice is cold and it just kinda sits out. So that's not a real complaint.  Staff came around offering non-alcoholic sangria in plastic bags which I thought was so cute. I didn't like the taste but it was a neat idea. There was also Las Vegas distillery & brewery there on Father's Day to offer tastings!  I love this place. We will come back every year for the mothers/day Father's Day brunch even though it's a bit pricey. $80 per adult, and I believe my 3 year old was like $16. He didn't eat much. Forgot to mention the infamous donut station; freshly fried and dipped to your liking!! My son was all about it.  Service is top notch. Food is great.

EEhTfotsBxRIB4UnGHVqVw.text: Great place for Sunday brunch, you can sit outdoors overlooking the pool. They have a nice variety of cheeses and fruits, bread and pasteries, fresh mini donuts stand, omlete bar, sausages , fried chicken and waffles, etc The food is fresh and high quality.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak sandwich

z0qvReUfc9zb24CWZBh2PQ.text: During our stay at the Four Seasons we ate at the Veranda several times.  Esther was our favorite waitstaff during those visits.  The food, while not innovative, was very tasty and portions on the larger side.  Price point seemed fair especially if you come from the Bay Area.  I would return.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yT-Fk3H98sZMWCii4OR2cQ.text: Best brunch buffet of my life! Typically, buffets are large quantity, poor quality with chaotic, unclean atmospheres but not here! The food is amazing, good value - considering unlimited blood marys and it's Vegas. There's a good amount of variety with fresh, healthy options as well. The donuts are freshly made right at the buffet and are amazing!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing!

IalK43GphtLyEQYS9q9h_A.text: I went to several brunches in Las Vegas looking for a venue for a bridal shower. This was by far my favorite place! I have since been back several times for special occasions.  I highly recommend to anyone looking for a good brunch with a great open atmosphere.

MdBodFFAdJADxVXboQOmRQ.text: This place is awesome!! It's pretty much hidden inside the Four Seasons hotel.  I've never been to the Four Seasons for all the years I've been to Vegas.  I decided to look for a really good Sunday brunch place. After searching for an hour or so, I decided to go to Verandah.  Finding parking without valet was a bit challenging at the Four Seasons.  I managed to find a huge parking lot that was south of the hotel.  I wasn't sure if it was for the Mandalay Bay beach resort or for the Four Seasons but I parked there anyways.  There didn't seem to have any signs at all what it was for.  If you drive towards the entrance of the Four Seasons, it's valet only.  The restaurant is located on the left after you go inside, past the PRESS cafe, which supposedly has really good cronuts.  When I got there on Sunday, it was already sold out, so I couldn't try it.  I booked a reservation with opentable before coming to the restaurant.  The server was pretty attentive and got me seated within a few mins of arriving.  The place wasn't packed at all but had a decent amount of people.  I seat outside, which was next to the pool area.  It was blocked off with some trees, so the patrons at the pool weren't bothersome.  After digging through the menu, I opted for the buffet brunch.  It was $40 with unlimited drinks, if you wanted Mimosas and such, you need to pay about $10 more.    As I scoured through the food, everything looked good.  I tried almost everything and I had to say, it was good!  The scrambled eggs with salmon were perfect, not too much salt and had the perfect taste.    The food varieties for the brunch ranged from banana pancakes, eggs benedicts to fresh made mini donuts (check the photo).  The waiter service was prompt and they automatically refilled my drink when I went for another round of food.  I would highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cvleQkcex-0f2w9ani90eA.text: We went for breakfast, which was amazing ! Service is incredible. The prices are high but, what isn't in vegas?! But, you pay for incredible service and they made us feel like royalty. The atmosphere sitting next to the pool was just beautiful.

97IHxBV1x21FH0gIKEWr_w.text: Great food. Excellent service but very expensive. $27 Hamburger was delicious but not worth $27. We also had brunch the next day which was fantastic and a better deal.

uJ9NCXTbqUn3ACwYbA6INA.text: Met a business associate for breakfast. Delicious frittata.  Attentive wait staff. Warning--despite waiters refilling orange juice from carafe, you pay by the glass!

uCFaRQrBn74W5XjoquryUw.text: Had breakfast there this trip (off the menu) and have had the buffet on numerous occasions.  The service and food are always consistently good when I've been there for breakfast. Definitely kid-friendly, too (i.e., my daughter wasn't sure she wanted everything offered in the parfait, so they brought everything out SEPARATELY - nuts/granola, yogurt, fruit and mango puree - so that she could pick and choose what she wanted; much appreciated).

70da09Fixvy9pOByID5Wug.text: I am giving this a five star because of the server assistant Cesar. Wow, what an amazing place to eat; the best part is that even though the food was great our server and server assistant were even better. Cesar was attentive, new how to answer everything, and made sure we were always happy. Our server Ricky was amazing as well. For sure will be returning :) highly recommend everyone eats here!

YV-NBb9X2rYBfHJRrpsDCw.text: A three course meal with wine pairing for $55?! In Las Vegas?! On the Strip?! At the Four Seasons?!! That's MIRACULOUS!! I dined here last night with girlfriends...the portions were perfect and beautifully executed. The amaretto tiramisu was one of the best things I've ever placed in my mouth:  a semi-deconstructed tiramisu E robed in a white chocolate globe with which a warm milk chocolate sauce is poured over. Seriously, I wanted to sing odes to the pastry chef. I'm a native and I always find a reason to dine here and enthusiastically recommend it to visitors. It never disappoints.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A creamy, dreamy orgasm
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfectly executed
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Perfect 1st course

8Mm2HknDZ7BnUZAG7-HW1A.text: I really like this place for happy hour. Great deals on drinks and lite bites. Good quality happy hour food at a great price. I definitely prefer happy hour to breakfast. It's not that anything is wrong with their breakfast but it is just ridiculously overpriced. Avocado toast for $22?! I could have made it myself for like $2. There was nothing special or amazing about it. There are so many other better brunch places in this city so will probably not return very often did breakfast but definitely will for happy hour. And while the Four Seasons does charge for valet now, they will validate your valet if you dine at the restaurant so you don't have to pay the steep parking charges

MFrvSzVvAxrqRRZJBcB8Ng.text: Excellent service and delicious food. Came here for breakfast.  I love the lox plate. Good coffee and nice outdoor seating.   Inside the Four Season's hotel.

w0lYtm99s_4CaHNfSmjTtw.text: It's decent. Came in for dinner on a Friday night. It wasn't my first choice to visit the Four Seasons Hotel for dinner, but I think I was content.  I had the New York steak for $35. It was served a la carte, so ordered some spicy broccolini ($7) to go with that. Started with soup and finished with wine, so about $75 per person at the end. The service was good, not great, but still didn't affect the dining experience.

2HO21aLgQBYXuAd1HHLskQ.text: We have eaten here three times, breakfast while staying at the Four Seasons, and twice for lunch while staying at the Mandalay Bay.  We keep coming back for the very tasty meals and the tranquility that the Veranda offers.  I don't think we have ever had a meal disappoint, and the service is very good.  A much better experience than the Seabreeze Cafe at the Mandalay Bay!

4OOuTpEFoWvyMmfc-E0aPA.text: As hotel cafes go, this is as good as it gets. Tucked away in a corner of the Four Seasons lobby with a covered outdoor terrace poolside, here's a nifty little oasis. I've been several times and have always been pleased with the simple but flavorful dishes. The menu has mostly standard fare with an Italian/Mediterranean focus, but everything is expertly done in big portions with the freshest-tasting of ingredients. On my last visit, a big bowl of roasted tomato soup was particularly outstanding. Of course, the slick Four Seasons service is in evidence and the place manages that careful balance of feeling refined yet casual.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mahi mahi tacos with white bean salad
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful presentation for a tasty roasted tomato soup
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Patio

uI7JcjKZ8IB_ol0h0nWkdA.text: We had breakfast here (Sunday Brunch and Weekday) on a couple of occasions. The ambiance, as many have noted, was fabulous. The service is very attentive. We sat outside on both occasions and the staff makes sure you are comfortable, whether it is chilly or warm! All of us enjoyed the wide selection of foods, whether we ordered a la carte or chose the buffet. The had different choices of fresh juices on every occasion. While the food does take its time to show up, when my son decided he wanted more, they brought his second order very quickly. I take that as good service (or we got lucky because we were still eating breakfast at 11.30 am). The buffet selections were good on the weekday, but was a king's feast (or queen's, depending on your perspective) on Sunday brunch. They make doughnuts in front of you depending on your selections!  I would recommend a visit (or two).

GXj9qelXJpC_r83UHjn2Vw.text: So I just checked my credit card and it looks like what was charged was credited back.  Maybe the management did address the problem, I will have to give them a call to make sure, but if this is the case it addresses the problem and knowing they have such a great history other than the last visit, we will continue to be visitors for sure.  If that one time problem could be just that.

X7KWWwrRXVqON5IreZoYfA.text: Horrible service, definitely not up to Four Seasons standards!!   We stopped in here for a light lunch before a meeting.  The place was virtually empty on a Wednesday afternoon at 3pm.   The three of us ordered the same thing- Grilled Cheese Sandwich with soup combo.  Presentation is nice, but the rest is pretty funny.... 1/2 a grilled cheese sandwich with the crusts cut off (I guess that is fancier?!) and the SMALLEST saucer of soup you have ever seen ..... you know those saucers they put your hot mustard sauce in at any Chinese restaurant?? ... well, that's what the soup comes in!!!!!!! seriously.  All this for $17.00.   The sandwich and soup were both good... like I said we wanted a light lunch and it was sure 'light'.   So the problem came when my friend took a piece of bread from the roll they gave us and found a very LONG hair baked into the bread. GROSS.  We called over the waitress and showed it to her. She apologized and took it away. It was clearly baked in the bread.  Unfortunately, the waitress seemed 'annoyed' at us... like it was our fault!!  She didn't take the rest of the loaf away.. she leaves it there like we are going to eat more from it!?  We had to ask her to get us a fresh loaf of bread... after that she wasn't very attentive for the rest of our meal. I guess we were the problem... so demanding.  At the end of our meal she brought out 2 mini cupcakes for us to share for 'our trouble'. TACKY.   Our bill was $83 (including tip) for 3 half grilled cheese sandwiches with tiny cups of soup, 3 beverages and 1 LONG piece of hair.   Oh, beverages are a rip too. $5 for coffee, ice tea or a diet coke which they serve out of the can at your table.......oh now that's fancy.

TsSyxYMRqdjvxyWJaJ2nkA.text: Enjoyed a solid, enjoyable dining experience at Verandah in the 4 Seasons Hotel on the Strip.  The tomato/mozzarella appetizer was extremely fresh and tasty.  I ordered the signature pasta dish - an artichoke pasta with seafood served in a jar - which was interesting and tasty but nothing spectacular.  The ice cream pops for dessert were unique and very good.  For a little more money, there are better dining options on the strip.

iNGRe8NQAmwovFj7vpoB6A.text: Brunch on a sunny Saturday in Vegas?  Verandah at The Four Seasons made us forget we were in Vegas.  The ambiance was great, and the room was beautiful both inside and outside.  We choose to sit outdoors and the view was nice, beautiful trees and their pool in the background.  We were in town in part for a John Mayer concert, and the music they were playing was, well, John Mayer.  If that's your kind of thing it was a nice soothing brunch soundtrack.  We read good things about the brunch buffet, so decided to give it a try.  Everything about Verandah was memorable... except the food.  The buffet selection wasn't special in Vegas terms.  The mini donut station was my favorite part.  We loved the room, ambiance, location, however the buffet just didn't do it for us.

XrwN9Lte1mmiCM-ZOMsdrw.text: This review is only on the afternoon tea.    This is, hands down, my personal favorite place to get afternoon tea.  Why?  First off, this place is located in the Four Seasons (self-explanatory).  Second, due to the location of the Four Seasons (it is at the end of the strip) it is a more secluded hotel, and this restaurant is at the corner of the hotel thus making it a nice quiet spot from all the hustling and bustling of Las Vegas.  And lastly, the service as well as all the other desserts and sandwiches are simply top notch.  For example, even though there is an actual reason you need to reserve a spot in advance as they only make enough for the people coming, the staff was nice enough to place an extra order of scones for us to take to go.  They even packed extra jam and devonshire cream after we inquired as to whether or not they sell their jam to the public (which they don't or at least not at this location).  Furthermore, they have a medium size list of teas available, which is more than enough for me as I tend to stick with black tea when I do afternoon teas.  As for the other desserts they got the usual salmon sandwich, vege sandwich, chocolate cake, et cetera...  And yes this place is kind of pricey but really you are in Vegas and in a Four Seasons hotel at that to boot.    Definitely my favorite place for afternoon tea.  I always try to at least go every time I go to Vegas but I think their afternoon tea is only on weekdays so call ahead and make your reservation before you go.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Afternoon Tea

yA29LGVLhtz_GhVJLQtqSQ.text: My family planned on going to one of the better rated buffets in Las Vegas for Thanksgiving.  We arrived to the buffet and saw a horrible 3 hour line!  It being 5pm on Thanksgiving, we thought we were out of luck, but had spotted the Thanksgiving menu at Verandah online, since we were staying at TheHotel.  They took our reservation for the same night and served an awesome Thanksgiving dinner.  The turkey was moist, mashed potatoes and stuffing great, 3 kinds of pie for dessert, and a quiet, less crowded atmosphere.  Considering everyone working at Verandah was working on Thanksgiving, they were exceptionally friendly and accommodating.  I don't know why we didn't just plan to go here for our Thanksgiving dinner in the first place, but it worked out nonetheless.  We went back for breakfast the next morning and were happy with the food, atmosphere, and service then too.  Our experience with Verandah was definitely a 5 star experience.

9GIz0J_e6ekXcPcs-FvtKA.text: We went to Verandah for brunch on a Sunday morning. We had been looking forward to this for some time. Our service was unacceptable. As someone who has always bragged up the Four Seasons this was highly disappointing. I am usually one that always gives restaurants two tries before I give up on them, pretty sure I don't feel the need to return or recommend them.  After writing the manager and not receiving a response, they are obviously not worried about it. I can say the food was good, as it should be for $50 a person on a get it yourself brunch. I did have to pass on the scrambled eggs though they had the appearance of something from a motel 6 free buffet.  The fact that they couldn't refill a drink or clear dirty dishes is certainly beyond ridiculous. Thirty minutes to take care of the check was also on the ridiculous side. Honestly I've had better service at any other restaurant in Vegas and being a local that's quite a few. Sorry Four Seasons you've dropped a few notches in my book.

QFVBFV2KF6in4dY1R2dH3Q.text: Came for a final breakfast with my in-laws before leaving Vegas. We sat outside, which we immediately regretted as there was constant leaf blower noise for the majority of our meal. We had trouble ordering, between the noise and my in laws NZ accents. Our waitress very bluntly stated that she couldn't understand us. Really? Food was fine, overpriced for the experience. We won't be back.

IM7scmR__B46KDdMDJKZZg.text: A refreshing, corner hideaway at the Four Seasons. Friendly staff and lots of shade. Makes you feel like your back at the resort not the casino.

qCW2gfLCR2c7g83JqfWvxQ.text: I like eating here when I am staying at the Four Seasons.  The Sunday brunch is heavenly.  If I have my choice I will come and eat here whenever I am in Vegas, but I need to watch my figure so sometime I need to control myself.  Honestly, the service and the quality of food is impeccable.  The ambiance is very nice.  Who else can outdo Four Seasons?  It is a hard act to follow, I know.

SXFCzlTwXLHvrHI9Jrp9-g.text: We had a weeknight dinner at the Verandah, and it was one of our best eating experiences in Vegas for value, food quality and service. We were there for a full 6 days, and if we go back, this is one of the only places we will bother to visit again. The inside of the restaurant was fairly busy, but the patio was almost empty (February). Heaters made the patio very comfortable, and it was so nice and quiet, which is hard to find in Vegas. The service was fast and extremely friendly with good advice and knowledge of the foods and wines. I picked a wine to have by the glass, and when I was only semi pleased with it, the waiter was quick to recommend another and was spot on in his advice from my description of what I like. The food was so fresh and well prepared, it was almost startling. Even their iced tea is really good, and made with ice tea ice cubes to avoid dilution! Talk about detail!

FBvVDxTAcUabTOTCX6oaVQ.text: Brunch with friends. We originally thought we'd go for a la carte but the buffet was waaaaaaay too tempting.  Here's what I saw and then ate: Mini-donuts - fresh and just a tad crisp Omelet station  - ingredients include crab and salmon Organic freshly ground peanut butter - oh so delish! Pumpkin pancakes Peppered bacon The list goes on since I had to try everything.  Definitely worth a try if you are staying at the Four Seasons or Mandalay Bay.

JN7UDarOi_Yxp8lyJ390Vw.text: I came here for Sunday Brunch, then back again for a late breakfast.  It is nice that they serve breakfast very late.  I had a wonderful experience on both occasions, I was late for the brunch so I did not order the buffet, but off of the breakfast menu.  The first time I had the frita which was excellent, the second time I had the small belgian waffles which were equally wonderful.  I also had a side of bacon each time I came, I wish I knew how to cook bacon like that, I seem to always burn mine to a crisp.  The memosa I had for brunch was very good, but the bloody mary was one of the best I have ever had (at the suggestion of my waiter).  My waiter, Leo, was awesome.  Top notch service in every regard and a big influence on my coming back.  The atmosphere was lovely, except for the second time where there was a table with two rather abnoxious children constantly making a scene.  But that is hardly the restaurant's fault.

FiKs4oivJaDjP0IVoDQkdg.text: This is a review of the afternoon tea service. We couldn't be more pleased. It was a relaxing, albeit pricey, afternoon break! They give diners the option of standard tea service for $30 per person, or for $38, they add either a glass of champagne or a green tea martini. I had the martini and it was smooth. The tea service itself was top notch - our server was attentive and friendly without being intrusive. The scones were still warm out of the oven, so no complaints there! Everything - the sandwiches, desserts, etc. were delicious.

dwKfipOkThOBT1nHsJeYlg.text: Awesome.  Brunch buffet and bloody mary bar, done right. Very clean and organized. Great food. Wait staff very friendly and very attentive to the guests. We didn't wait or want for anything.

HjnSnt7ZWjXxkXA0mMSsVA.text: Great atmosphere in a place where it can be all to hectic! The decor, and food are very good and what you would expect from a Four Seasons.

BE9HETfRGq0evuQ2xJpaag.text: I have to say Verandah at The Four Seasons Hotel offers the best weekend breakfast/brunch in town. I personally think it's better than Bouchon and Mozen. It's $37 per person with buffet style and serves between 7am - 1pm. If weather is nice, I strongly recommend to have outdoor seating by pool. You can customize your own omelet with smoked salmon, chicken, ham, mushroom, spinach, tomato, bell pepper, Jalapeno, Swiss cheese, Cheddar cheese at omelet station. They also have a donut station, which you can customize your own donuts with different dipping sauces & toppings. It's fun to see how bakery chef prepares those mini donuts right in front of you. Everything I had today was pretty good. (Scones, mini banana pancakes, banana parfaits, caramelized peach with ricotta cheese, smoked salmon omelet, vegetable quiche, fresh squeezed watermelon & berry juicy, and even roasted coffee!!) Everyone from hostess, waitress to bus boy is really friendly providing Four Seasons quality services. One more thing I would like to mention is all pastries were not drown in tons of sugar compare to most of other places. They made me feel less guilty and healthier to enjoy their lovely Sunday brunch ^__^

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. omelet station - weekend breakfast/brunch
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. donut station - weekend breakfast/brunch
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. weekend breakfast/brunch

bMWtgo8j8zT0eyap44FHiA.text: The epitome of great service. Food quality 5 stars! Worth every penny.

D_VzBEnzPSpfpps1NGWGUQ.text: Very cute place.. This review is for Dinner. Dinner menu online wasnt the same as What i saw  When I first sat down, I was a little overwhelmed with the menu. I didn't what to order in a sense, so I asked the waitress for her favorites.   I had a glass of Yellow label, he had a glass of Rosso. I never ever drink red, but his red wine was so smooth with a touch of fruity taste in the end. At first, it smelled to oaky for me, but as soon as i sipped it, it was delicious  Bruchetta - I liked the eggplant bruchetta more than the classic tomatoes   capresse - OOOH so good, one of my favorites! The mozzarella was light and it complimented the tomatoes very well   Carpaccio -  oh man, i really really enjoyed this dish. The chef is a genius for including arugulas into this dish! YUM  Entrees:   Lampchop : it was very dry :/ my least favorite.. it also came with lots of beans?  Linguine with pesto : it was delicious but very heavy!  Meatballs: it was okay..   Overall, i really enjoyed their appetizers more than their entrees.

jxoFG4OZL8n3Ft8x-CbubQ.text: My boyfriend and I's favorite place to go to! It doesnt feel like you're in Vegas when you're here. They have a patio beside that is beside the Four Seasons Pool and also an inside room that overlooks th pool area. They also have a good happy hour and afternoon tea which I both recommend :)

kS-KSqdN3irJLDTU8f3ZMw.text: Bellissimo! Complimentary focaccia infused with olives is served at the start of the meal - it was fantastic! I ordered the bufala pizza and it was fluffy and light, yet filling. My partner ordered the woodfired penne and it was nothing short of utterly delicious. The white wine sangria was perfect and the cannoli was a great end to our meal. The service was impeccable - our waiter was so attentive and informative. I definitely recommend!

0Ndf_xUfWwn4QWvvsvaOqQ.text: This is for their Happy Hour only.  Went with a group of about 8.  They have a $5 small plate and drink menu.  It goes from 4-7.  It's not my typical spot for a Happy Hour but I love the atmosphere and the service, of course, being that it was Four Seasons was top notch.  It's not an extensive menu but everything was good.  I enjoyed the calamari and the flat bread.  If you're on a budget watch the clock because once it strikes 7:00 that $5 drink turns into a $12 one!

R4Jl3Ttk5lS-7HY6zp4VAg.text: Everything about my visit was fantastic.... From the greeting by Kenani, to the service from Leakhena .The staff was very attentive, and the meals were terrific. I had the cheese and tomato pizza for appetizer followed by the chicken entree.   The server knew the menu inside and out, and promoted nearly each item with exact knowledge of the ingredients and taste.   This kind of service is over the top, especially in Vegas where it is very rare to find such knowledgeable staff!

MfzTvErxq850452M54N0Kw.text: The brunch here is not as extravagant as at other Four Seasons and seemed expensive for what was offered.  (As of November 2014: $39 for brunch, $46 with one mimosa, $52 with the bloody mary bar).  My first surprise was the mimosas are not bottomless, as they are at other Four Seasons.  If you choose the bloody mary bar option those are bottomless (I highly recommend this option, as the bloody mary bar out shined all the other stations).  There's a station with traditional breakfast items (eggs benedict, sausage, bacon, potatoes, bread pudding, pancakes, etc.).  Other stations include: breads and pastries, fruit and cheeses, and desserts.  Smoked salmon was the only seafood available and there were no carved meats, or other more impressive items that you might expect at this price point.  Customized mini donuts and omelets were available at the made-to-order stations, and our server brought freshly made waffles to our table.

5fG-HHXnDAAWoU7E-Agsyw.text: We come for brunch a several times during the year. I had a reservation for the patio and when I checked in they told me that I would have to wait 20 minutes. How do you expect guests to wait 29 minutes when u have a reservation?!

SauTq7AJLrg3IuSejLbhmQ.text: I wish I could separate my reviews between lunch and dinner, but instead it must average out to 4 stars.  First, Verandah is set inside of The Four Seasons at Mandalay Bay.  The room itself isn't too big, but it opens up to the private pool at the resort, making it the perfect setting for lunch.  Four Seasons is known for its legendary service and it really shows here.  They even have a machine which makes ice cubes out of a few of the drinks you order.  That way when the ice melts, it doesn't dilute your drink!  Try that at home and see how impressive you are to your guests ;)  The lunch is 5-star hands down.  I always get the rib sandwich, which is always cooked to a perfect temperature and just melts in your mouth.  At $18 it's not cheap, but in many ways you pay for the wonderful atmosphere.  I also had the mini Klondike-like pops which are presented really well.  My dinner here was nothing special and a lot more expensive than lunch.  I had a steak (which I notice isn't on the menu anymore) that wasn't bad, but did not meet my expectations compared to the lunch.  When I do come back I am anxious to try the brunch which I heard is the best in Vegas, or enjoy my rib sandwich at lunch!

N5xV8fWf3BcDkruCXjb_3A.text: The food was a B-, but the service was a solid D.  I'll summarize by saying, it just doesn't feel like a Four Seasons.  It feels like a Westin in this property (not a bad thing, just not what I've seen from other FS).  Buffet is worthwhile on weekends, but below average compared to other Four Seasons, if that's helpful.  All breakfast food, fruit and pastries.  No lunch options for "brunch."   All we wanted was some water and a high-chair, but it was quite a chore for our waiter.  I wouldn't bring children here.  Again, I would be between 3 and 4 stars here because of the food and ambiance, but this is the Four Seasons.  You have to do better, and I think I'm being generous in my review.

vra-Hp9KmD59Ki1zpc-gbA.text: A wonderful escape from the gi-normous buffets with bland foods.  The Veranda offers buffet foods as well as a menu to choose from.  We chose the buffet.  Watch them continuously bring out fresh foods.  The Sunday brunch was awesome!  Mimosas with the brunch and so much to choose from.  The atmosphere is comfortable yet elegant.  You can wear whatever, but I was glad that I wore a casual dress with flat sandals.  Try EVERYTHING!  They make little miniature donuts right there in front of you.  Delish!  The food is fresh and hot and the variety is amazing especially since it's not that big giant cafeteria looking buffet set up.  It's quaint and compact.  I recommend a reservation.

ow8d7hqAezKMa244971UVQ.text: Clean, good variety of food at the brunch, a good break from the strip places... And thw waiter was very nice and kind to explain it was not bottomless mimosas as a lot of people believe, but I knew it because I did some research before choosing Veranda!

i5euq8q6zI2AQXwxoyRYMA.text: Seafood pasta is one of my favorite things. This place had by far the best one I've ever tried. A little on the pricey side for pasta ($34) but easily worth it. Service is really great too.

e33XDKeiIg6e59Z85_0vmw.text: We were in search of a good dinner, nice ambiance, and relative quiet.  This did not disappoint!  The short ribs were the best I've ever had...rest of the party had chicken and shrimp pasta.  Everyone raved!  Service was excellent!  Looking forward to coming back to Vegas to eat here again!

aPTCoZa_5hb-LJ4QHST6zQ.text: Terrific service and comfortable atmosphere aside, the real compliment is to the very skilled and knowledgeable chef(s).  Eating out is always a crap shoot, and especially so when one has specific diet sensitivities.  I made a dinner reservation through 'open table' with a note stating allergies, and to my surprise, the chef had prepared some items ahead of time.  I am told that most restaurants at Mandalay Bay are this accommodating, and as a local that's good to know, but this is my go-to spot for a great meal.  :)

FciqSglv6L1RA3rPn7-kMg.text: Breakfast buffet: mini donuts!!!! Great service and great breakfast buffet. A bit of a "break" from typical Vegas.

aiZSL_TZdcJBGRvPM5Dz3A.text: Was in town for work.  Based on my hotel room, I had very low expectations for Verandah.   Grabbed a poolside table outside, which I am a sucker for, and was pleasantly surprised.  This is a legitimate Italian restaurant...and by that I mean equivalent to a good meal in Italy.  Not Italian American.  Their signature (veal?) meatballs are really good, super light in texture and lots of flavor.   The Bronzing was great, and cooked to perfection.   Had a couple of pizzas to start out things right, and everyone seemed to love them as well.  I usually snooze through and ice cream desert but they had a really great gelato thing going on  and perfect way to end the meal.  Give how disappointing most meals are in Vegas, Verandah caught me really off guard.  Worth it if you are in the vicinity.

_FoSD2ye_TCVn977_B178A.text: If you are in Vegas stop in and order the corned beef hash, it is the best anywhere and they know how to poach eggs!

R2N-ckzd_ksEv4F9krPJoQ.text: This review is for breakfast. Had the lemon ricotta pancakes which were killer, didn't even need the very good fig compote.  Decaf tea (working nights) was very good. Spicy pork sausage was excellent.  Special mention for service which was super fast (much welcomed as I was heading for bed) and professional. Overall a perfect breakfast.

x4B7Enpm2Nsk2bBslfE1ag.text: As always good and service was exceptional. Try the weekend buffet, worth every penney and the Bloody Mary is just amazing.

JPW1svCazk9tLs91pKylYw.text: It's just not very good. Limited menu with no choice but expensive entrees.The service was mediocre at best. I did not feel like I was at a Four Seasons. The fish was ok, but the pasta side was disappointing.Oh well, live and learn.

RcDGmhAXs0cmQTj476Bpuw.text: Verandah at the Four Seasons is one of the few places I'll pay exorbitant mark-ups for breakfast / bruch food. Bouchon will always be my #1 in my heart, but Verandah has always been a favorite of mine for many years.  FOOD: The first time I ate at Verandah was back in 08' for Mother's Day. As a teenager, fine dining lunch was the only thing I could afford. Over the years, I've kissed goodbye the lobster eggs benedict at breakfast and the only salmon burger in Vegas I'll eat. The salmon was always flavorful and perfectly cooked. If I'm paying a mini-fortune for a burger, I expect it to be prepared the right way. The current menu offers all the classics which they do extremely well. The corned beef has--yummy! But as a fine dining restaurant, I would like to see a little more character and diversity--something unique to Verandah that will make me itch to come back to eat.  DINING: If the weather allows, DO sit outside. The patio area is absolutely amazing on a beautiful day. Its upscale and luxurious but you get the amazing view of the pool. They have big sunbrellas and adorable wicker chairs to lounge around and enjoy your meal--classy! There's also plenty of space between you and the next table so you don't need to worry about being cramped or eavesdropping. The interior is just as nice.   Whenever I come here, I get that relaxed, laidback vibe but I still feel fabulous. This place is perfect for having a nice meal with friends or someone you're trying to impress. If your into American food classics--you'll certainly enjoy this place.

YyjfYrsoRt9CdEPx8y2_zA.text: I have only eaten at Veranda for brunch, which they have typically every Saturday and Sunday. It is very upscale and a little pricey even by Vegas standards. But is also not standard Buffet fare. We have been there two years in a row for Easter brunch and it has been great both times. During holidays they have a nice upgraded version and you need reservations. I love their Pecan Sticky Buns and French toast and Dessert and Donut stations!! You can also sit outside when the weather isn't too hot.  They have had a really nice chilled Seafood Bar when I have been there.  This is by far better than any buffet you will have in Las Vegas!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts at Veranda are amazing!!!

YIM9ZewJbvFoecKzWtQBmA.text: Wow. This place really blew my mind. I came here at 8am Saturday for the weekend breakfast buffet. It is served til 1. Now previously if asked what best place to get breakfast on a Saturday was Id have said Wynn buffet duh! But this buffet is even better. To start off you actually have a server who checks in on you and you have the option for a la carte if you are with someone who doesn't eat much but you enjoy buffets. Like most buffets it includes coffee juice soda etc with alcohol for purchase. You get your own coffee pot but the server still came by and refilled it himself of he saw it was getting low. All of the food on the buffet is restaraunt quality not mass produced sometimes good sometimes meh. That being saod theres not as much variety as other buffets. Theres no carving ststion or dinner items. But a nice selection for breakfast. Some of my favorite offerings were the corned beef hash,  the hash browns, the chicken and waffles,  and the pumpkin pancakes. There are a ton of pastries to choose from as well and a made to order donut station which is a must try. There is everything from bagels to fruit to yogurt to eggs to cereal. There is a peanut butter machine that you grind your own peanut butter so it's nice and fresh and delicious. $44 after tac before tip but worth it... most buffets on a weekend for breakfast will cost a pretty penny anyway why not go to one where you get high quality.

2kvqjrF_XaI75e2RF06zwA.text: Located inside of the Four Seasons hotel, Verandah is an elegant hide-away from the noisy and crowded Mandalay Bay.    I came here with a few business friends for lunch...took the recommendation from the waiter and had the Seafood Insalate.    Lobster, crab, jumble shrimp, sliced boiled egg, tomatoes, greens.   Healthy, refreshing, Abundant.   I loved it except the price --$26.    Food in Vegas is insanely expensive these days.  For that price we get two entries in LA.    Wait staff is professional and friendly. Interior is stylish and beautiful.  I will probably come back to try their signature items.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The seafood Salad

zf59zzJCcauPi-KOHOMt0g.text: The ultimate brunch mecca. Never in my wildest dreams could I have imagined the delicacies I would try at Veranduh.   I was determined to find a fabulous brunch spot in Vegas for a bachelorette weekend. Not wanting a diner-like place, I was ecstatic when I found Veranduh. I called well in advance and they had room for our party of 9. The day of, we arrived a few minutes early, so our table was not ready yet. We happily waited in the Four Seasons pool area.  We were then seated at a spectacular outdoor table. The menu offers a la carte items or a buffet style brunch for $37. Drinks were additional but the Unlimited Bloody Mary Bar sold me.   First things first, get to the Bloody Mary bar. It had all the fixins'. All types of hot sauces, olives, pickles, bacon, salts, etc. If you had at least 2 (which you will, because it is so delicious), the cost paid for itself.  Now on to the buffet. Holy moly. They have everything you could think of including:  Omelet Station Mini Huevos Rancheros (in mini cast iron skillets, I die) Eggs Benedict Lox Pancakes Waffles Pastries All types of breads (bagels, croissants, etc). Make your own donuts (well, someone makes them for you but you get to choose exactly how you want it!)  I would rather go here every day for brunch and not eat any other meal.   It is expensive, yet somehow reasonable considering you are in Vegas. The food and drinks are worth every penny. Service was top notch (I wouldn't expect anything less at the Four Seasons). Great for a group, also!  My only warning would be: pace yourself. Try everything but save room for the next dish.  I hope breakfast in heaven is at Verdanduh every day.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7hf5LNt0VcuL4GGLunln5A.text: This is a MUST every year when visiting Las Vegas. It's a bit tricky to find but TOTALLY worth the winding adventure. The BEST Pear/Goat Cheese salad awaits you. Followed up with Risotto and a cool cocktail. And the staff, oh my, the staff! This staff performs BEST PRACTICES that are second to none. They treat me like I'm famous!!! Stop reading and just go!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. They really treat us with first class service.
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Consistently the BEST cocktails on the strip. This sweet melon-i.e. treat is perfection
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This IS the most delicious salad on this planet...and every other planet for that matter.

g3wyDuzcYLKD-HvEfy2ZAQ.text: As Oscar Wilde said, "Only dull people are brilliant at breakfast."  That being said, the brunch at Veranda was worth getting up for. We had breakfast there during our ray at the Four Seasons with the breakfast package. Normally we avoid buffets but this was outstanding. High points were the fresh doughnuts, breakfast flatbread, quiche, sweet roll, and my favorite, the bread pudding. They also let us order eggs benedict fresh from the kitchen. I recommend this highly for brunch.

afc1bmK_Iw0VgabLUTCZiQ.text: I always enjoy my time at Veranda - even though they have eliminated my favorite salad from the menu - the Asian Chicken Salad.  The patio is always a refreshing spot to enjoy brunch, dinner, or lunch.  Service is 5 stars all the way!!  I look forward to returning!

6tN1p0c5ysP7SlWOTxkZhA.text: We visited the Brunch Buffet with a couple of girls and it was really delicious. I'm usually not a fan of buffets but this was fantastic.   The stand out dishes were the pastrami/corned beef hash served in a tiny skillet. The mascarpone cheese blintz, pannatone French toast, roasted potatoes and black pepper bacon. How could I forget the eggs Benedict and the fresh donuts. The coffee glaze donut with chocolate sprinkles was oh soo good.   There is something about the four seasons that just transports you away from your worries and this location is no different. I will be back very soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Donuts

tuaYZE5i5B26Rtnag-D1RA.text: Went there for Saturday brunch buffet.  It was a four star meal, but the ~$50 per person price knocks my rating down to three stars.  We tried LOTS of items in the buffet.  Everything was good, but the pecan sticky rolls were the best we've ever had.  Try the watermelon and lime juice, too -- it was very, very tasty.  Later the same day we returned for a late night dessert.  The eskimo popsicles were great (caramel ice cream coated in chocolate and nuts).  The chocolate souffle was also good.  Service was friendly and prompt.

f7Fjb45MBQfRaukXHx5e9Q.text: Terrific place for a business lunch.  They serve breakfast, brunch, or lunch until relatively late, and they're one of the best high end places open in town for an upscale meal under $25.    I tried the salmon BLT.  Very solid dish.  The fish was exceptional and very filling.  The wait staff was a little slow, but given that the weather was great and we were sitting outside, I think they might have just been a little overwhelmed.  Overall a very relaxing, delicious meal.  I would recommend Veranda to anyone who doesn't mind spending $25 on a quality meal.  This isn't your normal steakhouse, but neither is a local diner.  Come here for a nice brunch in a secluded pool atmosphere.

exWHgof4-BQwTJwOL0xAlA.text: One of my most absolute favorite things to do is have brunch at the Verandah. Having brunch here literally makes me happy. Yes, it's a big statement, but it's True.   The food is always great, they let me substitute items on the menu, service is almost always good, and they have mini donuts. Also, their iced tea is the BEST and comes with iced tea ice cubes, so when they melt, they don't dilute the tea. And no packet sugar/sweetener here, replaced by simple syrup. Fancy!  I went there recently for dinner. I planned to meet a friend for lunch but she had to cancel at the last minute. I had been looking forward to it for days, so I was bummed and my kind hubby offered to take me there for dinner (one of the many reasons why I love him, lol).  Dinner was great! Ordered the fritto misto (calamari) to start. Fried perfectly and accompanied by a yummy marinara sauce. I had the branzino for my entree, which was delicious. It came with whipped potatoes but I substituted rice (see 2nd paragraph). A side order of truffle potatoes had just enough truffle flavor - many places claim to have truffle _____ but when you get it, you can't even taste the truffle. Not so here.  Mini ice cream bars for dessert wrapped up a fantastic meal. Note: my first choice was the chocolate souffle, but it takes 15 minutes to bake.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mini ice cream bars w/ salted caramel gelato (held in jars by sugar, for decoration only)
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Branzino w/ puttanesca sauce, rice substituted for potatoes
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fritto misto w/ banana peppers

9PrBSXD0xpM0N67Y151rjA.text: Starting at the parking lot you have extremely polite valet attendants and people opening the doors and welcoming you. Walk to your left and enter the Verandah. Do yourself a favor and ask for the outdoor seating. You can hear birds chirping, soft relaxing music, a peaceful waterfall, heat lamps, covered patio so no sun in your eyes. I instantly transported myself to the 4 Seasons in Maui which I fell in love with. Towards the end of our breakfast the pool was filling up. I think the earlier you get to the restaurant the better so you're not experiencing the pool crowd. Even then there were no screaming kids, still relaxing.  On to the food, its hard for me to decline a customized omelette bar. The ingredients were good but I think a homemade salsa would be much more appropriate for the high price tag we were paying. This was Pace picante salsa straight from the jar. Also a few more gourmet items such as sun dried tomatoes or goat cheese would have been nice. The highlight for me were the mushrooms and spinach which were cooked perfectly.  On to the hot items. Eggs Benedict was delicious, frittata, quiche, corned beef hash, scrambled eggs with salmon, scone with lemon curd, mascarpone cheese blintz with roasted apple glaze, vanilla bread pudding (couldn't try this because it was in a such a big bowl, wish they had a mini size), applewood smoked bacon, peppered bacon, guava pancakes, and more.   There were a bunch of pastries I did not touch. My husband got a pastry and it was rock hard. I'm thinking people don't waste their time on those pastries and it was old.   On to the next section- bagels, breads, smoke salmon, capers, tomatoes,  onions and do not miss the honey roasted peanut butter made fresh!!! I asked and there are no other ingredients. It's outstanding! I enjoyed the mini banana parfait with candied walnuts and homemade granola.   The juices included was fresh squeezed orange juice and fresh mixed berry juice (including watermelon, cantaloupe, and berries blended together). It was really yummy! They also offer coffee. The service was too notch. I never once had to ask for anything but it wasn't pushy and annoying. Drinks were filled and they walked away, I appreciated them not interrupting conversations. They were quick to take plates and asked if we needed anything but like I said it wasn't too much.   Don't be like me and stuff yourself and not leave room for the fresh donuts!! Don't miss out on the donuts. Now take a bite of bacon then a bite of a mini glazed donut and now yours in heaven!!!  For $7 more you can have a Bloody Mary from the bar. You make it yourself with lots of complimenting toppings and additions!! They also have an option of unlimited Bloody Marys!   I think I would have enjoyed this experience just as much with ordering off the menu. It's pretty expensive for breakfast but a nice treat that has some good quality items.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Banana parfait with candied walnuts
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Unique items
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Candied bacon for the Bloody Mary bar

wA9SnpIB107jxnifQoBoJA.text: The breakfast buffet is about $40 . Beautiful display of food. Great variety . Love they they have food already portioned out for you.  You also have the option to ala carte your breakfast. The oatmeal was delicious. I loved that they had almond milk. It's so hard to find. I know that the servers are being proactive and trying to anticipate our needs but I had been asked 3 times if I was done with my food bc I was taking a break . When my utensil are turned over I am done.  Our server Louie was very nice!

k9K51bNTCnwZOZtsRSFoXw.text: Most amazing place to eat and spend a beautiful evening in family or on a romantic date service is great , most pleasant place to finish a hard work day or just to meet your love one , Leo our server wow great job sir  really impress .

BVVU8Wyqh1Av6MI-jv7vUg.text: Loved our breakfast! With so many options to choose from, trying to find a good breakfast is hard!  This place checks off all the right boxes!  Ordered off the menu... no extra charges Eben when we asked for more fruit!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fruit instead of potatoes...
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummy Italian egg white omelette!

LBp-2YJnvMVibWSNNSqwGg.text: Veranda is located in The Four Seasons Hotel.   The ambience of Veranda is a 10/10.  It is a beautiful setup with indoor/outdoor option seating.  The food is all great but nothing to die for.  It is pretty pricey at about 50 dollars a person.  I honestly feel like I can go to Dennys and then Pinkbox Donuts right after and get the same, if not better quality food.  They have a pretty good selection of food but nowhere near other buffets in Vegas that are easily half of the price for brunch.  In comparison, the Belagio brunch buffet is 25 dollars and has a MASSIVE selection of food to choose from.    Veranda brunch has a fresh donut bar, cereal, fried chicken and waffles, pancakes, eggs, omelettes, and a variety of pastries.    I still love this place for the ambience but food selection doesn't give you enough bang for your buck in my opinion.

y5U1okZO2bKLq2PJZRYGBw.text: Excellent breakfast/brunch choice.  Great service and everything tasted amazing.  The $39 all-you-can-eat buffet brunch is really only worth it if you plan to eat A LOT.  Otherwise, a single off-the-menu item (you can choose the buffet or the menu) and coffee is enough to satisfy most breakfast appetites.    If you are staying at Mandalay Bay and want good breakfast food - this is your option.

WlbfUgjasIGZnz07l2icGw.text: This was a perfect spot for a relaxing, no fuss dinner! The beet salad and Caesar salads were wonderful and my companion said her risottos was very good. The porcini  pasta was absolutely delightful. We still wanted something g and the waitress recommmed the mini Eskimo bars. OMG! I would go back there just for those! Wonderful homemade salted caramel ice cream with a thick crunchy coat of dark chocolate. It was superb!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5ZJRJjlGPKkYo7LRRdWyyA.text: Was not sure as the photos of the restaurant made it look somewhat cold but it's definitely more than warm enough of a decor to have a romantic dinner. Restaurant, glasses and dishes were clean. Selection was good though most guests go with the prix-fixe menu that has a good selection of wine, aperitif, entree and desert. Presentation of the food was excellent. Every serving included a brief introduction to the dishes. Pricing was not off the scale considering the food and drinks it included on the strip in a four seasons.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The photos on yelp don&#39;t do fair to the ambience, I decided to post a photo of the recent decoration at night

l8wzwBW82THG_Dn6mPb0vA.text: Absolutely the best dinner. From the waiter to the food to the chef everything was perfect. Thank you for the memorable experience. See you next visit.  Two thumbs up!!

yBX6vkMrgExcCusARp4TUQ.text: Love this restaurant. It's like a peaceful oasis among the crowd in Vegas. Staff are great and the home made pasta is phenomenal.

hls1eJMFEdU6aKcxcWV7vQ.text: What a ripoff. I'm all about 'the price of admission', paying extra to get something a little more elegant and classy, and the design of the restaurant is that. But to call this crappy brunch a buffet is an insult to buffets. A couple chafing dishes and a prepacked fruit bar does not deserve a $39 price tag. The food is dry but more so, it's just plain. I get the same thing Embassy Suite. Dried out eggs, left over sausage and then they step it up with hash browns in their own little skillets, oh cool. Then you take a bite and realize this has been sitting under heat lamps for the last hour. And who still charges for mimosas on brunch Sundays? Even the Hampton Inn had artificial crab meat for its omelette bar. I will give a second star for the service. The waiters/busmen (?) were  attentive and friendly. At least dress them cleaner, the baggy dockers just looks like the second shift at the factory. But the fact the this costs $129 PLUS tip for 2 people, 3 mimosas, for some dried out heat lamped canned good food is a shame. Never again!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Again, the vivid  photo turns these grey hash browns to a tasty red
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I have no idea what these were, but good thing I had the camera set to vivid. In person they were as dry as the lot across the street
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I would be tempted to come back for dinner, but never again for brunch

K5XBXY3Cs2CRjJgiVHe26Q.text: I had a delicious and quality breakfast this morning. I ordered the Hash with a croissant. I was impressed with the quality of the braised beef and seasoning. For sure earned their 5 star.

eJmNG8uHwRVzYNdy1NG3EQ.text: It was my favorite restaurant during my recent trip to Las Vegas for four days.  I had a breakfast there. The poached eggs on their Benedict was PERFECT! Not runny but not hard! Their Italian omelet also tastes very good. All the ingredients were tasteful and cooked right!

vhkFMiw8IKJVwFEAHuLGbA.text: To me one of the best hidden gems on the strip. This buffet might not be the flashiet with tons of food on the line but what they do have is freshness! They don't fool around the all the extras that looks good but most of us don't eat. They concentrate on the essential and they do it so well. The only place I seen that rotates their line so that the food never sits to long on the line. Fyi save room for their donuts!! You'll thank me later

KVJG-eLMl5UcL9e0ni1qEA.text: My friends and i went here after a little weekend get away for breakfast brunch for 39.99 a person. All i have to say is this place is phenomenal. If you can get over to this resturant/buffett i suggest you do it. It is small buffet with inside or outside eating. You can go to another buffet anywhere in las vegas and you probably wont get half the quality of this one within the price range. Its quiet and very relaxed with very very prompt service which flows well. I had a little bit of everything and it was delicious they have a few choices that i havent heard of or seen before but other than that it was standard breakfast foods.  They also have fresh fruits and a mini donut station with fresh made donuts which is awesome. Everything is portioned so you arent wasting any food. I have to say they have the perfect bacon as being a picky bacon eater i was over in the bacon section quite a few times they have three different ones peppered,smoked, and applewood.  The cornedbeef hash is also a great choice just wish there was more in the little skillet. Egg white frittata was great also.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice chandelier
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple juice in a glass not a cup
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

4qyu2tYjDDkeGUEUxZqKDw.text: I love this place.  It feels miles away from Las Vegas.  Like a really high-end resort anywhere else but Las Vegas.  It's calm, relaxed, and quiet.  Beautiful decor and great service take it over the top.  I ate there every day for breakfast, and once for lunch, even though I had a breakfast included at the hotel I was in.  Don't miss the Mezze Platter as an appetizer.  It is enough for 4!  I could have made a meal of this alone.  The Tuscan Chicken Salad is amazing as well.    Can't wait to return in August to sample happy hour before the Stevie Wonder concert...and breakfast the next day!

yOHENV2vniBd6ZBUqnQwzw.text: Veranda is a very good place for breakfast and brunch, but since we came a bit earlier, the service was lacking. We got the breakfast buffet which was good, but our coffee cups came stained and we had to get more. Our server wasn't awful, but never seemed excited to check in on us and it showed. The eggs were also a bit watery. The place wasn't bad, but I would find a different brunch restaurant in Vegas.

BYAnL6HtWvSd_PbXNBeFqQ.text: They say the devil is in the details and I'd expect a restaurant at The Four Seasons to have a handle on the details. Unfortunately, that ball was dropped. Hard.   The hostess was mildly unpleasant. The waiter was stand-offish and slow. And, considering the restaurant had more staff than customers at the time we visited, the service was surprisingly inattentive.   We came for happy hour because the happy hour menu was attractive and well priced (especially for Vegas and The Four Seasons). The Mozzarella Carrozza was delicious and I would have gladly ordered a second plate had I been pleased with the service (almost being impaled with silverware when the server *threw* them down on the table in front of us was a big miss).      The drinks were quite good as well. I enjoyed the Mai Thai, although it seems the bartender overfilled the drink; the glass was sticky. I'd expect that at a dive-bar, but not from The Four Seasons.   Overall, I was sorely disappointed with my visit to Veranda. Given the other reviews for this lounge, I'd hope my experience was the exception and not the rule. However, considering this establishment is representing one of the premier luxury hotels, I'd expect a higher level of service and a more polished experience. Perhaps my next visit will be better.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Fly-Tai is a great $7 option during happy hour!

IK4dg3ornFUhT3__VnSRkA.text: This is a must on any visit to Las Vegas. The atmosphere is always inviting and warm while the food is always delicious.  I recommend breakfast, lunch and dinner.  One day I sampled the huevos rancheros for breakfast and was pleasantly surprised at the flavor. I normally have the frittata.  Another visit for tried the crab and avocado salad for lunch with a wonderful wine.  One night I had a chocolate cake for dessert and I also tried the trio of sorbet.  Divine!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos Rancheros
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate cake.
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab and avocado salad.

a1NBlqbMdneVTPiIPq_FeA.text: I came to the Four Seasons for a meeting and lunch. First off, this is now my favorite hotel on the strip! You are warmly greeted from the beginning. It's a smaller hotel, therefore, it is easy to get around. I had lunch at Veranda and it was delicious! I would recommend their Crab Avocado Toast and Tomato Soup! They have an outdoor area and also provide private spaces for events! I will be coming again in the future!

vlV5VfFRr7rlt4U7-HJDGQ.text: My family and I ate here quite a bit during our stay at the Four Seasons in Las Vegas... we had breakfast here every day of our stay (4 days) and had lunch here once, as well as one other member of our family having dinner here one night while the rest of us were at a show.   The layout is nice - plenty of inside seating at tables and some booths.  There is also outdoor patio seating by the outside private pool at the Four Seasons which is much smaller than Mandalay but is also quiet and not crowded at all so it's very pleasant.    Breakfast here is VERY good with lots of options and very healthy fare - so I was pretty happy about that because usually there is only one healthy option and the rest is bad but it was a healthy mix of both.  I tried their healthy sampler which had some carrot/orange juice, a carrot blueberry whole wheat muffin, some quinoa muesli and some yogurt with berries.  It was DELICIOUS.  Best part was their fresh warm muffin - I adored it and ended up ordering it a few more times to have with my other breakfast choices.  My husband ordered their s'mores french toast and, while I usually dislike french toast, I ate some of his and loved it.    We got their weekend breakfast buffet one day and enjoyed it very much - at around $40 a person it's fairly pricey but everything at the Four Seasons is (or in Vegas for that matter) so we went ahead.  The buffet also had some healthy options (tons in fact) and the standard fare like eggs, waffles, etc.  I liked that they had scones with lemon cream, mini chicken and waffles, a fresh omelet bar, a fresh mini donut bar, and tons of fresh fruits and pastries.  Very nice buffet with options to please any palette.    We stopped in and had a nice lunch out on the patio one afternoon where I ordered their Salmon salad and enjoyed it very much - it was light and healthy with fresh ingredients.  My husband ordered a Bison burger I believe and I tasted it - also very good.   All in all - we very much enjoyed this restaurant and will likely eat here again when staying in Vegas for our next trip.

4gYyF7_uImaQoNjy5mgK0A.text: Great quiet spot inside Four Seasons Hotel is a good find. The blackened salmon salad was excellent! Think crust wood fired pizza was good as well.

Oc_SVKL0bDas7bVastXZxg.text: It was difficult for me to locate this place.  It is in the Four Seasons.  Nicely located poolside.  We sat outdoors.  On a hot day I would not suggest it.  There did not appear to be any misters or anything. They provide bread and olive oil.  The service is excellent!!!   Caprese salad - DELICIOUS. The red and yellow tomatoes were so good. Highly recommend.  Sliders - WOW. juicy flavorful cooked to perfection. I requested truffle aioli and smothered it all over... Even more yummy!   The potatoes with the are more like Criscut potato chips. Not was I expected but the sliders are so good it didn't matter.   I really enjoyed my afternoon eating here in the sun with my shades on.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sliders
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margherita pizza
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Caprese

cteS3SmgcMM1obR2esyvDg.text: Wonderful and kind staff and tasty food. This is a very relaxing and quiet dinning experience. I'd happily eat there again.

mkYRzMBf0Mc33W_dlwbCCw.text: Best breakfast buffet I had on the strip! We arrived on a Friday morning around 9:00am-- 45 minutes before our reservation, and were still seated right away with our choice of indoor or outdoor. We were seated outdoors Infront of the empty pool. For a weekend morning, things were surprisingly calm. Selection was great: Soft scrambled eggs, omelettes, quiche, potatoes, hash browns, bacon, sausage, cereals, yogurt, cakes, segmented fruit, charcuterie, pastries, coffee, fresh squeezed juices, and more! Compared to the prices of the menu + drinks (hello, $22 avocado toast), the $39 price was a great deal.

YGLw9Vo6mIrPzPvuPbhNtQ.text: My place to go for relaxing enjoyable breakfast or brunch, dinner menu can benefit from more choices. In general great place to indulge yourself without breaking the bank!

q85hFsunM645xjpr43xlVA.text: What an unforgettable awesome experience. Our bartender Gabe was fabulous. He gave wonderful recommendations and since it was my birthday the tiramasu was brought out saying happy birthday. I had the half order of la pasta cotta Mel vaso and it was seriously out of this world. The appetizer of ahi tuna was unbelievable. The chef Antonia came out and greeted. My mother had the chicken and it is official I will be dreaming of that too. We ended out evening with wonderful cappuccinos and there tiramisu was a league of its own also their mini ice cream bars are something. I cannot wait to return. Not to mention multiple people told me the pancakes are the best in the world. Yay for this awesome place. Ambiance fabulous service spectacular. I highly recommend going to this establishment. It is a hidden treasure.

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken to dream about

NboVInQjOuyKf7uUyTQbEg.text: Hands down the best brunch in vegas. we go there mainly for that. love staff, food is awesome & fresh and they will make it right for you all the time. ambiance is perfect. must go for saturday or sunday brunch. i think the brunch is until either 1 or 2pm only. so hurry up!!!

EsZNsPvGRTCYSq1x-xHucg.text: We had the brunch buffet on sunday am.  It was pricey at 39 a person but expected given the location in the Four Seasons.  It did not disappoint, we did a walk through to confirm it was worth the price.  The sheer volume and diversity combined with the attention to detail and preparation of each thing we tried was impressive.  This is not the usual mass produced brunch buffet.  Each station had individual servings of items like chilaquiles, hash, sticky buns, bread pudding. As well as all the usual fare for breakfast.  The omelet/scramble bar with the chef making what you ordered was impressive and the ingredients were all fresh.  The normal pastries and carb section had the interesting addition of a homemade hot doughnut bar.  Great quality and quantity for the price.  Would highly recommend if you don't mind spending the money and appreciate quality ingredients. If you just want some of the red, some of the yellow and some of the orange for your 10 dollar brunch, you better look elsewhere.

mppjft8_wt0b58K_axr86Q.text: Located inside the Four Seasons Hotel, this is my favorite Sunday breakfast buffet! Around $40 per person and $80 for Easter brunch, this buffet has it all! Omelet station, toast/bagels, lox, hash browns, silver dollar pancakes, chicken apple sausage... All your breakfast favorites prepared uniquely! They always add new items to the menu- my favorite is the chicken and waffles! Your brunch comes with coffee and choice of juice. If weather permits, make a reservation in advance for outside seating, you won't regret it!

-WAHQTK6HRW2FMPYFMGCow.text: This place is amazing! First and foremost I want to say how great and extremely on point the staff is. They greeted me with a smile, ask for my name and then everyone that came by my table addressed me as Mr Uy, which I must confess is a bit weird for me.  I stopped by for breakfast and ordered the Egg White Frittata and was blown away. I ordered it w/o the pesto, because I just find pesto a bit over powering for me at times and I just wasnt ready to start my day with "pesto breath". Coffee was a tad strong but was bottomless and I also ordered a mimosa which I later regretted. It was nice, but it cost $14 compared to my meal that was only $16.  I forgot to add that I had my breakfast outside on the patio which is poolside. If the weather is cooperative, I really recommend you eat on the patio.  I had an amazing experience here and will definitely come back, hopefully with some friends next time!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg White Frittata sans the Pesto

Z0C4gUEFs5LJ2Pjtqb_9BA.text: Such a peaceful and elegant place to have tea. The restaurant is tucked away in a small corner of the Four Seasons Resort, which is connected to Mandalay Bay. If you park in Mandalay Bay's lot you can easily walk there. They do require 24 hours of advance notice, so book ahead. They make some of the best scones I've ever had, and paired with one of their organic teas you can't go wrong. The staff were extremely pleasant and accommodating...since I came at the end of tea time they even let me take some extra scones to go! Please check out my full review here: thirstyfortea.com/2013/0...

ASm_jECCPDu8zNf0uKz6jQ.text: This review is for a lunch seating.   We sat down, ordered, ate and nothing came back up. That's about the only nice thing I can say about the food.   Service was very friendly and it's got decent ambience, especially on the patio.   If you must eat here, unless you enjoy government cheese melted onto soggy cardboard, I suggest you avoid the pizzas.

gFZLksD_60NONjFZmVpqSw.text: Beautiful restaurant inside a beautiful hotel. Even though it seemed upscale, it was a very comfortable and relaxed atmosphere. The staff was excellent. I valeted my car and I had no worries. I was there for a party so we were in a private room. The food was delicious. I had the Tomato Bisque, Italian Chicken Salad, and the Cream Brulee. Yum!  I would go back to try more of their menu. We arrived near the end of brunch so I got to spy all the goodies set out.

ITygk_EbrEvi1Fo14lFVEw.text: Breakfast at Veranda at the Four Seasons. The Veranda has been an oasis for me over the years. Tranquil with great service, excellent food I have always looked forward to my breakfasts here. However, this trip was different. Maybe it was how the Four Seasons screwed up my reservation and made us scramble to find a room the day BEFORE we were suppose to come (a story for another time) that tainted our breakfast. I don't know. The huevos rancheros were good, not great. The coffee was good, not great. It was just off. And to make matters worse, they took off the menu one of the best breakfast items on the strip, the corned beef and pastrami hash. No longer and I was so in the mood for it! Sigh. The track record speaks for itself so I will undoubtedly return again. But I will say that with the changes that have occurred at the Four Seasons recently (mostly behind scenes management stuff) I am not all that encouraged for the future.

ahiXWr5mSXt9x0fbS4l-Cw.text: Excellent of breakfast or Sunday brunch! There's indoor or outdoor seating overseeing the pool. The menu consists of updated and elevated classic breakfast items. The service is very upscale, and the atmosphere serene. Great place for a gathering in the AM...This is the Four Seasons, so expect to pay up! But so worth it...:)

bMo-M3OrTiOeAdIRHYuuhA.text: Probably one of the reasons I will not stay in the four seasons Las Vegas again. We have tried to have a nice Christmas dinner at this restaurant, but after we waited about 20 min to get seated (we had a reservation) we got informed that the first course of the only one dining option (4 course price fix menu) was not available. We had to skip the first course and where only offered 7$ discount. Moving on this restaurant also services the breakfast to the rooms at the four seasons. We stayed 2 nights and both nights out fruit plates where missing.  This Restaurant is absolutely not up to the expected four seasons standard.

U63ZpFNk5bKCddvTMi4-Jw.text: LOVELY!  What a wonderful setting to enjoy a meal.    The Scene... contemporary... a tad intimate but not romantic... upscale restaurant to enjoy a meal.  It was a bit busy today (Sunday around noon) for brunch/lunch... and Everyone wanted to sit outside... so we opted (since we were hungry) to sit inside.  Really wanted to sit outside... but... next time.  The Brunch... if you opt for the Buffet... it's $35 and includes tea, coffee and juice... we were not that hungry... so we ordered off the a la carte menu.  The buffet is lovely but not Huge and Overwhelming like other hotel buffets.  In fact, from the aromas and the entrees I saw... it looked very appealing and the omelet station was very nice where you can have custom omelets/eggs...  And the Bread / Pastry area made my mouth water... which is why I opted NOT to eat the Buffet... it would have been easy to go Hog Wild with all the good looking eats.  Ordered the Eggs Benedict.... which is served on a round Polenta Cake... I say "Cake" because the Polenta was more cake like... sweet and creamy at the same time... (it took the place of the typical starch of the English Muffin)... it came with a nice poached egg and candian bacon on top... you get 2 servings... along with a side of steamed asparagus.  My mother ordered the Mini Waffles... and while Mini... they were big on taste and very artfully presented.  She got 3... one with berries, one with dried cranberries and one with cinnamon butter.    Our friend ordered the egg white frittata which came with a side of toaste which came in a basket.  For a Beverage... I ordered a Bloody Mary.... it's Darn good.... not as good as the one at THE cafe at THE hotel... but definitley Solid.  Mom had a Mimosa... she said it was ok.  The check for the 3 of us... with our 2 alcoholic beverages and 1 coffee was $92 before tip.... this is a bit pricey... but 1) it's the Four Seasons and 2) it's Vegas.  Note... if you order coffee... it's $5.50... personally I think that's a rip off but what do I know.

TLiawlgIfYF-mTuvBrs3HQ.text: Had a nice little breakfast here when we arrived early to our hotel and our room was not available. We headed over to the Veranda. Hubby had the Eggs Benedict which he said was "fine" but didn't wow him. I had the Il Campania spinach omelet with hashbrowns. The omelet was good, nothing special, but I thought the hashbrowns were really good. They were light and crispy on the outside. Hubby tried a bite and got his own side order of hashbrowns. A solid place to get breakfast. They also have an "express buffet" on the weekdays which is a scaled down version of their regular buffet.

gE5ycAxTanp01rBod4mS0Q.text: Had the brunch and the bloody mary bar.. all tasty, great choices at the bloody mary bar was pretty varied. everything was good, fresh and hot.... the donut making station was yummy

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VwNqjDLAkvlgfnLpdobIKw.text: Had brunch here our first morning/afternoon in Vegas. The atmosphere is everything you imagine a restaurant at the Four Seasons would be. Quiet. Breezy. Elite.   I had a couple of eggs and bacon with hashbrowns, and found it to be pretty delicious. My husband had the Huevos Rancheros. It came with a large sausage and a whole lot of cheese. It must have been tasty because he didn't speak much.   We sat out on the patio for our meal, and it was really nice to get away from the hustle and bustle of the cars zooming by on the Strip. It's kind of like a tropical retreat hidden inside a neon jungle.

dFh5SVbe93H7d5JqLS3ALQ.text: I'm an old fart who likes visiting casinos and crowds on my own terms... I dont wear straw cowboy hats with dyed goose feathers, jorts, and aviator glasses indoors at 8 am. I dont like paying $75 per person to go to a buffet and wait in line and then watch people go ape shit like my boston terrier pup does when I give him some pieces of hot dog. So you get the idea re: my demographic...I'm not 20 years old and in Vegas for some cray-cray partay.   If you like a very nice, low key atmosphere, a reasonable buffet with fresh ingredients and a very competent, friendly staff, go to Verandah for brunch or lunch. We did not try dinner here but were very pleased with lunch and brunch here while we were at the four seasons. When in Vegas at the hotel again we wouldnt hesitate to go back and enjoy this high quality, focusing-well-on-the-details-without-being-ridiculously-over-the-top restaurant.

vBtljunc6BbJ4vyQhH-sCw.text: Breakfast menu offered when lunch was being served...LOVE that!  Our breakfast was delicious, coffee excellent, great service.  The stewed tomatoes were fresh tasting and nice citrusy/vinegary follow.  There was a buffet, but we didn't try it.  Must be where you get the build your own donuts.  Sign me up!

photos.caption: Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Close up of a great sandwich
Photo of Veranda - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs Benedict and breakfast focaccia

5iWqCglBbBUr2AxZDAdOJg.text: Now this is what brunch is supposed to be.... omelet stations...hot and cold food stations.....doughnut station (yes doughnuts!!!) I called at 10:30am to see if they could fit in 4 adults and 2 children at 11am, the staff gladly welcomed us down...in fact by the time we drove down to the Four Seasons, my table was already set in a little corner outside (it was a gorgeous day). The food and service was amazing!!! I will be back.....my only suggestion is bottomless mimosas (they only offered bottomless bloody marys). Nice job Four Seasons....money well spent.

JASM12H45mGeOvwtnsOqag.text: When choosing a brunch buffet spot do you go for quality or quantity ? In Vegas I feel like I should get both - a huge buffet with insanely tasty items. How hard can it be, right? Their brunch buffet is tiny - think your standard nice hotel breakfast buffet in any other city. The quality is great, but in my mind not great enough to make up for the lack of options. The donuts are fab (I served these at my wedding!) and the other highlight for me was the beautiful cups of fresh fruit. They were tiny, but it's a buffet - so sue me if I can eat 4 baby cups of berries :)   I've also been for breakfast (a la carte) and dinner. The setting is beautiful by the pool, but the service is hit or miss. Great martinis, great food in general but nothing "special". The food here is hardly inventive, gourmet, or interesting but it's solid - and that should count for something !   In summary, I prefer the breakfast a la carte to the tiny buffet. The dinner here is great - far better than Charlie Palmer next door.

vHP78AeudbmqwiWD88pENw.text: Love, love, love this spot. Sitting outside under the subtle (a word not usually associated with Vegas) lighting and quiet, elegant ambiance I felt like I'd stumbled upon a secret oasis.   The service is amazing. The drinks delicious. You wouldn't know you were on the strip! This is the real deal, which in a city known for faking it, isn't easy to find.   I plan to be a regular during my short stay here.
